text: Ice cream is delicious, I am quite picky and not much has compared to my favorite place back home yet, but bobtail is pretty darn close. The summer peach they currently have for seasonal is delicious, I've gone back for it twice already. (The person who wrote about asking for a milkshake in the other reviews with it probably should've just tried it and not get in a big stink.) the staff is usually pretty friendly, younger kids mostly whenever I go in, probably summer or first jobs so you probably shouldn't have such an attitude about it, we've all been there-one guy misheard my order and immediately corrected it, not a big deal. Can't wait to go back this weekend!

Delicious ice cream. Very creamy and smooth ice cream. They don't have wild and crazy flavors like you'd expect somewhere like Jeni's, but it's solidly good ice cream and they offer a wide variety of great flavors. The single cone is enough ice cream for two people to share.

Located across the street from my favorite restaurant Crisp.  A sweet treat after a meaty dinner. They have your traditional flavors, such as Mint Chip & Strawberry, & also unique flavors, such as Jack Daniels ice cream & Cubby Crunch.  They also serve sundaes & shakes. Cubby Crunch:  They hooked it up with the scoop!  This flavor had all of my favorite things: toffee pieces, Oreos, mmm!

What a pathetic business. I'm giving it two stars simply because the ice cream was decent. However the staff was utterly miserable, unpleasant, and openly hostile to customers. When someone asks "Do you think the summer peach ice cream would make a good milkshake," you don't respond with "Listen sir I don't know; I don't like milkshakes."  To top it off after waiting 15 minutes we had to ask for a refund for my mother-in-law's banana split because they didn't have the plastic lengthwise cups long enough to hold the banana split itself. You don't have banana splits on your menu if you don't have bowls to serve them in.  Again, pathetic business. Next time I'll head up to Gerry's in Andersonville or lickety-split in Edgewater, where at this time of the night the business is trifold and they still manage to provide service with a smile on their faces and with cups to hold their ice cream in.

This place was hyped up for no reason. It looked slightly dirty to me too. I was really interested in coming here but the ice creams were like mixed together which is a huge no for someone with allergies and it's not somewhere I would come again.

Came here again almost 8 years later to the date. Primarily to take a pic of my Son in the same spot where I snapped one of him 8 years ago. But of course, we had to get some ice cream which was still memorable and fantastic!   #love

A great place to drop in for some homemade local ice cream.  They offer some unique local flavors that you'll just need to sample and order depending on your likes.  I loved the cubby crunch , sea salt caramel, and peanut butter chocolate crunch. A constant line of people , but it moves quickly ‼

Cute retro-esc ice cream shop on the corner of Wellington and Broadway. Easy to walk to. Parking might be tricky. I had the peanut butter chip ice cream (peanut butter ice cream with chocolate chips). Very good especially on a hot day. They also have milkshakes, smoothies, ice cream lattes, and coffee.  A few seats inside to cool off.  Definitely a must to try!

I read about this place being great and decided to try it out. I came in to see a lot of employees on their phones. One girl offered to help while the others stood around. A young man with platform shoes, who I presume is the manager, looked very greasy and did not want to offer help. He didn't even bother to address the employees who weren't working and walked right out. The employees were disinterested and the ice cream was mediocre. The only thing saving this shop from a one-star rating is its vintage charm.

I have only tried one flavor so far, and it was the Cubby Crunch. I loved it and can't wait to go back to try more. The vibe in there is great, slightly old fashioned with classic and unique flavors. Absolutely must go here when you are in Lakeview East for dinner!

This is a cool shop with a bit of a vintage feel. There's plenty of seating indoors and outdoors. They have a special going on Thursdays for a deal on smoothies and milkshakes. The smoothie and milkshake selection confused me a little but I'm not picky so I just got a strawberry milkshake. My friend got a cookies and cream milkshake with whipped cream on top. The music was very lively music and enhanced the atmosphere. We stayed and played connect four for a long time and enjoyed it.

One of my favorite local ice cream shops :) I like the old-timey atmosphere and decoration.  Their best and signature ice cream is Cubby Crunch (crushed m&ms, pretzels, sprinkles, oreos, toffee crunch). Sounds like a huge amalgam / could be strange, but just ask for a sample. I normally don't like those things in ice cream, but I love Cubby Crunch! They are very good at creative ice creams, like this.  The only reason I knock them 1 star is because (1) they don't have very simple/basic flavors that knock your socks off (so if you want just an amazing vanilla or strawberry ice cream, you will have to go elsewhere), and (2) not enough seating.

Bobtail is AMAZING. Coming from someone who was raised on Rainbow Cone and who scooped at Plush Horse for almost a decade, this is high praise indeed. I highly recommend the Cubby Crunch, Sea Salt Pretzel and White Chocolate Peanut Butter-Cup. I'm beyond excited to go back and sample several other flavors throughout the summer and beyond!!
Cute vintage ice cream parlor style store in lake view.  Enjoyed my espresso and vanilla chip waffle cone. Nice to go on a hot day to cool off.

Had a late night craving for some ice cream while in the area. We looked up the nearest shop and Bobtail was the 1st place to show, but they closed at midnight and it was around 11:30 when we looked them up. I hate being that person that comes in late to any establishment that's about to close. But the employees were very welcoming and talked us through the menu. We sat right out front on the pink benches and ate our Banana Split and waffle cone with cookies and cream.. Great choice and the prices were fair.

The BEST ice cream in Chicago! Every time I go in, there is always a new flavor to try. I end up sampling quite a few flavors (oops!) and it's so hard to decide since they're all delicious. My personal favorite is the white chocolate peanut butter cup, but cubby crunch is also a great one along with pretty much all the others. Bobtail also has a great location- right near some cool restaurants and a few blocks from the lake!

Probably the most overrated ice cream spot in Chicago.  I ordered a two scoop with caramel which amounted to $6. The caramel was low quality and wasn't hot so it turned into cement at the bottom of the bowl. The quality of the ice cream just wasn't there. I would say it's on the level of Baskin & Robbin, without the selection and with terrible execution.

I used to go a lot and the staff was great. This last time though they really dropped the ball. They didn't greet us as we walked in because they were too busy talking. I ordered my ice cream and followed the guy behind the counter to pay. Suddenly this other guy trying to order an ice cream cake literally nudged me out of the way at the register. The staff member turned to him and started to help him before me which took a good 10 minutes. When he was finally done I had to ask him to pay because he had forgotten despite me standing off to the side. I should have just left without paying he would not have noticed. This place is pricey and there are a lot of new gelato/ice cream options these days, so I will not be back.
Ordered cubby crunch and butter pecan - both were good. Disappointed that there wasn't a wide variety, but we enjoyed what we had. Crowded on a hot Sunday afternoon, couldn't find a seat.

Yes, yesterday was hot, so naturally I stopped for ice cream- there was a line out the door for Bobtail, so I queued up til it was my turn, and it was worth the wait! I arrived at around 5:30pm on Sunday, and they were already out of three tubs, so the only choice I had that was non-chocolate was peach. It was Amazing! Real peaches, real cream....I took so much time lapping it up that it started to melt down my hand :) What made it even better was the almond slivered chocolate dipped waffle cone. Delish! I bought a prepackaged lemon-Poppyseed cookie for my mom but I tried it and found it bland. The tartness of lemon was not there. I learned Bobtail sells locally baked brownies, so I tried the Raspberry Fudge. Delightful and Rich, the triangle was just large enough to enjoy without being overloaded. I actually only had one bite, my four year old son devoured the rest :) Bobtail offers cones, shakes, malts, coffins (I see it and it's staying), treats.....and I want to try them all!  Plus, after five check-ins, $free$ item!

Holey moley I had read an article on Chicago's best ice cream spots and bookmarked this one right away. Later that night, I was in the area with a friend so why not?? And wow we both fell in love. Not only is this a cute tiny old-school ice cream parlor type joint, but the ice cream is superb with awesome flavors!  DEFINITELY get the double scoop, mix three flavors within, and put it all in a chocolate sprinkled covered waffle cone. The merlot- my favorite flavor of this combo, chocolate peanut butter, and salted caramel chocolate pretzel were a delicious concoction together. Major stomach ache for the lactose intolerant after this much ice cream but so worth it. I can't wait to be back and try some more scrumptious flavors!

I really wanted to love Bobtail.  The store is adorable and the employees were very friendly.  Unfortunately the very cool sounding ice cream flavors were kind of uninspiring tasting.  Their wine ice cream didn't taste like wine.  The peanut butter chip tasted fine but not exceptionally so.  I felt like I could have bought the same thing at the grocery store.  If you skip this place you won't be missing much.
Vanilla bean ice cream with caramel.....yum yum yum.... this blows away my favorite McDonald's sundae...simple classic sinful
Salted caramel chocolate pretzel was amazingggggg. Wanted to try their pistachio but they ran out of it. Definitely going back again!
Great old-school ice cream parlor. They have a great milkshake (called the cream express) with shots of espresso in it. The mint chocolate chip ice cream is really good. It is well worth a visit.

WOW. I have to say this place has the most unique and interesting flavors I have seen in a while. I went there back in March when there was an unexpected warm day, and ordered their features flavor which was MERLOT ICE CREAM! the wine-lover in me could not have been happier. I will definitely be back a few times over the summer!
Love this place for ice cream. They have unique flavor and the service is awesome. A great place for a meet with friend. I would recommend people to come here. Get busy in the summer
The guy with the grey beanie was an awful server. Not friendly and poor customer service. To top it off, messed up our order. A double scoop sundae in two cups??? A sad day.

Stumbled upon this place after eating dinner in Lincoln Park and am glad that I did! I like that you can get 2 flavors in a "single" cup, which is what I did. I got half lemon sorbet and half blueberry pomegranate sorbet, which went great together. The blueberry pomegranate was super yummy. I'll probably come back if I'm in the neighborhood just for that flavor. The other "unique" flavors look interesting as well.

To be clear, I have been here many, many times.  Usually service and ice cream cannot be beat, but this rating is based on 1 visit about a month ago.  Without spilling all the beans, I feel the service on this particular date was poor.  I was treated with disrespect just because I asked what type of cone was "included" with the price.  More upsetting, I submitted a comment and review on their website and to the owners with absolutely no follow up. I took my business to another local establishment.  Again, other visits have been a 4 star rating. I feel I had to comment regarding this particular instance.
Super tasty cookies and cream. Long lines during the summer obviously. Staff is always friendly.

Love the ice cream - hate the service and cleanliness of the store.  I want to continue supporting this local business and it is a nice walk from my home; however, every time I walk away frustrated by the attitude exhibited by the workers.  If I was the owner I would start fresh and teach the crew how to keep the store clean and tidy.  Get it together Bobtail!
Strawberry is one of my fav still the best one wud be peach bt can't get it during winter ...

I am sooooooo happy to have found this place of pure deliciousness here in YELP!  Its in my neighborhood as well.  I was looking for a REALLY good ice cream cake for my daughters birthday.  I had them design a super cute Panda on it and it was cuter than I expected.  The cake itself was so damn good.  The staff that took my order was very friendly and helpful and the coffee is great!!  Thank you. Super stoked about this gem;-)

Heavily unsatisfied with the customer service that makes no eye contact or crack a smile. Associates seem irritated when presented with questions. They cracked under pressure and sized me up for no apparent reason. I just asked if they had more pie in the back of the house.
I love this place and the old time atmosphere. The ice cream is delicious and decadent the way it is supposed to be.. Old fashioned through and through which is a good thing in my book.

My favorite ice cream shop thus far in Chi. This ice cream changed what good is for me (which makes other ice cream eating less fun). My favorites are anything with peanut butter. The pumpkin in fall is reallllly rich too. Plus, the inside is super cute/classic ice cream shop vibe.

I'm far from a neat freak (I take the "green choice cleaning option at hotels and then don't bother cleaning )but there was a half empty water by the register and dirty floors and tables.   We were the only people there (2/5 around 2pm), though the lady behind the counter stood there and played with her phone.  Service was indifferent, and the ice cream was decent--not stellar but acceptable.
Amazing as always. Have a punch card for us frequent visitors. The staff are friendly and always make you feel welcome.
Got a double dish, it cost $5.40 total. The amount was less than half a pint. It was good, but I could've bought a whole pint of B&J's for less. Come on, wtf?

Grabbed an afternoon treat after a long day of walking Chicago. Home-made ice cream was great with a wide variety of flavors! Free samples given. No homemade waffle cones. Kid size was big enough for me! The white chocolate peanut butter cup was sweet and smooth!

I wanted so badly to like this place after great reviews from my friends and reading the reviews on this page. But honestly, this place seemed so overrated. Maybe I should have gotten one of their "unique" flavors? I opted for their Cookies and Cream and it tasted just like something I'd buy in the store. In addition, you know how sometimes water freezes on your ice cream and there's a little bit of an ice taste? Well a bit of my ice cream tasted like that.  I left very disappointed. In terms of the place itself, I felt like it could have been warmer. I actually left my jacket on while eating my ice cream. If you're selling ice cream in Chicago's freezing winter, a good tip would be to have the heat up in the place! Overall, "Meh. I've experienced better." So two stars it is.

Ugh, love bobtail ice cream. It can be pricey, but its definitely good. I always seem to miss out on any type of chocolate because they're always sold out by the time I get there, but everything else is good. I'd stay away from the cookies and cream milkshake, tho. Tastes more like thickened milk than a real cookies and cream shake. They do have a merlot wine ice cream treat which is pretty good. If you're a cone person, I recommend the waffle cone dipped in oreo crumbles! 3 stars instead of 4 because they're always sold out of the ice cream I want, despite trying to get it 4 or 5 times.

Bobtail delivers on both super delicious ice cream and charm.  I spent 4 years of my life living 2 blocks away and as a result Bobtail has earned a special place in my heart - and stomach.  One flavor in particular is my absolute fav - their Signature Sunset.  It is Merlot ice cream with chocolate chips.  It is perfect for all you winos out there or anyone who might enjoy just a slight hint of merlot with their ice cream.  If boozy treats are your thing you might also want to try their Lakeview Barhopper which is Dutch cocoa ice cream blended with Jack Daniels.  I have also had Guinness ice cream there before around St. Patrick's Day.  Besides their tasty and unique flavors, they also have a bookshelf of board games to enjoy.

I love this place! It's my favorite spot for ice cream in the summer and my favorite hot chocolate spot in the winter! My bf got a peppermint hot chocolate made with steamed peppermint ice cream. I got the turtle hot chocolate with butterscotch, pecans, and whipped cream. It was practically a warm milkshake and it was amazing!! Try this place out if you get the chance.

My toddler loved his mint chocolate chip ice cream in a waffle cone. He ate it all.  I highly enjoyed my chocolate chip cookie dough milkshake. A great product and great location. Looking forward to going back to try their hot chocolate when it finally cools down.

My company catered in Bobtail. The catering was well done and VERY high quality. I would have guessed that catered Ice Cream would be close to melted and I certainly wouldn't have expected the wonderful setup they did.  Everything was in individual servings with cups and lids. You had all of the toppings that you could add to it down the line. It was a very high quality presentation and well thought out. BEST OF ALL! The ice cream itself was literally the best I have ever had. We had Chocolate and Vanilla. You could tell the ingredients were not your standard run of the mill ingredients. I was happy to learn about this place because it's only about a 10 minute walk from my house! THANK YOU BOBTAIL!

The ice cream was uneventful & I left heavily dissatisfied.  The strawberry ice cream was icy, lacked flavor, & gave no resonance that it was from a homemade / non-commercialized re For the price point, id prefer a pint from the local super market. I will pick up Breyers before ever going back.

Sure it is more expensive than your average Baskin Robbins, but it is not Baskin Robbins, and it is worth it.  Beyond delicious.  Staff is very friendly.  They have board games free to use while you eat ice cream.  It is nice that they make it an "event" and don't rush you out.  The ice cream cake is amazing.  Always get compliments when the birthday cake is from Bobtail.  Really glad it's in the neighborhood.

Came to town to visit a friend and after she told me about the merlot flavored ice cream I demanded she take me to try it. It did not disappoint! They were very generous with a single scoop. Till next time my delicious boozy ice cream friend!

I love love love the merlot ice cream. It's delicious and unique. The cubby crunch is also good. The icecream isn't cheap, but it's the best in the area. The shop is cute too, kind of old fashioned. Super friendly staff.
Worst ice cream I've ever had. And that's including baskin Robbins and margies. And at $4.19 for one scoop in a plastic cup Id rather go to baskin. Can someone explain the high ratings to me?

Price is good for the portion and quality you get.  Fortunately one of the employees talked me down from a triple scoop on a hot day. I consider myself an ambitious consumer of ice cream, however disaster was barely averted even with the double scoop. Flavors are good, and am looking forward to trying one of their milkshakes with espresso shots.

They close in your face! Even if the yelp says they are open and you show up 30 mints before closure ... well you are out of luck. No problem, plenty of other places ready to take my $$ and sell me great ice cream.

An awesome neighborhood ice cream shop dangerously close to where I live. Their ice cream is delicious and their servings are huge. One scoop in a waffle cone is more like three. I love how it feels like I'm suddenly transported to the 1950's when I'm there. When there on a hot summer evening expect a line. They are also known for their ice cream sandwiches.

A little disappointed with the ice cream cookie sandwich. We saw an interview about this place and it looked amazing. We came here and the cookie sandwiches were already made, only strawberry, espresso and chocolate available. You cannot pick your own ice cream flavor and make your ice cream cookie sandwich. The cookie was hard and the ice cream okay. We also ordered a milkshake and that was good. Next time I'll order a scoop of ice cream and skip the cookie sandwich.

I used to live around the corner from Bobtail (very dangerous) and pop in for an ice cream occasionally. Decided to stop in while walking past on a Sunday afternoon. Salted caramel chocolate pretzel was as delicious as it sounds, but at nearly $6 for a one scoop waffle cone, it better be good.

Once upon a time a in the not too distant past there was an ice cream place by the name of Bobtail where you could find excellent ice cream, the right sized portions, and a staff that cared about customer service. The good news about Chicago is that a person has options.  After my recent visit to this ice cream stop I have decided not to return unless for some crazy reason I am in desperate need for ice cream and they are the only option. The recent evening I went there was mainly an all guy staff with one gal working. The gal had a positive friendly attitude where as the dudes there seemed to not really care so not friendly and not unfriendly either. Lack of a welcome and a smile in the world of ice cream is a rarity. The outdoor tables and chairs were put away early as it had been raining earlier even though the rain cleared  a couple of hours before close.  Portions have shrunk and prices have increased. There are so many excellent quality places that I no longer need to go here as the flavors have remained the same which is ok yet I have found on par or better with the local competition which also comes with a better value...size for money spent and a friendly welcome I need not return.  Au revoir to a former favorite.

There's nothing like an old-school ice cream Palor in the heart of a nice Chicago neighborhood. I went on date to this place and the ice cream was phenomenal! They have a very eclectic variety of ice cream and I always opt in to get a waffle cone just because you can't get ice cream without getting a waffle cone. I love this place and I would definitely go again. The staff was very friendly and they also provided free tastes and helped me decide what ice cream to get! If you want ice cream in Chicago, GO HERE!
Bobtail is your typical ice cream joint. Flavors are decent, but the win here is the large portion sizes.

Had the brownie sundae with vanilla ice cream, chocolate fudge, and peanuts. One word, AMAZING! The staff was super friendly and had great recommendations. I will definitely return for my next ice cream fix.

Walked into this small shop and was immediately greeted by the staff. They quickly helped by letting me taste a few flavors. A single is about 4 dollars. I ordered the Lakeview Barhopper, which is Dutch chocolate with a hint of Jack Daniels. It was quite tasty and I will be back to try other speciality flavors!

Cute family owned shop. The employees are super nice and helpful in explaining what some of the unique menu items are (for example, the ice cream latte - which turns out to be like a hot milkshake as opposed to an affogato like I thought). You can get 2 flavors in 1 single scoop, and that ended up being plenty for me.  Get the cappuchino yogurt!! Cinnamon is listed as one of the ingredients which sounds meh, but kicked it up several notches.

They serve really big portions. Few people from the group couldn't finish the double scoop cone. Ice cream is not as creamy as Id like it to be.  While the server was filling my cone a portion of the cone broke and she was going to give me a new cone. Which was nice of her. I told her it's ok I don't mind. Servers didn't seem to be happy and friendly I guess it was late maybe that's why no one smiled.
Had a cone of their merlot chocolate chip ice cream--SO GOOD. Pro tip: there is seating inside, but the music is loud

I really, truly, wanted to love you, Bobtail.  Perhaps my expectations were high. Perhaps it was the incredibly long line on a late Sunday afternoon where a woman kept hitting me with her out of control elbows in line. Perhaps it was the fact that I chose the wrong flavor for me. :( The salted caramel pretzel just left me wanting more... If I come back I will be trying a different flavor for sure.

We stopped by for dessert on a hot summer evening. The staff was friendly and offered us as many samples as we wanted to try. I ended up sticking with my favorites, a 1/2 scoop of mint chip and a 1/2 scoop of chocolate in a cake cone and the bf got both scoops cookies n cream in a sugar cone. The single scoop was more than enough for after dinner dessert. Luckily we had a 1/2 mile walk to the car, which gave us the perfect amount of time to stroll and eat our ice cream. The ice cream is good, but it's nothing amazing.
Just ok. Walk off the calories and make the trip to Jeni's on Southport instead.  You won't be disappointed.

My first review of Bobtail was a glowing 5 star review... And as you can tell from the number of check-ins I have here, I love their stuff! But this weekend I saw something kinda gross that may forever tarnish my opinion of this Lakeview staple. I was waiting in line and a girl in front of me ordered her ice cream and a shake. She then asked for the key to the bathroom while an employee was dishing her ice cream. Without skipping a beat the guy reaches around the wall for the key. In his one hand is her ice cream and in the other is the ice cream scoop. With a free finger he grabs the giant spatula that has a key dangling from it and hands it to her. She proceeds to go for the bathroom and he digs the scoop back into the freezer.  I've been in many public restrooms and they're seldom clean. Also there is a percentage of our population that doesn't wash their hands. So the fact that the employee didn't wash his hands after handling the bathroom key is kinda gross. The employees here also don't wear gloves when handling food so whatever nasty bacteria was on that key is now on his hands and on their food prep surfaces. What's worse is he asked to take my order next. I don't mean to make a fuss but food preparation safety should be one of the main concerns of any establishment. That key should be handed out by someone not preparing food at the very least or perhaps by the register. Will I come back? Perhaps. There are plenty of ice cream places along Broadway so I may think twice next time.

The worst ice cream I have had. I was thoroughly shocked by how bad my cookie dough ice cream was. The cookie dough was tasteless; it almost tasted like plastic. My dad had vanilla ice cream with caramel and nuts on it. We both threw out our ice creams after trying to eat for a few minutes.

The ice cream was amazing, I got the s'mores sundae and it was phenomenal.  However, horrible service, I was extremely disappointed.  I asked for a sundae and the guy serving me ice cream made a mistake and was in the process of making a shake.  The lady at the cash register went on rolling her eyes at me and so did my server.  For no reason, then as me and my partner were paying she ripped the card out of our hand and gave it back as if she was disgusted with us.  I never felt unwelcomed like this before especially at an ice cream parlor.  I get we went late and they probably wanted to end their shift already but that was extremely disrespectful.  Besides that the ice cream was enjoyable, just ate it a little frustrated.  However, I will go there again just maybe during the day when they are hopefully not working.

For such rave reviews and ratings I expect a lot. My experiences at bobtail have not been anything worth raving about. Nothing to criticize either until the other night when I visited 30 minutes before closing. We walked up at 10:25 and all the employees looked like they were closing up shop. Running around wiping down everything and putting the chairs up on the tables. I had to reverify that they closed at 11pm and not 10:30 as it appeared. I also checked their closing time prior to leaving figuring we would have a half hour to get our ice cream and enjoy there. Nope. I already felt hated for ordering ice cream WHILE THEY WERE STILL OPEN I wouldn't dare attempt to take a stool/chair down from the table to sit on it while they were probably going to being mopping the floor. We paid, and I even tipped cuz they made me feel so bad for interrupting their closing procedures. I figured we could sit outside instead.  But again, nope! The one girl actually ran out the door right after us and then ran in front of us to chain up all the chairs and tables outside. We had nowhere to enjoy our ice cream. Even with the business still set to remain open for another half hour. Awful business practice.

Love this place, they are open late and the lines are long, expect to wait avg 15 minutes. It's one of those places you go to on a summer night with the family. It's in a great area, so we always love just taking a walk and and grabbing some ice cream, and just hanging out

I may be biased from the circumstances in which I tried it, but I came in about a week ago on a SUPER hot day after walking around with a friend. I got the cookies and cream in a waffle cone and man it was amazing. A bit pricey (around $6) for the single but it's a huge portion. I didn't end up eating lunch that day because I got too full.

One of my favorite ice cream finds in the city. Total neighborhood spot that imbibes the vibe of Lincoln park into all of its unique flavors. While others prefer the cubby bear or wine flavor, I love my cappuccino yogurt in the summers and the hot cocoa in the winter. A great date spot, hangout, walk your dog or stop in and pick up to go. A definite go-to!
Signature Sunset - my all time fav from bobtail ice cream!  When we used to live in the neighborhood, we came here almost on a weekly basis. If you're in Lakeview, you have to try it :)
Good ice cream.  Can not go wrong with their Chocolate or their Daley Addiction (vanilla).

After bragging to a friend how good Margie's is, he told me I should also give Bobtail a try. The ice cream selection was somewhat limited, I got the mint chocolate and a coffee one. The ice cream was pretty good, you could tell it was homemade. The service wasn't great, when you go into a old fashioned ice-cream joint like that, you'd expect friendly people. The oreo cone was good, worth a try. If you are nearby worth a try if you are in the mood for homemade ice-cream

I pass by this place all the time and finally got to try it. However, I personally don't think the ice cream they served here lived up to the hype. I got summer peach flavor, but the ice cream melt pretty fast (maybe because it's homemade?) Anyway, it's really sweet and creamy, but nothing special nor impressive. I still love Jeni's or blackdog gelato better.
Soooo good!  This is the perfect after dinner snack stop.  Lots of choices and always pretty busy.  Take a little detour and stop by.  It'll probably be the best part of your evening!

Who hires those kids? Lazy, not friendly and making mistakes. I frequent there too often and it is a joke. One time they gave me the wrong flavor while I was paying, another time they overcharged me, then refused to make a pint since it was out from the fridge. If I owned that business, I'd fire all of them! All of this in a span of 2 weeks!

I love the ice cream here, especially since it's been so warm these couple days! I've tried several flavors -- the cubby crunch, signature sunset, summer peach, and the mango sorbet. They were all really good, so I can't really pick a favorite... but I guess mango would be the one I liked least, considering it's a bit on the sweeter side, and it cannot go on a cone since it's a sorbet (the cone is the best part of the ice cream though). The only downside is that it's a little pricy, and the sizes seem to be a little inconsistent. A single scoop was pretty large, so I got a kids size the second time. It was still quite large, so I decided to get a kid's scoop again the next time around, but the girl gave me an extremely meager scoop that time. If the kids scoop is supposed to be the size of the meager scoop that girl gave me, then I will probably just stick to getting singles in the future. The price difference doesn't justify such a large difference in size.

I had not anticipated a stop here, but since I was in the area, why not get a shake? I was just going to get a scoop of pistachio with almonds, but they sold out, as they had a busy weekend. They're getting ready to make more today, so I might have to stop back tomorrow. They make some incredible looking ice cream sandwiches. Check out their episode on Chicago's Best TV YouTube link below... youtu.be/Bb0CHuoMF78

I always grab something sweet after dinner so I Yelped (surprise!) some ice cream and Bobtail came up.  I got the cappuccino crunch & a flavor that was on the chalk board that I'm assuming isn't part of the normal menu so I can't remember the flavor.  The one scoop is quite large. My photo is a half scoop of each flavor. But, for the price you're paying it should be that large.  The ice cream is pretty basic. I sampled some of the speciality flavors & they didn't really have me thinking, "damn that's good." You really can't mess up ice cream in my opinion, but nothing worth raving about. I wouldn't go out of my way, but if I'm around the area and want some ice cream? Suuure.
Ice cream is good, but not great. Overpriced for the size of scoop. Also extremely grumpy employees. Convenient, but there is much better ice cream in the city

You don't see old time ice cream shops like this much any more. I love froyo as much as the next person, but ice cream in a cone is just the perfect warm weather treat. They have lots of flavors that all sounded good but I went with the cubby crunch in a waffle cone. We sat outside and ate our ice cream like a group of kids with smiles on our faces.

My girlfriend lives in Lakeview so after we eat a meal, we usually come here for some ice cream. This place is very quaint and their small scoops are two scoops so that definitely makes us happy as ice-cream-lovers :D They have an assortment of flavors. My girlfriend always gets the Crubby Crunch. Its become her personal go-to. I usually get the Salted Caramel or my all-time favorite flavor in Cookies N Cream. Go for any of those!! Overall, the workers are really nice and  I'm definitely going to keep coming here!

Pretty good basic ice cream, nothing super special. I sampled the merlot dark chocolate (you can def taste the merlot) and the dailey addiction (simple, delicious). Went with the cubby crunch (so much happening!) and peanut butter chocolate chip (too overwhelmingly peanut butter for me) with hot fudge. The Hot Fudge was no good, tasted like it came out of a jar. Overall it was good, but nothing all that mind blowing. The tastes were okay, but nothing i would go out of my way to return for. The place/atmosphere is small and nothing special either.

Often times, I find it hard to really like an ice cream place (i mean REALLY LIKE). There just isn't anything unique that sets them apart from one another. Why would I go this place over another place?! For me, the atmosphere of a place doesn't matter that much. What does matter, is the food.  Unfortunately, while I liked the ice cream that I had at Bobtail's, it wasn't something I couldn't get anywhere else. I would come here if I was in the area and wanted some dessert, but I wouldn't drive out of my way to this place. It's not that this place isn't good - it is good - but it just isn't that much better than its competition.

Love Bobtail ice cream! Is it very creamy and delicious and made locally. They rotate the flavors so there are always new ones to try.  The store has a fair amount of tables for you to sit and enjoy your ice cream and even provides games for you to play. When the weather is nice there are tables and benches outside as well.

Delicious ice cream and great price for the quality and quantity! The space itself is very inviting and the variety of flavors makes it so hard to choose! I ended up with the Cubby Crunch and the Salted Caramel with Pecans after the staff member recommended them to me. I made the right choice to trust him!  Both of the flavors weren't too overly sweet and both had a yummy crunch to them with the Oreo bits in the Cubby Crunch and the toffee bits in the Salted Caramel. The ice cream was so creamy and paired well with the waffle cone.  I will be back to try the other flavors!

This is a quintessential old fashioned ice cream parlor. The ice cream is pretty good, but not outstanding. The staff is a friendly batch of hipsters. The low review is mainly because the ice cream is not amazing enough to make up for a positively gross bathroom. I hope reviews like this help the place improve this, then 4 stars!
I love bobtail ice cream!! My favorite is the cubby crunch, but everything is delicious. Perfect outdoor seating when the weather is nice.

Creamiest, most fantastic ice cream ever. And the fact that it's local makes it so much sweeter (pun intended). My favorite is Cookies and Cream. BORING YOU SAY? Try it before you judge. My boyfriend loves the Lakeview Barhopper (chocolate based with a hint of bourbon). Really cute place to grab some delish ice cream, hang out, or sit at the porch outside (in the summer months). Love it!
Great ice cream, awesome coffee, fun atmosphere! They have board games for customers who may just wanna chill and hang out, I am all about the Monopoly! Staff super friendly and accommodating.

I had their pumpkin ice cream and it was awesome.  My mom decided to go with her go-to flavor strawberry.  We had it on a sugar waffle and it was quite enjoyable.  I would have given this place a full 5 stars but someone at this establishment needs to wipe down the tables and surrounding areas throughout the day.  There were dried up ice creams stuck to counters, tables, and it sort of made me enjoy it somewhat less.

I've definitely had better ice cream than I had Saturday night at Bobtail.  I tried the Specialty flavor of White Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup - which should have been exactly what it sounded like.  However, it tasted like vanilla ice cream with about 3 or 4 small chunks of peanut butter cup.  I did not taste the White Chocolate at all - and the peanut butter cups were barely mixed in. My husband tried the "Cubby Crunch" of vanilla ice cream with sprinkles and oreo chunks.  It was fine (much better than mine!), but I feel that Baskin Robbins or DQ is so much better.  Heck - even the grocery store ice cream is better.  I wouldn't waste my money on this ice cream place.

Found this on Yelp after looking for something sweet after dining across street at crisp. I saw everyone post about crunchy cubby was curious. The place is quiet and cozy alittle dark but expected for Lakeview area. The staff was extremely helpful and enthusiastic about having me try their ice creams flavors being a newbie. I decided to go w my two favorites peanut butter chocolate chip and crunch cubby very rich and delicious. Something different and many people in for a sweet treat scattered on Thursday evening.

After grabbing dinner in Lakeview, my friend and I decided to drop by this cute little ice cream shop for dessert. What's also great about Bobtail's is that the shop is open until 10 or 11 pm most days for when you're craving something sweet a little later at night. I was pretty full from dinner, so I opted for a child's cup of the white chocolate peanut butter cup. When I first saw the cup, I was a little disappointed. Be warned, a child's cup is TINY. I paid $3.75 for essentially 2/3 of a scoop, which is pretty sad. Get a bigger size for a better bang out of your buck... Now, onto the ice cream itself!! Bobtail does not mess around. The ice cream is SUPER dense (even more so than your typical ben and jerrys!), and very creamy. I loved the flavor- concentrated and not too sweet. There were plenty of mini peanut butter cups in my scoop, which was great. My friend got a pistachio scoop, which also tasted yummy. There were pistachio pieces sprinkled throughout her cup too!  Bobtail is your classic old school ice cream parlor. It reminds me a lot of the ones that I went to during the summer as a young kid. Doesn't hurt that I saw people playing connect 4 in the corner, either! Can't wait to come back in the spring or summer!!

This review will be short and sweet.... I've been to Bobtail a number of times and I'll continue to go back because of the variety of ice cream flavors they have (that actually taste good) and the awesome workers they employ.

It was National Peanut Butter Day the other day.  So, for desert, we came to Bobtail for their selection of peanut butter ice creams.  And they actually have more than one!  My wife had a single of the peanut butter chip ice cream - peanut butter ice cream with chocolate chips.  And she topped it with peanut butter sauce.  Have I mentioned that she likes peanut butter?  I asked for peanut butter chip but with chocolate sauce on top.  However, I got chocolate ice cream with peanut butter sauce.  Okay, I can kind of understand how that got mixed up, so I ate it.  It had peanut butter on it so it at least fulfilled the criteria for the food of the day theme.  The most important thing, though, was the taste.  Awesome!!  Smooth, creamy, packed with flavor and not too sweet.  Good stuff.  The staff was very nice and efficient as well, even with the little slip up on my order.  I knock them down a star mostly for the price, but a bit for the order mix up.  Anyway, when I'm throwing calories and my already high cholesterol to the wind, I'll be back, especially for some of their other very yummy-sounding flavors!!

One of the best ice cream places of Chicago. Bobtail always mixes up its flavors and always really unique options (Merlot ice cream?). Great place to go in the summer/warmer times, as there is outdoor seating and a little patio.

Loved their ice cream, so creamy and just sweet enough for my taste buds! I played it safe by getting a single scoop of their mint choc chip flavor in a sugar cone. The server gave us 2 big scoops (which I guess is standard for a "single" scoop), which was great for me and le bf to share. No long line, good service, overall, I got my ice cream fix and was a happy camper :) Will come back and try some other interesting flavors that they offer, such as the Lakeview Barhopper, featuring Jack Daniels!
Ice cream in the winter is the best -- especially if it's from Bobtail!  Favorite Flavor: Peanut butter chip :] Get it in the waffle cone  &remember to ask for a stamp card!
The signature sunset (merlot and chocolate chip ice cream) is my favorite! Love it

I went back. I admit it, I was wrong about this place and had a one-time bad experience. This time the workers were nice and they let us sample flavors without telling us we had too much. The Cubbie crunch is the best flavor in my opinion followed by cookies and cream. I wish they had more flavors though. They also have plenty of other options which tons of people come here for... such as coffee, shakes etc.  Something I really like is they load you up when you get a double scoop in a waffle cone. HUGE portions! I felt like I got three huge scoops and that will for sure keep me coming back here. Well, it does cost $5, so I guess they try to make it worth your money.  There is seating inside and outside. There is a 15 min standing zone right outside if you want to quickly run in and grab some ice cream.  I highly suggest you check in five times to get the buy one get one free deal! It's worth it.

I got the chocolate  and pumpkin flavored ice cream. I was disappointed about the taste of both. The pumpkin one was so sweet and the chocolate one wasn't good at all- very light brown color with a little taste of cacao.

Went here after having dinner at Crisp. The ice cream itself was decent, and the shop was very cute, but was very small and crowded. Not only that, the cashier was not very friendly. The ice cream scoopers (there were two) were very friendly and helpful, and did not mind at all us wanting to try the different flavors. They didn't have a large selection of flavors. There was outdoor seating, which was nice since the inside had limited seating. They could use more of a variety on flavors and a larger selection.

Average. Maybe I ordered the wrong ice creams for myself and the kiddo. Went with standard flavours like cookies and cream and peanut butter chocolate chip. The chips were great but the ice cream not peanut butter flavoured. Boo. Next time I'll go for something unusual like the Lakeview Barhopper (chocolate bourbon).

A go-to for ice cream in lakeview!! The signature sunset is a must try, it's Merlot ice cream with chocolate chips. The staff and friendly and the portions are very large. They also have board games, we always play a game of Candyland when there

Very ordinary, nothing special. I've tried alot better places in Chicago this place is definitely not in the top tier. The price is about average. Not much of ice cream variety. I don't think I'll go there again

Everything here is so good. I made a stop here after hitting up Nando's Peri Peri and Crisp (gluttony at it's finest) The ice cream is so creamy and delicious. I sampled the pumpkin ice cream, peanut butter cup and some chubby crunch. The cubby crunch has oreo bits, toffee, and sprinkles. It's so good I'm going again this friday!

For someone who is on a diet, this place is hell. I've been watching what I've been eating lately but decided to have a cheat day with a friend and ended up swinging by this Ice cream place. What a mistake. Ended up getting a double scoop waffle cone with raspberry cheese cake and chubby crunch (?). I had to stop after the first scoop but if I had no inhibition I would have definitely killed it and some more. Definitely would go again - only after running 10 miles though.

I have been to several restaurants in Chicago that feature a Bobtail ice cream flavor on their dessert menu. After visiting Bobtail Ice Cream Company it definitely lives up to it's name.  Bobtail Ice Cream Company is a classic ice cream parlor that isn't few spacious but there always seem to be busy. Bobtail has a few tables inside but more seating outside. I wouldn't recommend bringing a large group of people if you plan to grab a seat at the ice cream parlor. All of the employees I interacted with were extremely friendly and willing to educate you on the various flavors that they have to offer. Bobtail offers the classic flavors but if you are going to travel all the way here you have to go big or go home and get a specialty flavor.  After trying all of the delicious flavors I landed on the Cubby Crunch in a chocolate dipped Oreo waffle cone. Cubby Crunch is a combination of vanilla ice cream, sprinkles, Oreo, chocolate chips, and toffee or heaven on a cone. For this place to be as popular as it is the prices aren't that ridiculously priced as well as the specialty waffle cones.  I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for something to combat your sweet tooth or the perfect item for a cheat meal!

I've been in here three times now... And it's just ok.  1. Brownie sundae ... The brownie was more like cake if that's your thing... I prefer like a gooey brownie. Also- the girl serving me saw someone she didn't like walk in and said "what the fuck is she doing here" well... I don't know but can you just finish making my sundae? K... Thanks. It was just okay 2. I got just a dish of white chocolate peanut butter cup ice cream.... Just okay, flavor was minimal and there was like four pb cups in the whole thing. 3. Me: Hi can I have a cookie sundae?      Guy: what flavor ice cream     Me: vanilla     Guy: that's it? Just vanilla? (With an attitude) What toppings?      Me: humm ... hot fudge      Guy: oh we're out of it       Me: perplexed look trying to understand an ice cream shop not having hot fudge      Guy: sometimes that happens! (again with an attitude)  Also the whole time I'm waiting in line he's touching his face talking to his coworker discussing what type of facial hair will look best with his man bun. Gross!  Btw the attitude and the poor work ethic, I just told him never mind and left. Aside from convenient location there's no real reason to come here.

Good ice cream! But, it's always a million degrees in there and they are always out of tons of flavors which is super annoying. And by the time I ask for one that they have in stock, I always get the impression that the employee is annoyed with me which I hate.
I love ice cream done right and for me this was Mehh.  I got a scoop of Cubby Bear and it was a delicious treat, but simply not earth shattering.  No hard feelings, great service and A for effort.

yum! The Honey graham, white chocolate peanut butter & salted caramel pretzel ice cream was pretty darn good I must say. The line was reallylong but moves fast. I'm docking a star because the staff that work there are REALLY in a rush and don't care much about helping you decide what to get or being patient with you as you try to pick the flavor of ice cream that you want. Instead they want to move through the line quickly and you end up feeling rushed. That being said- once you get your ice cream, you won't be disappointed! Definitely a must go to spot if you crave ice cream.

I LOVE this place! We just moved to Lincoln Park a few months ago, and have been trying a lot of ice cream places around the area. The workers here were phenomenal (shout out to the guy in the Red Hot Chili Peppers) and the ice cream is outstanding. I got the sprinkles waffle cone with cubby crunch and peanut butter chip, and it was delicious. We will definitely be making a trip back very soon!

LOVE LOVE LOVE. Living a block away from this place is dangerous. Don't let anyone else tell you there's a better place to get ice cream in Chicago. My favorite thing to get is the mint chocolate chip in an Oreo cone. No, it's not the cheapest but I'd rather pay for ice cream that's worth it! Friendly atmosphere, too with board games and comfy seating.

I adore this place. It's the first ice cream place I went to when I moved to Lakeview and it's pretty much the only one I ever go to.  I went there for the first time because I had a Giftie for it and tried the S'mores Shake...Oh my god. The best shake I have EVER tried, I get it almost once a week, it's so good. I tried their cubby crunch ice cream the other day and wow is it great. This place is fantastic.
I ordered Cubby Crunch in an Oreo waffle cone. IT WAS AMAZING!!! Best ice cream I have ever had. I love this place and cannot wait to go back again and again!!
Caramel salted ice cream is fabulous!!!  So rich and creamy!  Everyone is so nice there, too.

Espresso ice cream on a sugar cone - very sweet. I know people question me when I say an ice cream joint is too sweet because isn't ice cream suppose to be sweet? Well yes and no. There's the sugary type of sweet and there's the sweet where you can eat so many more scoops and not feel like you just consumed all that sugar. It's called the hidden taste of sugar.

Perfect atmosphere and amazing ice cream! The shop itself has a charming, old-fashioned feel. As for the ice cream, it tastes homemade (because it is homemade). I ordered a scoop of the Cappuccino Crunch Yogurt, which has flavors of cinnamon and coffee mixed with chocolate flakes. Coffee ice cream and Cinnamon ice cream are two of my favorite kinds of ice cream and Bobtail brilliantly blended them together! I also recommend the Peanut Butter Chip -- very creamy with dark chocolate chips speckled throughout.

Everyone in my family I swear started yelling at me when I said I've never tried Bob tail ice cream! I tried it out and my first like about the place was there a line on a Tuesday night, usually a good indicator that this place is awesome. The second like of this place was the menu, great variety of options. I ended up trying the salted Carmel pretzel ice cream in a waffle cone. It was funny because when I asked the girl behind the counter for that she happily smiled and said oo yeah that's a great one. Sure enough it was hands down one of the best salted Carmel combo Ice creams I have tried. I can gladly say I will be here again when I am in the mood for some great ice cream and highly recommend this place to anyone.

Bobtail was a perfect piece of a perfect day of hanging out in Lakeview.  The sweet treats Bobtail had to offer made for a perfect course after some Seoul sassiness with the Joanne W over at Crisp.  I like ice cream, but don't like the mess factor especially when it's a warm sunny day.  So I went with a favorite flavor profile of mine--the Creamsicle--and decided to drink my calories. The Creamsicle float is made with craft orange soda and their premium home-made vanilla bean ice cream. It's creamy and refreshing and citrus-y.   I did try one of their signature flavors--the signature sunset--Merlot ice cream with dark chocolate chips.  I did like it, it's full-bodied, something I could only handle little bits of, not a whole scoop.  So other than their premium ice cream and other flavors, they offer sundaes, floats, shakes and icy coffee drinks. Something for everyone! The space is definitely old-timey.  Some inside seating, but a nice wide bench and patio tables outside. Worth future visits!

This place is jammin and always has a line out the door at night. Came here in a Saturday night. They have amazing flavors that do not disappoint! Salted caramel pretzel is so good, and the group I was said their strawberry milkshake was amazing, cookies n cream and coffee with choc sprinkles. Can't wait to go back...and they have coffee drinks so will be back to try those as well!

One day while I was sitting and enjoy some seoul sassy wings at Crisp, I saw someone stroll in with a couple of shakes from Bobtail Ice Cream. I was instantly jealous. I had never been, but had heard good things. If I had not had plans right after dinner, I would have strolled on over...  Fast forward to a couple of weeks ago. I had a wing-date at Crisp with my fellow Crisp-lover, Aimee M. Actually it was a movie date that we strategically set at Century so that we could get our Crisp fix and dessert action at Bobtail after. We are crafty like that. So we strolled on over and indulged our inner child with ice cream floats!  I  had the root beer float, which is made with Mug root beer. I think it's hard to screw up a root beer float, but having the right ingredients is key. Mug root beer is a solid choice and the ice cream is deliciously creamy. I did sample the peanut butter chip - which was very tasty - but I had just stuffed myself full of chicken wings and decided a root beer float was more my speed.  You can also get ice cream coffee drinks which I was wavering between during the ordering process. They all sounded awesome. I see Bobtail becoming a regular stop when I'm in the neighborhood....just what my waistline needs!

After working out beer calories and getting majorly sweaty with a lakefront bike ride, my sweet tooth was hankering for something tasty. We saw the line outside Bobtail and decided to join in. Normally, I'm not a fan of waiting in line...I'm really that impatient...but on a hot day like this past Saturday, ice cream can be worth the wait. And Bobtail was certainly worth it! While the line was long (out the door), the people of Bobtail are efficient and got the line moving. I decided to go with a single scoop of Cherry Vanilla, and my friend went with the White Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup. We both really enjoyed ours, though as my friend pointed out, they were kinda skimpy with the peanut butter cups in his. I think he only got like two. Overall, generous portions for a single scoop. It was the perfect amount. Any more would have been overload, any less, I would say "not worth it". But it is!!! If you're in the area, stop by Bobtail!

Other than the staff who sometimes seem a bit irritated/tired this place is great!  All of the ice cream flavors rock but the peanut butter chip is my favorite.  Ordered a Bobby joe this time with chocolate ice cream-- way more tasty than anything from a coffee shop.  It can get a bit busy inside but don't worry there are benches outside too.

Wow, really awesome! I tried the cookies and cream and it was delicious. I know my friends love the cubby crunch and cookie dough so I would also recommend these flavors, but I'm sure all the flavors are delicious. They also give you huge samples which was awesome! Great service and a good place to go to after a meal :)
Best ice cream: 1. bobtails peach ice cream 2. haagen daz rum raisin 3. firecracker popsicles their peach ice cream is THAT good
Crunchy bob and raspberry cheesecake lived up to the hype. They are patient with people requesting multiple samples and the outdoor seating was nice for our group of 6.

Awesome ice cream and varied choices, just a bit small inside and sticky floors to eat there? Otherwise, Will definitely come back to this nice quaint ice cream shop.  Beware of street parking. Can definitely be difficult to find one if you're not from the.area.  Glad that I chose the pistachio ice cream, if you love pistachio ice cream, you definitely need to give it a go.
Loved the cubby crunch!!!! Sooo delicious and the staff here are so amazing and friendly. Would definitely come here again if I'm in the area.

I came here twice. Shakes were great the first time. Second time, not so great. Customer service was mediocre both times.  The second time I came here I ordered a salted caramel chocolate pretzel shake and added a banana to it. I also ordered a chai shake for a friend. I'm not sure if they somehow dropped the whipped cream on the side of the plastic cover but it looked very sloppy, which was the least of my concerns. The milkshake ended up to be this very watery, possibly vanilla(?) flavor with no sign of the salted caramel chocolate pretzel. It tasted more like a sweetened milk than vanilla. The banana was there though. The chai shake was fine but come on. I was in a hurry to deliver the chai shake to a friend, and once I was far from bobtail I realized they had messed up my shake. I couldn't even go back because I had asked for a receipt but the cashier accidentally did not print a receipt or somehow exited out before she could print me one. Quite disappointed with this experience as I had traveled quite a bit (I don't live in the area) and paid $12 for two milkshakes, one of which quite frankly sucked.  One of the employees who was there both times I visited was rude as last time and the only one who was friendly and enjoyable was one in glasses.

This is the cutest little ice cream shop. It gets great reviews and being an ice cream addict, I needed to try it. I was sadly disappointed. Nothing unique or exceptional. I had the Cherry Vanilla on a cone. I did not look at it in the case, just at the list on the wall. It was made with maraschino cherries. Are maraschino's real cherries? They seem overly sweet and artificially colored. I like the real thing, actual from the tree cherries. I was going to try the peach ice cream, but they did not have any, but I suspect it is made with canned peaches. Sorry Bobtail, but you had me, then you lost me.

A little over- rated. It is a nice place, the people that work there are really friendly and the service is great. But the  ice cream was generally just fine, nothing great or really interesting or super delicious. It was just basic and decent tasting ice cream. Nothing really spectacular. Better than a chain, but no as good as some of the really good places and parlors. When you go into these types of places you want something that's a little better than your normal ice cream -- and it just is not. If in the area and want ice cream its a nice little place and the ice cream is okay. I've never had bad ice cream really, so it is hard to mess up. But nothing great.
This place is one of my go-to places for some good ice cream and a cute little local ice cream shop. They make their ice cream in house and it's delicious. The crew is very hipster.

Delicious ice cream, candies and sweets counter, nostalgic and welcoming.  What more can you ask for? Do note that that "Single" cone is a whopping gigantic double-scoop.  If you're looking for a more reasonable portion, be sure to order the Junior!
They have the best pistachio in town here!! Hands down. I don't know why but I love it so much more than any other pistachio ice cream.

Bobtail Ice Cream is a must do in the neighborhood. It shoots for the nostalgia factor, which doesn't really impress or negatively influence me. It is clean and family oriented, so bring the kids and sit back and enjoy the music (mainly classic rock and pop tunes). They serve quality ice cream, and do it with a friendly smile. This is also a great date spot, so make it part of your special night out.

5 stars for taste, location, service, friendly staff, and value. Yes I paid $3+ for a scoop, not too bad considering it is located in the busy street of Broadway in Lincoln Park. This place is nestled in a busy street of local restaurants and other shops.  Great tasting ice cream for sure! There's no 2,000 flavors but honestly, will you have all 2,000 flavors? No, you have your favorites! I tried the salted caramel chocolate pretzels. It had the salted caramel taste and pieces of chocolate pretzels. Delish!  I will most definitely come back to try their other creations. Plus after 4 check ins, you get a sweet treat!  Enjoy!

Since, I live in the neighborhood I had to try this place I walk by daily. Boy, am I glad I tried this place. This must be a hidden gem and I want to tell all about how I love going to this ice cream place.  The flavors are not usually your typical boring chocolate, vanilla and strawberry flavors. Right now they have coconut, chocolate salted caramel pretzel and peanut butter with chocolate chip. For those of you that do like the classic flavors it does keep a few classic flavors.  The ice cream taste homemade and the workers are friendly and fun. I highly suggest anyone to stop by and try Bobtail's ice cream or even there shakes. YUM!! Also, for there cookies and cream ice cream they actually but chunks of Oreo cookies in the ice cream right in the store. If they doesn't sell you, I don't know what would.

Good cream, Nice old school feel. Super crowded on a warm Saturday, and then the employee with the pink and purple hair allowed her friend to cut the line and not pay in front of a large crowd of people.

I have been a frequent customer of Bobtail and rave about it to my friends. However, I decided to use the groupon worth $12 towards my purchase.       First, the girl working behind the counter only applied $6 off my purchase (good thing I asked for the receipt). Second, I immediately talked to the other person working behind the counter and he kindly offered to refund the entire purchase. I was appreciative of his accommodation, but I still have yet to receive any refund for my purchase.       I'm not one to fret over a few dollars, but my issue here is a matter of principle and ethics. I hope others have not had issues with their groupon being fully redeemed.

Love the ice cream here. I've been here twice so far but definitely plan on coming more often now that it's finally (hopefully) warming up in Chicago. The portion sizes are huge with good prices and I love the variety that they have in flavors and other things like shakes, etc. I've had the salted caramel pecan and my friend stands by the cubby crunch.

***Bobtail is a popular ice cream parlor that features old-fashioned ice cream; it is definitely more exciting and satisfying than other old-fashioned ice cream parlors in the city like Baskin-Robbins; it does struggle to compete with the city's and country's best ice cream though*** Bobtail is a Chicago institution.  It is a classic and old-fashioned ice cream parlor and you know it as soon as you walk in.  There is a high booth, lots of kitchen machines that seem to be from another era and vintage signs, menus and such on the walls that illustrate this ice cream parlor's past (as well as how low prices were back in the day). With all the new gourmet, artisan and organic ice cream parlors out there like Jeni's (in Chicago as well as other cities), Sweet Rose Creamery (in Brentwood, California) and Bi-Rite Creamery (in San Francisco), it is hard to expect that Bobtail can deliver a similarly excellent and special experience. Bobtail though does not feel too dated or too mainstream like a Baskin-Robbins.  They even feature a few interesting flavors like merlot ice cream blended with dark chocolate or a Dutch chocolate ice cream mixed with Jack Daniel's.  I tried both flavors and liked them, but I also felt that the ice cream did not measure up to some of the great ice cream parlors now available in most major U.S. cities. The merlot ice cream had a very unique flavor.  It was sweet, but the wine flavor was still very noticeable.  It tasted like a port ice cream with the combination of sweetness and a red wine flavor.  The merlot flavor blended nicely with the dark chocolate flecks in the ice cream. The Jack's Daniel flavor in the Dutch chocolate with Jack Daniel's was not as noticeable, but there was definitely a little bit of a burn and bitterness.  The contribution of the Jack Daniel's was most noticeable in how it really brought out the chocolate flavor.  Though this was not a dark chocolate ice cream, the chocolate flavor was surprisingly pronounced. The ice cream had a consistency similar to Baskin-Robbins.  It was not too icy, but it was definitely more firm than the gourmet ice creams now being sold in major U.S. cities.  The ice cream also lacked the richness and density of other great ice creams I have had. Service was friendly and quick. Prices were reasonable.  Bobtail's ice cream was noticeably less expensive than those gourmet ice cream parlors. Bobtail is a satisfying stop for ice cream.  It definitely stands out when compared to its mainstream competition like Baskin-Robbins; Bobtail features ice cream that is both more delicious as well as less icy than what you will find at a Baskin-Robbins.  Still, Bobtail struggles to compete with the country's best ice cream parlors (like Jeni's, which is also located in Chicago).  If you just want a good old-fashioned ice cream cone though, Bobtail should meet your needs. I am not sure what the parking situation is.  Bobtail is located a good distance from the heart of the city so you might be able to find parking around here.

I enjoyed my peanut butter chocolate chip ice cream. I wouldn't say this place is doing anything special but I am not sure it is claiming to do so either. I would go again, but I would also try out another exciting place Chicago has to offer.
Love the mint chip and the white chocolate brownie

Always tasty. Always friendly. The favors are creative - merlo chocolate chip is very good. They also have Guinness chocolate and a Jack Daniels ice cream if you prefer other alcohol centric flavors. I love the salted Carmel pretzel. Great malts and shakes too!

This was an amazing gem to discover in the Lakeview area. The staff is never less than friendly and playful and the flavors offered here are amazing. The Cubby Crunch is phenomenal and if you're looking for a nice ice cream treat, this is the place to go. Even in winter.
They got fire ice cream, a nice friendly relaxed atmosphere with great employees. What more can you ask for? Oh yea they have half price shakes on Tuesday & Thursday's
Like everything else on broadway - boring.  Go venture off and find yourself some gems. Decent ice cream nothing super original or unique

bobtail is good, but I'm not sure it's worth the headache - ice cream headache that is! Lol. I took the entire fam to this location and it certainly was no 'Rocky Road' but instead our visit was a 'Rainbow Sherbert' of flavors! When we went to order, the staff was so friendly and it was clear they didn't have a 'chocolate chip' on their shoulder! lol. They even let me dangle my 4 year old son into the cooler and scoop out of ice cream! I mean talk about an 'eggsperience'! So, my boy was a total natural and was able to scoop all the sweet stuff without leaving a single 'Moose Track', lol, that's my boy! After getting Bryce outta the cooler, we got to taste our ice cream - and let me tell you - we all just about 'cookies and creamed' our pants.  The ice cream was so freakin good, it was making me sing all 'Cookie Dough' Re - Me! lol  The only reason I gave this place a four star review instead of five, is because we all ate our frozen cream so fast that we each had a headache for like an hour and a half. Totally worth it though.

My fiancé and I have been loyal patrons to this place for ever now! The place is cozy and has a good stock of board games if you want to spend a quiet afternoon here. Their ice creams are the best ever! And the portion sizes are just huge!!! Well given that we go there all the time, the Flanders keep rotating, but every now and then they come up with something new and awesome. In summers we are there 3-4 times a week and even in the peak of winter we end up here every week to get our fix. The ice cream cakes, the sundaes and the milkshakes are all A+. All my friends in town or out of towners have had to make a stop here if they visit me ;) it's funny but true that when we were thinking of moving proximity from bobtails was high up on our criteria for a new place!!  It was high time I wrote a review for this place.  Love bobtails!!!

Such a cute place! The staff was super nice and the warm drinks we got were yummy. I love how they even added cinnamon sticks to the hot spiced cider. What a nice touch! I definitely need to go back again and try one of their ice cream creations. I really like how they play oldies music to give it that 1950's/soda-pop-shop feel. And I absolutely LOVE how they have board games available for use. So cute! I just wish that the place was a little bit bigger to fit more seats and tables in there. But this is a really sweet spot! I will definitely be coming back.

Had a craving for ice cream last night and am thrilled to now be living across the street from Bobtail. Even in 20 degree weather it takes me less than 60 seconds to get there!  The two girls working there couldn't have been more patient with me as I labored between which flavor to pick, giving me several samples. After much deliberation I went with the Cubby Crunch topped with whipped cream, it was delicious and very affordable. I'd highly recommend Bobtail to anyone in the neighborhood with a hankering for some delicious ice cream, I know I'll be back!

When I first walked in, I was really turned off by how dirty the place was and it smelled kind of nasty by the door. Their ice cream was really good, though. My sister, who lives in the area, swears by their ice cream.
Okay soooo Cubby Crunch is the best thing that ever happened to ice cream. Nothing else needs to be said.... TRY IT. NOW.
This little place has delicious ice cream. My favorite is the cubby crunch. I eat it so fast it doesn't have time to melt :)

Yummy homemade ice cream! The staff are really nice, too. My husband and I went to get ice cream after eating at Crisp one night. He tried the pumpkin (fall... *sigh*) and I picked cinnamon. He really loved the pumpkin, but I decided I didn't like the cinnamon-- it was too spicy! it tasted more like cinnamon gum than a sweet cinnamon dessert. When we asked, the manager was kind enough to let me have a scoop of the cookies and cream instead, no charge. And it was DELICIOUS. I recommend this ice cream shop on account of their owner's generosity-- and the sweet treats!

The people that worked there were SO nice! It was busy but the guy helping me took the time to point out his favorite items and let me try them. They have some really interesting flavors. I really enjoyed trying this one that had a Merlot flavor with dark chocolate chips but honestly the BEST ice cream for me was this flavor called Lakeshore Barhop! It tasted like chocolate with a little whiskey and it was awesome! This place is totally worth coming out to again!

Got a regular Bobby Joe (House coffee, espresso and ice cream blended)... I got it with Salted Carmel Pecan & Vanilla ice cream... Next time I will skip the vanilla and get it all SCP because I like a little more sweet blended coffees, the vanilla made it taste a little more bland. But otherwise I love it! My husband got a shake with Daley Addiction and it was the best shake ever! So much win in that cup! ;) Will be back! Oh and they let you sample the ice creams btw.

I've been here twice, and I'm not impressed. Most recently, my visit was pretty disappointing. The staff is so so (cashier seemed to not enjoy his job - I get it, but it's also not my problem as the customer), I literally received soup for a banana split as it was pretty hot in the place (they need to have some ac going because I do not enjoy melted splits before my first bite can even be taken), and the tables are not bussed or kept as clean as they could be (the fact that they are busy is no excuse). Overall, it doesn't seem very clean or kept up.... there was plenty of staff there that evening for none of the above to be a problem. I can do without this place.

A perfectly fine place to get ice cream if A, you want some kind of old-fashioned sunday-type-thing or a coffee-ice-cream-espresso concoction, or B, you don't feel comfortable pressuring your friends to go up the street to the superior Paciugo Gelato.

Their ice cream flavors run out pretty quick so get there earlier in the day or evening. I tried the merlot chocolate chip - delicious if you're a fan of wine. A very family and pet-friendly places. I've only been here once and there was a crowd, so it gets slightly chaotic at times but they eventually get to your order. Flavors: butter pecan and espresso were top-notch yums! I was hoping more from the Cappuccino yogurt but it was only subpar. Too light for an 'ice cream' and too creamy for a frozen yogurt type of deal. Is this even making sense? Well - also, by the time my friend and I got to the cashier and were about to pay, our ice creams were half-melted.

The secret here is that they'll make a milkshake out of ANY of their ice creams. This leads to concoctions like the salted caramel pecan peanut butter chocolate fudge shake, which is just as amazing as it sounds. The peanut butter chip ice cream is more chocolate than peanut butter, but that's my only complaint and we'll definitely be back!

Great local ice cream shop in Lakeview. My favorite is the Cubby Crunch ice cream that has a little bit of everything in it. They have a couple other really unique flavors like Merlot with chocolate chips and Jack Daniels and chocolate. Perfect spot on a  hot summer night in Chicago!

I would give this 5 stars but they ALWAYS run out of ice cream.. I mean its 5pm in the afternoon on a Saturday-- How could you possible be out of strawberry and Chocolate! I drive all the way from Lake In the Hills to get this ice cream and  3 times they were out of Strawberry and Mint Chocolate chip.. I need to find a place that is closer to me that is reliable.... I cream is the best I have every had, but they need to manage the making of there ice cream better....

Perfect neighborhood ice cream shop. The Dutch Chocolate is great. My girlfriend did not like the pistachio flavor--it seemed to be more like vanilla ice cream with pistachios rather than a true pistachio flavored ice cream. It's usually too hot to sit inside, the benches and seating outside is nice to take advantage of and great people watching!

Stumbled in here to wait for the rain to pass.  Had a scoop of peanut butter chip ice cream and a mint chip steamer.  What a pleasant surprise.  The ice cream was so flavorful!  Dare I say best we've had?  I love after 8 hot chocolate so the mint chip steamer was right up my ally on this rainy day.
Lakeview barhopper is my fav .. the ice cream hits the spot on a summer day and hot chocolate is perfec for a winter stroll

Really good coffee and ice cream (certainly better than Windy City sweets up the road). But usually disappointed by the staff (who never look like they want to be there) and the diversity of flavors (they were out of 5 flavors today).

It's humid out today and the sweet tooth kicked in. Since I live close to this place I decided to get some yummy ice cream. Like other reviews I did have to wait a little while and it is hot inside, but boy the smell of it all combined. I am horrible at making up my mind so i usually get two flavors in a cup with some sprinkles. I decided, as usual, to get cake batter flavor with brownies and sprinkles. There is actually chunks of cake in the ice cream!!!! OMG... I love half baked vanilla cake. I know gross, right!? but love it. Not everything can be perfect about a place. There will always be some kind of complaint. It's not cold enough, it's messy, it's  busy...well people can only can only do so much. Try not to be so harsh in judging....just enjoy.....!!!!

Love this place! Good for ice cream in the summer and a latte in the winter! The place is always busy with line out the door. Which is always a good sign when looking for a place to go. They don't have  many ice cream selection as other places like Cold Stone Creamer. I will recommend this place if you are looking for a basic ice cream flavors.

I have been to many ice cream shops that claims to have homemade cream. Hands down Bobtails have the best ice cream I have tasted in a long time. I sampled the white chocolate peanut butter chip because it was recommended to me but I was looking to get a shake. So I then I sampled the expresso cream and it was delicious and thought to myself what could go better with a coffee taste other than some rich chocolate ice cream in a shake. It was well worth the wait (line was extremely long and out the door) but it moved pretty quick. However in the summer time it's probably nearly impossible to sit inside because it's so hot and crowded. However I do recommend Bobtails and I will be a returning customer.

If you have a sweet tooth and live anywhere near Lakeview, Bobtail is a must. I would not plan to go here on a rainy day, because it's typically sweltering inside the store.
