Plan to eat outside or go for a walk after grabbing your scoop. I've had a multitude of flavors from Bobtail, but most recently tried their peach and it was fantastic. Incredibly summery and flavorful, I highly recommend if it's available. I think the best part of Bobtail is there original flavors. Two very unique ones are the Signature Sunset, which I suggest if you're in the mood for something that isn't super sweet. First of all, the ice cream is Merlot flavored, which sounds super weird. However, it isn't. It totally works with the dark chocolate chips, and I'm not sure how. The best original flavor at Bobtail is definitely the Lakeview Barhopper. Successfully combining two of my favorite things, chocolate and whiskey, this does not disappoint. Again, when you first hear the combination you're like "huh?" but it's delicious.  Overall, great local ice cream shop. Pricing is nothing out of the ordinary and, as I mentioned, eating outside is the way to go.

Very good inexpensive ice cream parlor. It had a long que outside, which made me curious to go in try one .. Pretty good decision after all .. I tried the lakeview barhopper and the signature sunset. Both were good flavors .. Bar hopper had a whisky flavor to it.. Yumm !!
I'm a serious fan -- the ice cream is excellent. Unfortunately, the place is in serious need of thorough cleaning.

It was quite busy, but there definitely wasn't adequate staff to scoop, and cashier, and keep the place clean (it was seriously filthy) when I was on my maiden voyage here.  The place was also roastingly hot... I like the cool comfort of a/c while I enjoy my ice cream so I can actually enjoy it, rather than feel like I better hurry up before I have melted ice cream coursing down my arm! The ice cream was pretty damn good though (salted caramel butter pecan, nom nom nom), and the guy who made my cone & rang me up was appreciative and complimentary when I threw a buck in the tip jar. Hire some more peeps, clean this place (!) and turn on the a/c and I would so frequent this spot.

Cubby crunch ice cream was delicious! One of my newest favorites. I gave it 4 stars because I didn't find the atmosphere or the workers to be welcoming and fun. Other than that, great ice cream. Loved the benches outside.

If it wasn't for the cubby crunch this rating would be a 1.  First of all there is such a lack of consistency depending on which employee takes your order.  I mean I'm paying 4 dollars for a single scoop of icecream I expect a single scoop.  Second some of the employees are just so unfriendly it boggles my mind.  It wouldn't kill you to smile.  The worst is when the employees have there own convos while handling your order/cashing you out.  You really shouldn't be talking about certain things while customers are present.
Their Signature Sunset is my all time favorite ice cream. It is not overwhelming with wine flavor but just enough. Add in the dark chocolate chips and you havr perfection.

even you got one scoop on a cone it's way too much so -I got a kid cup -was enough for me- they're generous with the portions. yaay! plus you can find lots of different ice cream flavor combinations. I got cappuccino and yogurt ice cream and turned out that it had also cinnamon.

What a disappointment. Have frequented before and it was great. Tonight both of the ice creams I had were flavorless and not worth the money charged. The seats and tables were so grubby we didn't even want to take a seat. Think it may be a while before we try it again.

I don't get the hype for this place. It seems dirty. It's confusing in what they have and how much they charge. Overpriced but that's not a surprise. I went last Friday night at 8:30: chocolate was finished, mint chip was finished. The guy wanted to sell me some Jack Daniels chocolate for my 5 year old boy...I had a peach flavor that seemed butter and had no flavor whatsoever. Still there was a good line behind me. I don't understand why but maybe it's my mistake.

"What kind of cake do you want, and don't say 'none', because that's not an option." "Ice cream." Birthdays are serious business to me, so when an ice cream cake was requested, I turned to yelp to help me find a business that wasn't Baskin Robbins or Cold Stone where an ice cream cake could be acquired.  Enter Bobtail.  There are two options available, a 6" cake or a 9" cake.  I opted for the 9", as I felt it would leave room for the writing as well as alllllll of the candles I needed to cram on there without it looking crowded.  Someone was turning old, so that was a lot of candles. Having never been to Bobtail and wanting the cake to be a surprise, I asked one of the employees for their suggestion as to what flavors would go well together.  Actually, that's a lie.  All the reviews mentioned this Cubby Crunch, so I knew that was going in the inside.  I needed help with whether the cake itself should be chocolate or vanilla and what the outside flavor should be.  Chocolate cake with peanut butter ice cream on the outside it was!  I don't like to pat myself on the back very often (oh who am I kidding, yes I do), but I think the flavors went great together.   I don't know if you can request the writing to be in a certain color.  From what I remember, the cake in the store had the same color scheme on top as the one I ordered, so blue and red might be your only options.  I didn't think to ask, but that's something to keep in mind if that's important.  Take the cake out right before serving.  I was told to run a knife under hot water to help with slicing and that seemed to work pretty well.  If you're picking this cake up in the summer, make sure you go straight home.  I had a tear-filled meltdown once I got home and noticed the cake had started melting, all because I made a "quick stop".  I'm pretty sure they might even deliver, which is something to consider if you're like me and convince yourself a quick stop on the way home makes more sense than going back out.  Lesson learned when an ice cream cake is on the line. I'd definitely order a cake from here again though!  You're going to pay more than you would at Baskin Robbins, but birthdays are special and it's worth it.

My friend told me about this place during lunch so we decided to go over and check it out.  This place gets 2 stars because of the awesome vintage decor and carnival/folk music playing!  And another star for the amazing Sundae my friend and I had! I chose a hot cookie sundae with peanut butter ice cream and marshmallow!!! However 3 stars is all this place will get because of the staffing. Not only did we not get a good welcome when we were the only 2 customers but a worker had went outside for a minute so the other 2 decided to say how he was annoying and wanted to fire him- all loud and in front of us while we ordered! And sorry- but coming from a cosmetologist I can tell you your blue eyebrows are a joke! How unprofessional to have employees talk badly about one another in the open.

Descriptive phrase: corner ice cream shoppe. Bobtail is a nice little spot for ice cream. It's got a neat, classic decor inside. Their vanilla was creamy in the large root beer float. It was paired with Barq's root beer (not Mug like they said), which I'm not a huge fan of, but it was still refreshing.

On my way to the gym the other day, I came across Bobtail Ice Cream Company. Naturally, to fuel up for my beach bod workout, I figured I needed some ice cream because of the...calcium...Yes, let's go with that. I love the atmosphere of this store. It's vintage, eclectic, and has a homey neighborhood feel to it. I got my favorite flavor mint chocolate chip and was not disappointed. The mint ice cream was refreshing, velvety, and dense. Ice creams that use fillers and artificial ingredients don't have that kind of rich mouth-feel, but this one definitely did. What I also loved were the chunky chocolate chips. They came in a bunch of different sizes, large and small, and were delicious to munch on.  Go here next time whether you need a pre-gym workout snack or a yummy treat from the summer heat! Tip: Ask to get a scoop in a cup with a cone on top! That way, you can enjoy the ice cream + cone without the mess! :)

The ice cream is nothing to write home about, their customer service is sub-standard, and the store is always filthy.   I've been here three times and each time the people behind the counter have had rotten attitudes which takes away from an enjoyable experience.  The last experience was the last time I will step foot in their store.   The blonde girl was slamming cups around behind the counter and was so rude I left while she was making my order. I even wrote the owners of Bobtail about it and of course they didn't have the courtesy to write me back,  which clearly shows they really don't care about their patrons.
Signature Sunset, aka Merlot dark chocolate chip. DONE! That's all you need to know! And a kid scoop is usually PLENTY!!! on a sugar cone. Now Done!

Oh Bobtail Ice Cream, I just cannot resist your delicious creaminess and fantastic flavors. As a pastry cook, I'm constantly surrounded by delicious desserts, so much so that I'm rarely tempted by sweets outside of the work place. But there's nothing better than a huge "scoop" (aka 2 scoops) of Bobtail Ice Cream on a hot and muggy day (side note: I hate Chicago weather).  Bobtail is one of those old fashioned ice cream parlors that makes you nostalgic for the idealistic version of the old days. You know, those cute ice-cream-parlor-and-drive-in-movie days. Sure, you can get a scoop or two of ice cream here, but you can also get root beer floats, crazy sundaes, espresso ice cream drinks, and so many more. The menu just goes on and on and on. I, personally, always ogle over all the crazy combos I could get and then, in a panic, end up ordering a simple single scoop. I then immediately regret the decision because those single scoops are SO BIG; all I needed was a kid scoop. I think I'd need an army behind me to finish a sundae.  So next time you're suffering in Chicago's sauna-like heat, come by Bobtail. You might get lucky and come on a day when they're offering 2 scoops for the price of 1 on their featured ice cream. There's actually a posted schedule for this awesome "event", so call in and ask, or stop by to see the schedule.
On my last visit I enjoyed the s'more sundae, but today I am loving the turtle sundae with crunchy pecans and caramel.

I absolutely LOVE coming to Bobtail, it being a favorite stop of ours after any meal at one of the many restaurants in the vicinity. It feels like a 50's soda shop, with 90's pop playing and old posters adorning the walls. One of my favorites is the Signature Sunset - merlot icecream with dark chocolate chips. Their shakes are decadent, but their ice cream latte is to die for! I had a Toasty Turtle steamer and was delighted at the amount of pecans at the bottom of the cup! It is a really nice spot in summer, with outdoor seating.

I live down the street from Bobtail's. I have had an ice cream every week here for the past 3 years, come winter come summer. When I nearly moved to Uptown, this was one of my reasons to stay behind. Yes, I know I have a problem but Bobtail's is just so good! I love all their flavors, but the s'more sensation has gotta be the best. They have really cool 90's music playing if you go late night.

I live a door down from this place and it has become the death of my diet..... Interior is dated but the ice cream (cubby crunch is my fave) is delish and there's a tall guy who works there who is the friendliest ever! Their seasonal flavors are always really fun and often sold out so if you get a chance, always give them a try! Once you've had Bobtail you'll understand why there are always people eating their Icecream with with mittens on in the dead of winter.

Bobtail has a cool little corner location.  You walk in and get a sort of 50's throwback nostalgic feel.   There is a decent amount of flavors to choose from and then you have the option of cones or cups to choose from.   It does tend to get a little crowded where the ice cream is scooped which can be a little irritating at times.   I had a single scoop of the white chocolate and PB cup and it was delicious.  I would suggest giving it a try if your in the neighborhood especially for kids or on a date.

One of the best IC parlors in the city. The only drawback is the parking situation. But, if you are busing it or walking, it's a must. The ice creams mesh old style favorites with creative new, the fat and sugar content are well matched, and the hot fudge is really up there. The staff do a great job under within a small challenging format but it is worth the wait and hassle. This is my 6th time there, love the place.

My friend had introduced me to this ice cream shop as a 'must-do' and I'm glad I tried it out but I've had better ice cream else wear. I got the most popular one which at the end turned my lips and tongue blue but i like trying different flavors. All the flavors were written in a chalkboard style board and the two people behind the counter were nice.  They had a few high table chairs which me and my 3 friends sat on. We all liked our ice cream but the flavors weren't rich, the toppings were minced (I like them chunky) and the favorite part: the waffle cone. My waffle cone had broke while they were preparing my ice cream so they transferred it to a a new one so I just had waffle cone bits on my ice cream. The prices are great in comparision to those ice cream and frozen yogurt chains in which your ice cream is weighed. So I guess for that, it's worth it.  I came once, tried it, but don't plan on returning.

Bobtail Ice Cream, what more can I say?  Old school ice cream parlor feel.  Offers tasty, unique ice cream flavors like Merlot wine and seasonal flavors like Guinness for St. Patty's and Pumpkin during Fall. Great Tuesday and Thursday deals on $3 shakes and malts. Definitely worth a visit!!

Great ice-cream, but they staff seems to have stopped caring. The seating area is consistently dirty and the area outside is a mess. Tonight someone spilled a milkshake outside the door. When I told the person at the cash register, he just shrugged it off. They used to set out their own garbage can, but now they just let the public garbage can overflow.
Cute little ice cream shop. There is outside seating- hard to find parking in area. Lots of options- almost too many ( the menu is huge). Frozen yogurt was delicious!

I tried Bobtail in the summer... and thought it was just okay. I had the cubby crunch and tried a few other flavors, but just wasn't impressed. The ice cream overall seemed too sugary... and I love sugar and my sweets, but it just wasn't smooth enough.  I do like all the different cone options though!! Sticking with Black Dog Gelato instead!

We had a lovely dinner at the nearby Stella's Diner, complete with a dessert of pumpkin spice cake with cream cheese frosting, served with vanilla ice cream on top. But that didn't stop us from getting ice cream at Bobtail lol! :p Scoop each of cubby crunch & strawberry ($4.70ish after tax) - 4.5 stars. Creamy, good amount of toffee chunks. It was moderately busy, no available seating inside, so we took a bench outside. My favorite ice cream shop in Chicago is still Jeni's Splendid, but I look forward to visiting Bobtail again x)

I had a root beer float. it was ok. ice cream isn't as good as Margie's. the clerk behind the counter was very loud and annoying. he was talking to another employee in the back.... i dont know if i'd go here again.
Best ice cream in the city! They also have $3 milk shakes on Tuesday and Thursdays. They also have board games in the store and they open up a patio on the side of the building

I am always pleasantly surprised by Bobtail. The ice cream favors are excellent, of course, but this place is reasonably priced as well. (I guess I'm in full-on suburban mode when I talk about how expensive the city is. Oh well.) I loved the Lakeview Barhopper, a rich chocolate with Jack Daniels. My very cute date had the Cubby Crunch with the complementary (free stuff! In the city! There I go again) whipped cream and cherry. That had a little too much going on for me.  The store itself is quite charming. Definitely a place to go!
I spend way too much time here. My shorts will not thank me in the coming months. Amazing ice cream, friendly staff, convenient location to me. Could I ask for anything more? (The answer is no.)

About a 2-2.5: After dinner, my friends and decided to stop by Bobtail to get some ice cream for dessert.  I had the Cubby Crunch, which was vanilla ice cream, sprinkles, oreo, chocolate chips, and toffee.  It was a solid-tasting ice cream, and I think the chocolate chips were actually dark chocolate.  One of my friends had a soft-serve in a cone that she didn't really enjoy, and the other friend had the chocolate chip cookie, that was actually tasty.  A little pricey, as a small cup was a little over $3.  I was glad that I tried this place out! +underwhelming ice cream

The merlot chocolate chip ice cream is DIVINE. A unique must-try (just ask for a taste!). Not much seating, but an absolutely charming little spot to grab dessert.  And if you are lucky enough to get a table, don't forget their smattering of board games.

decided to get something sweet after dinner and this ice cream place is a block away with a lot of good reviews.. so why not give it a try.. went in and we was the only people there.. probably because it was winter and its snowing outside haha.. anyways i walked up to the ice cream section and looked at the flavors.. couldn't decide so i asked a worker there on what would he recommend.. but he just said i don't know.. depends on what you like.. so i told him whats the best selling flavor here and i don't like minty flavors.. his responds was.. well there's alot of flavors that's not minty so which one you want...... i was just thinking to myself.. can he be anymore helpful... he didn't seem happy or friendly either..  i end up just picking the Daley Addiction which is vanilla ice cream with butter fudge swirl on a almond chocolate cone.. it was nothing special at all.. only thing i enjoyed was the almond chocolate cone.. i would not come back due to bad service and average ice cream...
"Red", the manager is the best! Made us fresh coffee and offered us samples of delicious ice cream. My favorite was the hibiscus. Great place to go anytime of year!
Great ice cream and coffee place near landmark theater, you get a lot of ice cream and the flavors are all good, and some really neat coffee varieties, a little pricy but definitely worth it

Bobtail is great! Go to Crisp for dinner and walk across the street to Bobtail. The servers are friendly and the price is reasonable! I got to sample the pistachio flavor (which was delicious and similar to the Ben & Jerry's pint pistachio pistachio flavor in the sense that there are whole pistachios in this ice cream) and it was tasty. I decided to try the Walnut fudge, however, since I'd never tried this combination anywhere else. I got it on an almond and chocolate waffle cone (yum!), single scoop, which is GIANT, by the way, for under 4$! The walnut fudge ice cream had lots of nuts and a rich,creamy, rich chocolate flavor. The booths and high seats add to the appeal, and you can people watch from the window.
Awesome white chocolate pb crunch! Perfect neighborhood ice cream shop. Innovative flavors.

I adore this place!  I love coming here in the summer after a long bike ride with a friend.  I sit out on the benches and enjoy the lovely Chicago summer.  I love the peach flavor they have in the summer and the white chocolate peanut butter cup ice cream. The flavors are unique and I'm sure you'll find something new to try.  They give you large portions too and don't try and skimp out! The place is a adorable, inside and out, and reminds me of my small town ice cream shop.  Keep up the great work!  Love your establishment!

This cute ice cream shop is dangerously close to where I live. Definitely a Lakeview staple, and fully recommended. The signature sunset made with merlot is really amazing. The white chocolate peanut butter cup is also out of this world. I like that you can enjoy inside, or they have some seating outside too. They take credit cards, not just cash, which is convenient. And they have pints you can buy to take home with you. Sometimes the line looks long but it moves fast so don't let that deter you from getting some delicious ice cream.

They have awful service. I ordered a cake a week on Monday for a Friday pickup. When I arrived they had the order form but could not find the cake. FInally they called a manager who said the cake was never made. NEVER MADE. If there was a problem why didn't they call. Then they tried to sell me a pie that  they could put a name on. I special order a cake, in one of there special flavors which is the only reason I pay the outrageous price for a cake. Next time I am going to Dairy Queen. Bobtail service sucks!!

CALL FIRST!  We were really excited about dessert, but apparently they like closing nearly half an hour early, more than they like serving customers.  That's fine, we're heading to Lickity Split instead. (I appreciate their reaching out and offering an explanation.  I've not been back since, but I'll be happy to update this review the next time I'm in the area.)
Insanely good flavors. Pumpkin and salted caramel pumpkin were maybe the best ice cream flavors I have ever had. However it was pretty melted so that was a slight negative.

Bobtail is so cute! I brought my out-of-town friends here on a rainy day and we sat and chatted while enjoying our ice cream. My friends were most impressed by the wine-flavored ice cream, while I liked their seasonal pumpkin flavor the best! It was so rich and spicy. The shop has a cute parlor-esque feel, and the scoopers are attentive and friendly too. It's also right across the street from Crisp (an awesome Korean chicken place), so I recommend going there first, saving a liiiiiitle bit of room for ice cream, and moseying on over here for a sweet treat and a comfortable place to sit a digest for a bit.

I love this place! It is so cute and has every option you would want for ice cream or a shake, they will do any combination you can think of. They also have board games so you can hangout and play board games on a date or with whoever!

Many flavors to choose from and so many unique ice cream drink combinations to be had here. My girlfriend and I shared a double salted pecan caramel and pumpkin ice cream. The salted pecan caramel was a nice sweet and salty treat. The pumpkin was a must have for the fall season and was deliciously rich while well spiced. Here they serve a merlot ice cream that actually has a hint of wine at the end of each bite. I definitely haven't seen that before. Service was certainly not a problem here as the group I came with was welcomed with tons of samples before we made our orders. Not to mention the smiles that came with them! Will definitely make the trip again if I'm in the area.
Best peanut butter ice cream but it was so dirty my wife says we're never going back

Bobtail has some stiff competition when it comes to ice cream in Chicago. To be brutally honest, its good but nothing too special. Plus the price of essentially one scoop is very high. It may have a little variety, but in the end i don't think its worth it.  Good overall, just a bit too pricey in my book.
I've been 4 times in two days, enough said, this place is amazing. I love cubby crunch and their sundae!

While not a "premium" ice cream place, bobtail delivers fun ice cream flavors packed with fun ingredients. The cubby bear packs fun flavors and negates the need for any toppings. The Daley has full flavors that go well together. I had to "forget" where bobtail was when I lived closer so it wouldn't become my regular dinner

After spending 3 years of my life as the lead ice cream maker at a small shop in St. Paul (we threw down with Bobby Flay and won) I was excited to see what Bobtail had to offer.  Disappointment is the best way to explain the entire experience. Walking into a shop like this you would expect the customer to come first. My GF and I were second in line to a couple who waited for more than 5 minutes to even be acknowledged by the 3 employees working behind the counter.  Once they ordered each person seemed to act as if they were more of burden than anything. It was 8 O'clock on a Saturday night. Prime ice cream time. Finally it was our turn to order. I ordered a chocolate malt and my GF ordered a Cubby Crunch shake. 10 minutes later and after getting passed by 3 people behind us in line we had our treats. Total flop. My malt had an inch of malt powder sitting in the bottom. It reminded me of slurping up mud. Cubby Crunch (one of their signature flavors) ice cream is underwhelming. The neighborhood offers such better ice cream at Oberweis and Windy City Sweets. Don't waste your time on this let down.  I will never return.

If you have an ice cream craving and your in the neighborhood, Bobtail will satisfying your sweet tooth with it's various offerings that transcend the business-as-usual flavors at most ice cream shops. Be it boozy selections (beer, whiskey, and cabernet all make appearances) or childhood throwbacks (oreos, sprinkles, peanut butter cups) the mix-ins in the flavors will definitely deliver. The prices are reasonable and moving from the double to the triple scoop for an additional 70 recents is the way to get the most bang for your buck. Instead of each getting our own scoops, me and my wife split the triple and picked up a scoop of Cubby Crunch, White Chocolate Peanut Butter, and Cookie Dough. I didn't find the white chocolate all that white chocolate-y but that's probably because this is a flavor I'm keen on making at home and use legit, intense, white chocolate. Here, most of the flavor comes from the mix-ins rather than the ice cream base. Overall, it's a solid ice cream shop but one I'd go the extra mile to seek out.

Worst customer service ever. So bad that I was expecting the guy helping me to say he was kidding.  It all started because I had the groupon. I met some friends out front and was essentially treated like a pesant by a young flamboyant twit. I feel bad about giving less than two stars because the ice cream was actually really tasty. I hope the owners are reading this. You have THE worst customer service I have ever received in my entire life. I will NEVER come back.

Perfect for a summer night! I had a single scoop of the white chocolate peanut butter cup. It was perfectly sweet and nice and creamy in texture. They definitely don't skimp on portions - the single scoop was huge!  I can't wait to go back and try other flavors or some of the shakes/sundaes. Cute old-timey ice cream shop atmosphere and a great patio.
YUMMMM!  I had the white chocolate peanut butter cup ice cream in a waffle cone and it was soo good!! absolutely loved it and i will def. be going back here! I would highly recommend this place.

Bobtail is by far my favorite ice cream place in Chicago. Considering ice cream is my dessert of choice, that's saying a lot. I love everything about this place: the fact that they're open late, the cute and friendly waitstaff, not to mention the delicious dairy desserts! I discovered Bobtail in May (on Cinco de Mayo, actually), and I have gone back dozens of times.  If you're looking for great ice cream, look no further than Bobtail!

Nice little corner ice cream joint on the north side of Chicago. We were due to see a movie at the Century Centre Cinema a few blocks away and were an hour early, so we took a walk spelunking for ice cream. Found Bobtail on the corner of Wellington and Broadway in Lakeview. This store, founded in 2004, is the original effort from a group that was involved in a University of Chicago business plan contest ... and their product is based on recipes from a businessman who sold door-to-door back in the 1950s. Enough backstory. If you like ice cream you'll like this place. No frills operation in an old-fashioned ice cream palace. Has a neat blue and white striped awning on the front. A few stools and tables, a long counter with all the goodies behind. We started simple and had a small chocolate sundae (how can you go wrong) and a scoop of mint chocolate chip (ditto, and a good benchtest). Both were winners. The sundae was just the right size and with great chocolate syrup. The mint chip was fresh and full of flavor - it was not gummy how this ice cream can sometimes be at other places. All-in-all this was a great little find. They also sell coffee, espresso, etc. While the tables and chairs inside of the store could use a little rehabilitation, the absolute top-drawer and friendly service from the staff makes up for it. You are greeted when you hit the door and engaged in some friendly banter. Nice group of peeps. This is a neat little ice cream dive tucked away on Broadway after the split with Clark. You have to look for it - but give it a try.

It's really hard to give a ice cream place a bad review just since it is ice cream and everyone loves ice cream. That is...everyone who isn't lactose intolerant... Anyways, Bobtail has some delicious flavors and I've probably tried about 4 of them on several visits. The Cubby Crunch is by far my favorite at the moment. I say at the moment because they do every once in a while come out with a "featured flavor" that will run for a limited time. The ice cream itself is very light and doesn't taste like you are eating a cup full of sugar so that is a big plus in my book because it allows you to actually enjoy the individual flavors. My only complaint about this place is that it is kinda small and on some nights people are packed in there so tightly to get their ice cream fix you have to either wait in line or just come back another time. The only other way around this is to just grab a pre-packed  pint from the freezer in the back and eat it at home..... Definitely a awesome ice cream joint. Check it out if you are in the neighborhood!

I have walked by Bobtail a million times and finally stopped in Sunday night for dessert with some friends.  We all got the dipped waffle cones and were in heaven.  I almost wish I hadn't ever stopped because I already had to go back two days later.   cant.get.ice.cream.off.my .mind.  This time I got a float with expresso ice cream and cola, very delicous. Great service (they dont judge when you ask for extra gummy bears/candy/delicousness)! Great ice cream! Its nice to sit outside and chow down while people watching too!

This is all I have to say. The merlot chocolate chip ice cream is worth every single penny you might spend. The only thing I regret is not being able to get a bigger size because they ran out. I cry. The service could have been a bit more friendly and the place a little cleaner but I'm not really holding it against them.

Tues and thurs are half priced! First time I went on a Tuesday.   I didn't want to push my luck and ask for hot fudge and whip cream in my milkshake, as it was already such a good deal.  Just as this thought had echoed in my head, the server kindly offered exactly what I wanted much to my surprise.  Most places won't offer up anything unless asked to save money, but not this spot! Best ice cream in the city with stellar customer service to go along with it!

Most of their ice cream flavors are good.  Coconut is nice and smooth.  The Butter Pecan has lots of nuts.  Cubby Crunch is perfect for birthday parties.  It's great.  There is one flavor that I just Hate - Salted caramel ice cream.  It should be called Salt ice cream.  Way to much salt.

My aunt and uncle live within walking distance from Bobtail. My uncle, mom, cousin, and I came here last weekend when I was in town. There was a bit of a line, but the staff did a great job taking orders quickly. I had white chocolate with peanut butter, which a must have for white chocolate and peanut butter lovers. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in the Windy City!

First of all the ice cream is delicious.  It's a little spendy, but it's worth the convenience if you are in the neighborhood.  It's not worth going out of your way at these prices. Given the high prices and the propensity of people to care less cash these days, it helps they accept credit/debit cards. There's plenty else if you aren't up for ice cream.  They have an espresso machine and serve other treats as well. Staff is very friendly, competent, and quick.  Crowd is good.  The music drowns out any inane conversation that may annoy you.  They leave out free ice water and cups.  Don't see friendly gestures like that much.
Signature Sunset and Cubby Crunch are just mind blowing. It's as if Bobtail went into the depths of my mind and extracted flavors that would make me sit down and shut up. It's that wonderful.

So the line is long but it moves quickly. The ice cream is good but not worth the drive from the burbs. If I lived in the neighborhood, this would be my go-to. Try the peach ice cream...it was wonderful!

I'm a huge ice cream fan.  For some reason, I've struggled to find exceptional ice cream in Chicago.  Lots of gelato and froyo to be had, but not what I was craving this night.  Bobtail dishes up generous portions of classic and inventive flavors and feels like a neighborhood creamery should.

I had a terrible experience at this location. The employees are very rude and unfriendly. I would like a manager to contact me for the situation I had after emailing the  Managers and waiting for their response.

I had been to this little establishment before during a chocolate tour last summer but this time I took my kids. My son is a super fan of peanut butter but sadly they were out of their famous flavor :( However there was more to pick from and we enjoyed their merlot ice cream (wow) and cookies and cream and to make up for the missing flavor my son had vanilla with peanut butter sauce on a waffle cone. With all that said, super nice servers and great ice cream...we will be back! :)

Sad to say my review is going to be about the service that I received from this place. First of all my friend was completely skipped in line and the 2 workers started helping all the people behind us. When I asked our server (who should have asked if we were done ordering) tells us a rude way that his co worker will be the one to finally take our last order. So we waited then as my friend started speaking he rudely says " Can't hear you". After his remark my friend was a bit annoyed and answered loudly to make sure he could hear the order and the server had the gall to say he didn't like the tone we had, when at that time he had an attitude taking our order. Then he patronized us in front of other customers saying and making the situation very uncomfortable as we asked for the mangers number, which if the customer wants the managers number they should be able to speak with a manager to know exactly what kind of employees they have representing them.  We were denied a number and the servers just didn't help at all.  That same server kept yelling across the whole store when a phone number  should have been given and that would have been the end. All in all the ice cream experience should have been better and the server should take some lessons in customer service.

I love Bobtail. The staff is friendly, helpful and patient while you pick your perfect flavor. I love that they serve discounted milkshakes on Tuesday and Thursday, although they are so good that I don't mind paying full price the other days! I recently brought one of their ice cream pies to a dinner party and it was a hit! Everyone loved it, I highly recommend the mint chocolate chip one! Further, I was very impressed when i went one day and they were out of the flavor that I wanted. The man working immediately issued a free scoop card for my next visit! Such great people!

Bobtail makes me happy. Or I guess I should say Bobtail's ice cream makes me happy. Especially their peach ice cream, which is back for the summer. Mmmm...it is so good! Bobtail Ice Cream is a cute little ice cream shop that offers great ice cream, sundaes, floats, shakes, and pretty much everything else you want an ice cream shop to have. The have a variety of classic flavors (the coffee ice cream is amazing), signature flavors (their signature sunset is awesome - merlot ice cream loaded with dark chocolate chips), and seasonal flavors (I eagerly wait for summer all year because it means that peach ice cream is back).  Yes, the shop is tiny and kind of cramped, and you will probably have to wait in line, as everyone seems to love Bobtail, but trust me, the quality of the ice cream more than makes up for these minor inconveniences. Grab a cup or cone of your favorite flavor for a sweet treat, and don't forget a to grab a pint of ice cream to take home with you for later.

Can I just tell you for a second how much I love Bobtail Ice Cream?  The place is tiny, but it has that old fashioned soda fountain vibe going on, which I totally dig. Their ice cream is perfection, but I always, always go for the chocolate malt. I don't know what they do to it, but it is seriously delish.  You will have to wait in line, but trust me when I say you will not regret it if you do.

Really good ice cream in a cramped space. For the chocolate lovers you have to try the Lakeview Barhopper.  Its insanely good. It is a year round shop with hot coffee/ice cream and hot chocolate / ice cream combos, which is good.  Root beer floats looked good too.

One of my favorite ice cream shoppes in the city! Locally made and always delicious. My favorite flavor is the Cubby Crunch. Just be warned, this place gets crazy crowded in the summer months. I have seen lines out the door! If you are in the Lakeview area and looking for some awesome ice cream, it is tough to beat Bobtail!
Great ice cream parlor where you step back in time and enjoy a traditional root beer float or try a new flavor, like "gluttony". :)

Boy oh boy do I love Bobtail! I've surely had more Bobtail ice cream than I'd like to admit... But these guys sure know what they are doing! - Their ice cream is kept at THE perfect temperature, which makes for an always amazing consistency. Every scoop I've gotten here has been so delicately creamy! I reeeeally hate when you go to an ice cream place and the ice cream that they dish out is so rock hard and iced-over that the cup you're given is composed of quite the multitude of tiny, super-frozen, lame "scoops" of ice cream - making clear that the scooper really struggled in scraping your portion out from the mass. Anyhow, Bobtail ice cream always seems to come out in one clean swoop of decadence!  Not only does Bobtail have their technique down, but they also offer quite a delicious variety of flavors. Personally, I'm a big fan of the Lakeview Barhopper, which is made with a Dutch cocoa and blended with Jack Daniels - dark chocolaty goodness with a kick!   The workers in here are always very welcoming also and willing to give you samples!

Cute little shop in Lakeview who's milkshakes bring all the boys to the yard...and not just because it's Boystown Lakeview. Their ice cream is awesome!  All home made in house and buzzworthy flavors such as merlot and Jack Daniels. My personal favorite was the Cubby Crunch cause it had a little bit of everything your sweet tooth loves, but again everything I got to taste was pretty delicious.  Def a must if you're in this hood on a hot summer day.
My favorite ice cream place in Chicago. I love the peanut butter chip and cookies & cream, and the root beer floats are good as well.

Ice cream, can you ever screw it up? I'm not sure, but Bobtail owns it! Minus the long line (can you blame them?), this place is fantastic. Good ice cream with great service that's friendly. I couldn't decide what to get (so many good options), so I just told the guy to get me what he would eat. Came out with a caramel pecan scoop on a cone, and was happy. Great stop for some good treats. Atmosphere: 9/10 Service: 10/10 Food: 9/10
Great old time ice cream joint!  Can be slow with a line out the door but worth it!   Enjoy!
This some damn good ice cream and the prices are so right! I tried the salted caramel pecan, lakeview barhopper(merlot and chocolate!!!!!!!) and an ice cream sandwich. Lawdamercy!

Pretty good ice cream. I loved the LAVENDER AGAVE! The LAKEVIEW BARHOPPER (which was supposed to have bourbon in it, I think) was disappointing. It just tasted like rocky road to me without the nuts and marshmallows.

How anyone could give this place less than 5 stars absolutely baffles me. First and foremost: Tuesdays and Thursdays are half-price milkshake days.  How could you not?! Bobtail offers a solid mix of simple flavors and pretentious ones -- my favorite is the cookies and cream.  It's stellar.  A scoop of cookies and cream on a sugar cone makes for a happy Amy.  Or a cookies and cream milkshake when it's Tuesday/Thursday evening.  That being said, every flavor I've had has just been great. Yes, if you come here after about 8pm just about any day of the week you will wait in line.  And it may not move super fast but who cares, if gives you plenty of time to decide on a flavor so once you get up there you can get your treat quickly, pay, and get back outside into the summer night.

Love the decor of this place. Somewhat of a historical vibe of the mid 1900's grabbing a scoop of ice cream with your dad on a summer day.  I had the white chocolate peanutbutter cup milkshake was fricken AMAZING. And this was after I had a pretty big dinner so I was on the verge of being regretful of getting ice cream because (over indulgence)  of my dinner.  Would recommend to anyone that is not lactose intolerant!

I got a strawberry shake and loved it. I came here another time and got an ice cream cone with one scoop of strawberry and one scoop of cookies and cream.  I will note that the night I came here, a few of the workers acted as if they would rather be someplace else. I usually don't get that sort of attitude when I come here. Maybe it was because it was Saturday night? I wouldn't want to be serving ice cream on a Saturday night either, but if that's what YOU do, at least try and make the most out of it! Overall, I love this place! The ice cream here is on point.

Yummy, but I don't really think this place is worth the line in the summer? They have shake and smoothie specials on Tuesdays and Thursdays but they only had two people working on a beautiful warm night. So it took forever and that was kind of annoying. The regular size shake is 2.99 on special though, which is pretty good- it's a lot of ice cream! If you get a flavor with any pieces though (ie mint chocolate chip) all the pieces will be stuck at the bottom. They need bigger straws.

Came here last night for the first time after walking by it many times.  This place was impressive.  I tried the special "PB&J Time icecream in a waffle bowl with strawberries, grahahm cracker, whipped cream and a cherry.  Doesn't get any better than that!  It's pricey but well worth it.  My boyfriend had the cookies n cream shake with a banana.  He loved it.  I will def be back here for more sugary treats!

I wanted to like this place much more than I did.  It's not bad, but I was expecting the flavor of my lakeview bar crawler (or something to that effect) to come through instead of just sugar and it really didn't.  I'll give it another shot, but the guy at the counter didn't need to be so rude about giving me the bathroom key. "You gotta buy something first!" I pointed to my husband holding our ice cream, ready to pay.  Those extra 2 minutes he made me wait were a little uncalled for.

Came here on a groupon and ordered an enormous sundae to use up the value of it in addition to my friend ordering a shake. Yum. I don't live very close so coming here was a special occasion of sorts, but I could definitely see it becoming a weekly routine in the summer if I did live down the block, so my waistline will thank me. The Baskin Robbins next to my apartment never tempts me.  They service was friendly- they didn't skimp on the toppings, prices seemed reasonable, and the place was clean and cute to sit in or grab and go. If I'm taking a walk in the area on a summer day, I'll likely stop in.
Cubby bear crunch .. Best treat wether it's -7 out or 70
love love love this place. great ice cream, awesome staff. definitely a favorite on a sunny day.

A great, little, quaint ice cream shop that I visit every time I come to Chicago. The ice cream comes in interesting flavors and the staff is generally pretty helpful. the single dip in a waffle cone is really about 2 scoops so be mindful of that if you are just wanting a taste of something yummy versus an hour on the treadmill. I only gave it 4 stars because the seating area needs some drastic improvements. We had to clean off our own table, and the chairs literally rock with you as you sit in them and feel like you'll soon be sitting on the floor.
there is a reason why there is always a line out the door during the summer! I love the coffee (something?) ice cream.

There is a man who comes here at least once a week for the chocolate milkshake. He is a normal sized man, and I had just happened to ask him "hey, I'm from out of town... what's good here?", when of course he recommended the chocolate milkshake. Instead, I got a vanilla milkshake. It wasn't too bad.  The man turned out to be a doctor who was a midwest transplant. I told him that I worry sometimes that I love ice cream too much, and he said a milkshake once a week is okay for normal sized people (ha!). I'm glad I qualify as normal sized, but I still worry about having a heart attack at 30 due to all the ice cream I've consumed over the course of my lifetime. In any case, this is an adorable ice cream parlor that had some funny/cute children's drawings posted up on the wall. I might have contributed to Bobcat's art collection... shhhh  ;)

Yea, this place has INCREDIBLE ice cream.  I love how they have a bunch of staples as well as rotating cast of special flavors.  One of my favorite flavors that I tried was coffee ice cream with chocolate covered pretzels (if you just read and acted like you weren't impressed, please slap your self and reread that sentence). Lines can get crazy on warm nights in the summer but that's why I try and get all my ice cream eating done in the winter.

True story: a major factor in my most recent apartment search was the building's proximity to Bobtail. It is that good.   Everything about this store is charming and delicious.  The hours are great, especially in the summer - it's open way later than I would expect, but that's definitely appreciated.  And the ice cream! Oh my goodness the ice cream.  I love love love the white chocolate peanut butter cup - I get it almost every time.  Another flavor I've had that stood out to me was the Cubby Crunch - it was good, but it had almost too many fixin's for me to really enjoy it as a whole (I prefer to laser-focus on one aspect of my ice cream).  My boyfriend loves their banana splits, and the hot drinks (especially the Toasty Turtle) are really good.   TL;DR: Eat here. White chocolate peanut butter cup. Be prepared to substitute this ice cream for a meal.

We went on a pretty cold night with a hankering for some ice cream. Got a hot fudge sunday. The ice cream was amazing, hit the spot. My only beef with this place is how awkward the seating is. We sat in a booth and played a game while others started to infiltrate the seating area. When I got up I had to practice being a contortionist. I got over that fairly quickly, but the thing that irked me the most was the staff. They were soooo loud, we had a hard time enjoying ourselves. They weren't too welcoming to begin with. OH well, maybe we'll try it again some time.

A few of us came here after dinner to end the night on a sweet note. As sweet as it was, it was also guiltily filling. My brother had the waffle cone with two flavors: peanut butter chip and cookies & cream. The portion size was extremely generous. But he's a guy with high metabolism. He effortlessly devoured that scrumptious treat.  As for me, I had a waffle cone with sea salt caramel ice cream. The flavor was superb but I felt the texture was too creamy for my liking. The portion was overwhelming and I could barely finish it.  My friend also tried the raspberry Italian soda. She could only force herself to drink half of it because it tasted like cough syrup.  P.S. Bobtail is really, really tiny. Expect long lines and lengthy waits. And you will most likely have to eat standing or outside the parlor.

I received a letter of apology and a gift card in the mail this afternoon from Bobtail.  I really appreciate the gesture, and will forgive you, Bobtail. Your ice cream is delicious and I was very sad at the thought of having to find a new ice cream spot.

I must admit, this place disappointed me.  I'd seen it for a while... and when a friend and I finally tried it... the product was inferior and the service left something to be desired.  But, I imagine even "bad" ice cream is good when you're craving it.

Came here to indulge after eating way too much at Crisp across the street. It's a cute mom & pop style ice cream parlor that makes their own ice cream - and it's delicious.  I'm all about the Cubby Crunch - Vanilla ice cream, sprinkles, Oreo®, chocolate chips, and toffee. Tastes kinda like a crunchy birthday cake.  Oh and don't forget to get a stamp card at the register if you think you might become a regular!

Merlot chocolate chip, cubby crunch, and perfect pumpkin ice cream can be ordered from this delicious fountain shop.  The staff is always friendly, free cups of water when you are sweltering while waiting for your ice cream in the summer, and a loyalty punch card system.  When the ice cream craving calls, you can't beat bobtail!
We have been here twice. It is nothing special. The first time it wasn't overly clean either. Unfortunately, I think they are resting on their laurels a bit.

Words can not describe my affair with Bobtail's Peanut Butter Chocolate-Chip ice cream. Every time I allow myself the indulgence my world stops in time. I can never get enough of it! It is the best ice cream I have ever had! On top of great ice creams they have all kinds of fabulous shakes, sundaes and monthly specials. There monthly specials are something to keep you eye out for because these sundae creations are quite uniquely spectacular.  The staff is always super friendly and anxious to provide tastes of everything. The second best part of Bobtail though, is their selection of board games! My boy and I love to go and challenge each other at Scrabble why satisfying our taste buds. I mean what more could you want out of an ice cream shop right?
I love this place.  I always intend to try something different but I can never get away from my standard order of peanut butter chip in a cup, it's just too good.

I had their Pumpkin Pie Sundae... Fell in love! It was soo delicious! Pumpkin ice cream, caramel, cinnamon, graham crackers and whipped cream. Yum! I want to go back and try their other options.  Unfortunately, the place is tight, and on a busy Friday night there was one guy handling the ice cream and a girl at the register, so it took some patience to get our dessert. But I can say it was worth the wait!

Delectable, homemade ice cream with unique flavors.  This place is a dessert-lover's dream.  Large servings of ice cream and very affordable, I wanted to go back as soon as we left.  Good thing I picked up the frequent buyer card! The cute decor that hearkens back to that time when ice cream parlors were THE place to be.  Honestly, I don't know because I'm not old enough to, but I still appreciated the false nostalgia.  I especially enjoyed the old school photos of Chicago. The surrounding area is also packed with restaurants, so go somewhere else for a light meal and then fill up with ice cream (how every meal is meant to be).  Then, walk it off as you browse the cutesy shops in the area.

After a long bike ride and yoga class, what better way to reward yourself than by being a total fatty and chowing down on a delicious ice cream cone. This is an absolutely adorable shop that always seems busy when I walk by. I really liked my Cubby Crunch because it had sugar in all possible forms.
There's a reason this shop has a line out the door that rivals Garret's Popcorn when its -30 degrees F in the winter.  Go and eat, cry Yummy and Yelp.

Seriously the best ice cream I've ever had. The mint chocolate chip keeps me coming back, but the cubby crunch is pretty good too. They serve large portion sizes, and you can sample any of the flavors before ordering. Their shakes are amazing, but I usually stick to the single scoop for fear of how many calories are in them. The only reason I can't give them 5 stars is that the line can move extremely slowly on summer nights.

I used to love the peanut butter chip. The espresso is good, and variations on strawberry are usually good, but the various other flavors I've tried are below average. The single scoop is gigantic, at least. That would amount to a three-star review, but I just saw the ingredient list on their packed pints (for peanut butter chip), and it includes a lot of ingredients that do not need to be in ice cream, including partially hydrogenated oils. For a company that boasts "top-quality ingredients," this was a bit of a shock. I guess I'll stick with Black Dog Gelato from now on.

Had the cubby crunch and it was very tasty!  The person serving our ice cream was friendly and patient.  He made great recommendations for toppings and the ice cream was very good.  Lots of creative flavor options. As an ice cream enthusiast, this was one of my favorite spots for some authentic homemade ice cream in a frozen yogurt world!  Cute little storefront with some outdoor seating as well.
Damn tasty ice cream!!  Too bad there are always so many people there and a long line.. but then I guess it is worth a little wait.  When they are hanging out the door, I drive past!

Simply put, this long-time creative frozen treats shop near the foot of Chicago's Boystown neighborhood serves up fancy scoops and pints to those willing to explore and pay for it.  One of my favorites had is their lavender, dark chocolate sold in pints and also most recently, the huge Merlot chocolate chip scoop enjoyed on a perfect autumn day.

This has become my go-to place for my (imaginary) handsome, Italian boyfriend and me when in the area. You stand behind the counter and pick your poison. Last time I was in I went with the Merlot Chocolate Chip. The verdict? Delicious. So good to eat and the little spoon they give you allows you to eat it just as it was meant to be - in perfect, little bites. It lets you savor the moments even longer. Go now! And take your fake, Italian boyfriend.

After dinner we wanted something sweet.  We saw a line outside this corner store and stood in line. They had music playing inside and outside. Pro: Like the different flavors of ice cream of choice. Old fashion feel to the place.  Has outside tables to sit. Con: long line to wait for ice cream, not enough space inside to sit. Hard for find street parking location is popular.
White chocolate peanut butter chocolate chip. So delicious. Employees were friendly and loved to help giving samples.
Small place, Delicious ice cream!   Service is too slow ( sometimes)

Easily the best traditional ice cream in the city. I'm tired of the zillion fro-yo places opening up everywhere. People! Drop the self-serve cup and the dirty topping serving spoons, head to Bobtail and enjoy so real ice cream!
delicious, creamy! i want more!! cappucino yogurt! not too sweet and good flavor.yummmm

I had walked past this place before, and their website said their limited time feature flavor was bananas foster, so I went.  They were out of their feature flavor despite only having been open for one hour on a weekday, so my first impression was that I had gotten the old bait and switch treatment.  I ordered a shake with their white chocolate and peanut butter cup ice cream.  The white chocolate flavor was good, but all the mini cups sank to the bottom and didn't even get tasted until the end.  They should have diced them fine so they would distribute through the shake.  It was decent, but with each sip I kept thinking it's nowhere near as good as Andy's Frozen Custard.  Ultimately this was on par with a pint of Ben & Jerry's so I doubt I'll go back.

Love this place! I almost always get milkshakes here, because I'm just a fan of milkshakes. You can get a milkshake in any of the ice cream flavors. Most recently, I've had a butter pecan milkshake, a strawberry milkshake, and a white chocolate peanut butter cup milkshake... The last one was my favorite, I have to say. The staff is all really friendly and the ice cream is delicious. They have a lot of great unique flavors as well as the classics.
The Signature Sunset (Merlot ice cream, dark chocolate chips ) was really good.

I scream. You scream. We all scream for ice cream. Bobtail Ice Cream Company is what I would consider a notch up from Baskin Robbins. The ice cream is no doubt store bought ice cream served up fountain shop style, but it is good nevertheless. On a cone. In a cup. With or without sprinkles. Pick a topping, provided they have it. It's all good. There tends to be a crowd of indecisive housewives with antsy broods and teenagers who have no stop button to turn off their constant giggling. Once you get past that, you do indeed get a scoop or two of some flavours that are worth returning -- when  you're not held hostage with little saucy Sally, obstinate Johnny, or giggle snorting tweens.
The ice cream here is great and they even serve Intelligentsia coffee!
The Lake View Barhopper is definitely not worth the trip. Tastes like plain chocolate ice cream. Go buy Edys,  just as good, possibly better!

The only place in the city (that I'm aware of) that makes coffee "steamers" - or, lattes made with ice cream instead of milk. SO GOOD!  The atmosphere here is awesome as well. The shop is stocked with board games so you can hang out for awhile.  The only complaint I have is that I wish there were more flavors to choose from. That, and sometimes the line is out the door. But overall, one of the best, most iconic ice cream shops in the city. A must if you're in Lakeview on a hot summer night!

They don't have air conditioning here. So you're going to get sweaty when you're waiting in that line. The vanilla with peanut butter cups is delicous, especially in a big fat oreo covered waffle cone. My that's decadent.  I tried to get drunk on free samples of their merlot ice cream too, but it's not so tasty and also doesn't have booze in it, said a kid working there who I'm sure had learned that the hard way.

I'm so glad this place isn't closer to where I live. I would pack on the pounds for sure. This ice cream is flavorful and creamy just as it should be. The flavors are unique, (I love the peanut butter chocolate chip!) and they will give you samples to help you make your decision. The staff is very nice. I only wish they had a bigger selection. I think they only run about 12 flavors at a time...I'm accustomed to around 31.

Good ice cream. I met one of the owners at a Northwestern recruiting event- he worked at Oliver Wyman consulting.  I think they could improve their operations though. Price- Decent. Price is not absurd Quality- Very good. You can see them making the ice cream in the back. I like the unique flavors like Jack Daniels Quantity- Good amount of ice cream for what you pay Atmosphere- Cute. There are board games and black chalk boards and the story of how they came to be Staff- Nice staff, but I think a bit slow. When we were there before the pride parade, it was packed and it look about 15 minute to get your order completed after walking through the door. I saw 3/3 people scooping ice cream and 0/3 at the cashier so people were waiting to pay and get out. Good stuff though- we go whenever we're in lakeview at night

This is the first REAL ice cream I've found since moving to Chicago, and I thought it was amazing.  The salted caramel pecan was awesome, and since my server gave me like 3 scoops on my size small cone it was sort of dinner and dessert at the same time. I also like how there are lots of benches and seating outside so you can laze around in the sun while you eat your ice cream.  I can't wait to come back and try the peach- it looked like a popular seasonal flavor.

Bobtail bobtail bobtail you should be getting higher than a 3 star from me but....here we are. How did it come to this?  I've been to bobtail many times, it's in my corner so....easy access. I've have overall great experiences here, with good ice cream. The last TWO visits frankly peeved me in a huge way. I asked for a single scoop each time and got a laughably small about...to the point where I questioned it up front (politely) and the cashier even started to ring me up for kids size.  The "scooper" (i think it was the same girl both visits) corrected him. Really???? Really??? I looked around comparing other portion sizes and thought I was being punked. My ice cream bubble especially popped as I saw my boyfriend being hooked up by his scooper :( wtf?! Bobtail, you're ice cream is decent but I may be turned off enough to not come back anytime soon. I may just keep on walking down the road to CVS and buy a pint for the same price.

We came here after a big dinner, not cause we were hungry or needed dessert persay, but because Chicago is so damn hot. We stood inside and waited in a long-ass line, still sweating profusely because it's pretty hot inside as well. I wish that they would've turned the A/C on higher, but maybe its part of their scheme to get you to buy more ice cream. For our order, we just got a scoop of white chocolate peanut butter cup to split. The ice cream wasn't my cup of tea - I got a hint of the white chocolate flavor at the beginning, but it was faint. Also, overall it was just super sweet and rich. I dunno if I'm just being super picky but I definitely wasn't feeling this scoop. Also, half of it melted by the time we chowed down, but I'm blaming the Chicago summer for this. But still, just thought that their ice cream was okay and they lacked more truly creative flavors.

The Signature Sunset is the perfect name for the most perfect dessert.  It's a merlot ice cream with dark chocolate chips.  I've never tasted anything like it.   You can ask for samples of their ice cream, so don't be shy.

I go to Bobtail all the time.  The ice cream is fresh, creamy, and sometimes decadent.  I'm becoming a fan of their Merlot flavor - quite fancy.  I've heard people compare Bobtail as the Homer's Ice Cream of Lakeview and it's a fair comparison.  The prices are a bit more than 31 Flavors, but the quality is far superior.  Also, women love this place.  It's always packed late on Friday and Saturday with girls hungry after Friar Tucks.  Come to Bobtail and enjoy some lady watching and delicious treats.

Went here after dinner on a Saturday night with a few friends and boy was it super packed!! We literally had to wait a half an hour to get our ice cream. Was it worth it? ABSOLUTELY YES! Everything my friends tried was delicious from the peanut butter chocolate chip, to the chocolate, to the ones with alcohol in it, everything was creamy and delicious, especially on a hot summer day. The only thing that was annoying is that it was kinda hot waiting in line, but I think that's because people kept coming in and out and opening the door. But the guys who got us our ice cream were very friendly despite being super busy and gave us some good recommendations. What i loved was that the mint chocolate chip flavor wasn't green, because REAL mint isn't green, so you know that they use all natural ingredients which is also a plus. Will definitely be back for more!! And crisp is right across the street so dinner there and ice cream at Bobtails!!

I'm a fan of Bobtail! It's a reliable bet everytime it gets hot and is well situated in the middle of the neighborhood. It's a little pricey, but that's whatever quite honestly. The staff is always very friendly and working hard. The ice cream is consistently good and varied. I've never had a bad shake or cone at this place. I'm glad you're a part of the community Bobtail. I'll be a customer so long as it's warm and I'm in town.
Yep. It's good ice cream, and you get A LOT of it! The woman behind the counter made my custom sundae a little too perfectly...there was LOTS of ice cream, a LOTS of caramel, and LOTS of nuts! Yum...

I am forever ruined for other ice cream places! Okay, so perhaps that is not entirely true, but its hard to beat ice cream that is made fresh and sooo well. I love the creative flavors and the way that they make customers feel involved. For me, this is a perfect example of a local business that embraces its community and I really hope that never changes. I mean when I walk inside it reminds me of this ice cream place I went to back home when I was a kid in Media, PA (Jimminy Crickets). They have board games that you can play while you eat and I love that because it sends the message that they don't want to just serve you and get you out of there. Sit down. Stay a while. Although, I will mention that the games are a bit sticky :P and the seating a little bit cramped. Its not entirely comfortable if you are going with a wheelchair or scooter user because the line is very narrow. That would be my only complaint really.  My favorite flavors have to be the Lakeview Barhopper and their Peanut Butter Cup is the best I've had ANYWHERE. I also really really enjoyed their Strawberry Butterscotch special flavor and I hope it comes back!! Ummm I don't really like the Cubby Crunch (. .) sorry! but I agree with the person who said the Merlot Chocolate Chip is tasty! It really is.

Why is it SO HARD to find an ice cream shop in Chicago?! Not froyo, not kefir, not gelato... ice cream! Give me milky, fatty goodness! .  Anyways, I love Bobtail. I don't find it overpriced at all-- it's real ice cream in a pretty nice location. The ice cream is about of average richness, and they have really fun flavors. I've had the Cubby Crunch but my inner chocoholic thinks the Lakeview Barhopper is better. Their specialty drinks are yummy, too. One of the girls that works there gives three scoops for every single scoop you order.
Awesome unique ice cream and the best iced coffee I've had in a long time.
My fav ice cream place on earth! The Merlot Chocolate Chip is to die for. Always a line as this place nut so worth the wait!!

The Cubby Crunch ice cream is fantastic and hands down, one of the best ice creams that I've had this summer.  The Cubby Crunch is vanilla ice cream with sprinkles, toffee pieces, Oreo pieces and chocolate chips. I loved it because you got that sweet and salty taste (coming from the toffee) without being overall sweet since the base of the ice cream was vanilla instead of a rich chocolate.  If it was chocolate, I think all the topping flavors would get muddled.  But this was just PERFECT.  I got a single scoop, but could honestly, have eaten a ton more. My boyfriend tried the salted pecan and that tasted lovely as well (but honestly, not as good as mine).  It was almost a bit too salty for my liking. The shop is very cute.  The selection of flavors isn't large, but the flavors are pretty unique.  Also, if you check in five times on Yelp, you can get a free item with your purchase. Overall, awesome ice cream shop and hope to be back again this summer!

I got 3 scoops of very different flavors because I can't make decisions and they were all so appealing. They were really nice and friendly--I mentioned I was moving into the neighborhood and they immediately offered me a frequent buyer card and punched it twice as a "welcome." Cubby Crunch was out of this world. I'm slightly concerned about my pants fitting once I move in so nearby.
get the cubby crunch & sit on the patio outside!
The Cubby Crunch is awesome! I'd recommend Bobtail for ice cream lovers like myself.
I came in here when I had a major craving for a shake.  I was NOT disappointed. It's a little on the more expensive side, but it was worth it!

Aaaaaamazing salted caramel pecan ice cream! Rich, creamy, with the prefect blend of sweet and saltiness. The 2nd time I had butter pecan, which was also delicious. I can imagine this place being packed during the summer months, so maybe I should get my fill now, before the weather gets too warm? They have a good collection of board/card games (though some are kind of falling apart) for people to hang out. Will definitely be back!

Absolutely love the icecream here! They have a shop at the Buckingham Fountain too! That is actually where I had my first Bobtails Ice Cream.  The ice cream taste homemade. Their strawberry is to die for. Rich and creamy. You can taste the difference between this strawberry ice cream and other store bought ones. Tip: Get the single scoop with two different flavors to get more variety!

This place is so overrated that I'm completely perplexed by the stellar reviews.  The  ice cream is sub-par at best and tasteless at worst.  The staff isn't terribly friendly either.  I once overheard an employee get pretty fresh with a potential customer who called close to closing time.  Bad product + unsatisfactory service = go to Windy City Treats or Paciugo up the street on Broadway.  Both will exceed the experience you would receive at Bobtail.

Great ice cream and a fun place to go!  The old fashioned decor is cute and makes you feel less like you are being pushed through for money and more like they care about ice cream (as lame as that sounds, I know...).  I have been here many times and the ice cream never fails... unique flavors and great waffle cones.  Last week I popped in to use my groupon before it expired and the women waiting on me and my partner, even pitched in to help cover fifty cents we didn't have in cash so we wouldn't have to put it on a card.  Super friendly and down-to-earth staff!!  Thanks bobtail!

Cubby crunch is amazing with oreo, toffee, chocolate chips. It was a 10/10 with a sprinkle chocolate dipped cone. Great Groupon deal. Friendly servers. 1950s ice cream shop ambience. My shake was OK; the ice cream is the draw.

Cubby Crunch. Not quite 'cellar door', but the two words juxtaposed still sound beautiful to me. So I've been in Chicago since last August. Chicago is known for many things, including its rich history of good food. Never would have I guessed that 'ice cream' would be part of this tradition. This will be a shorter than usual review since I just made a shorter than usual visit to Bobtail (just picked up an ice cream en route to a day of studying at Next Door Cafe). Get the Cubby Crunch. It's a confetti of an experience (is that even a phrase?). You get the deliciously sweet notes of the ice cream along with awesome little morsels of goodness hidden throughout. It was and is a delight. I've had Bobtail Ice Cream a number of times now, but this is the first time I've been at one of their actual storefronts (rather than a purveyor). It's cute. TL;DR - The ice cream is bonkers good. It's cheap. The cubby crunch is addictive.

Bobtail Ice Cream Shoppe was a great addition to the Lakeview area. The shoppe has the 50s feelings from the wooden floors to the marble table tops and to the counter.  They offer different flavors of ice creams.  I would also recommend any of their ice cream drinks.  They often run ice cream specials which is nice. The shoppe also has games that you can play while you are enjoying your ice cream so it adds to the family feeling. During the warmer months, this place is always busy.  At times, there will be a line out the door.  You can also enjoy the curb side patio. So indulge.

Okay, let me start off with a disclaimer: I came here on a whim, during lunch break and I needed an afternoon pick-me-up. I did not get ice cream, but definitely will come back to try their adult flavors when it's a little bit warmer/I've got extra time & calories to kill!  What I *did* get was an iced mocha. In a large. Wow. DEFINITELY got me awake...well more like wired/hyper! Move over, Starbucks. You've got another competitor in my book!
Friendly neighborhood ice cream shop with plenty of selection. This store gets PACKED in the summer. Staff is friendly! I'm a fan!
Nothing to go out of your way for, but above average ice cream. Original flavors & friendly staff.

cute little icecream place in the area...it's kinda refreshing to see an icecream place with some "flavours" for adults :P the Guinness draught icecream was really interesting... the chocolate one with jack daniels was very good and strong in chocolate, but i can't taste any whiskey... I am intrigued with their icecream latte....def. try that next time  i would think they may want to streamline the ordering process a bit to help with the line. I could see how this may be a problem in the summer... =/

I can't believe I haven't yelped about this place yet!! It is a small ice cream place which has an old school charm to it.  The ice cream is delicious. With flavors like Merlot and jack Daniels this definitely caters to the more adventurous foodies. Also, for shake lovers this is a haven. I don't really dig shakes, but I am happy with their ice cream! Can't wait for summer to hit up this spot again.

Meh, had a bit of a crazy experience here on Saturday.  We had a 35 minute line out the door that just kept getting longer.  The ice cream was still great, but Bobtail was very understaffed and they had run out of a lot of stuff - including napkins!

Very good ice cream in a great location. I can see how this place gets stuffy in the busy summer months since it it small. Only drawback is that it is a bit pricey. $9 for a single scoop of ice cream on a sugar come and a small malt. I'm sure we will be back come Spring/Summer.
I absolutely cannot fathom eating ice cream anywhere else.

I ordered an ice cream cake for my (former) boyfriend's birthday, and from the time I called and made the initial order until the time I picked up said cake, I have to say this place has awesome customer service. Honestly, the cake was pretty expensive for me, but it was custom (got to pick the ice cream flavors!), and it was the best kind of ice cream cake (had real cake in it, not the crunchies like Carvel, who I'm not discounting, but still).  It was so yummy!   I would definitely go back to check out the rest of their treats.

I am obsessed with Bobtail. I have been visiting it every time I've gone to Chicago and now I will be lucky enough to live down the block from it. The ice cream flavors are simply delicious and I love going there in the height of the summer. A cappuccino yogurt in an almond/chocolate waffle cone...heaven.
Great little ice cream place in LakeView.  Great ice cream with very nice workers.  We normally go on a Tuesday or Thursday for 1/2 off shakes.  Love the cookies and cream shake the most!

I just love this place.  It's so old school and the ice cream is always good.  I usually try to order something new but inevitably go back to the mint chip-- It's not that fake neon green scary mint-- it tastes fresh and natural with chunks of good chocolate. This is one of the only places that my dad always suggests that we visit when he is in town-- even though I live downtown and even in the dead of winter.  It's just that good.

Everything I've had here is awesome. I love the old-timey charm and the random board games they have stashed on shelves. It's a great place to hang out with friends or just grab a cone on the way home from dinner.  There's nothing quite like having a cone on a bench outside watching the people walk by on a warm summer evening.

I am in love with Bobtail.  Everything about them makes me swoon.  I have never met an ice-cream flavor that I did not like, I am treated like I am the first customer of the day when I try every new type of ice-cream when I stop by, I love the concept of your local business in East Lakeview.  They have a lot of fun and seasonal flavors, including some with alcohol.  The place is packed on summer nights with couples of every age, families, kids, folks walking their dogs - it is like the local hangout.  It is certainly a must-visit place when in that part of town.

I never really clicked with Bobtail. It was one of the first businesses I patronized when I moved to Chicago and I could never muster more than a ((shrug)). The ice cream quality never really impressed me and the service was 'annoyed teen chic.' For years, I had friends who, knowing my sweet tooth, told me that I needed to come back and try them again. That in the intervening time in which I established my initial impressions, Bobtail got its act together and started cranking out some serious ice cream. I was all, like, "So?" For.years. The joke was on me. One day as I wandered East Lakeview in search of a sweet treat to keep me going on this long, winding road of life, I was beckoned into Bobtail by images of happy, portly children bounding out of its doors, hopped up on sugar and joy. I needed some of that. I walked in... and was ignored. Yep, this was familiar. Before the two girls behind the counter had realized that I wasn't a figment of their imagination and I wasn't leaving, a third (!) clerk came out from the back to help me. This wasn't starting well. The only upside was that I'd had time to scan the menu and figure out what I wanted. A scoop of Chocolate Daydream. A scoop of Bananas Foster. Hot Fudge. Peanuts. Whipped Cream. Cherry. Read it all again. Slowly. Savor it. Mhm. Yep. Despite awful service (again!), it's likely my 34 Cs and expanding waistline will be back. That sounds like some high-quality, interesting ice cream, no?

Bobtail proves yet again that you just cannot screw up sugared dairy fat. YUMZILLA. The cookies and cream is rich, thick, and absolutely fantastic. Husband had the maple and butter pecan, and loved it. A lot of places share Bobtail's secret to success, aka, calories, so it probably wouldn't be worth a special trip out except for our need to use my Groupon. But if you're in the neighborhood, it's a great after dinner or hot sunny day spot.

With flavors that include Jack Daniels and merlot, Bobtail certainly satisfies the adventurous side of ice cream.   Plenty of standard offerings and a variety of cones, floats, milkshakes and flavors, there isn't an ice cream dream that Bobtail can't fulfill! I don't know what it is about the chocolate chips that they use, but you can actually taste the chocolatey goodness as they melt in your mouth, instead of the standard tasteless crunchy things that you usually get! On a more interesting note, their ice cream does not contain eggs (excluding the flavors with Oreo), which I'm sure will excite the local hardcore vegan. There's a 15 minute parking zone right in front, which is perfect to pull in, pick up something delicious, and head home (especially on those lovely Chicago winter days).
All I can say is Yummy, Yummy, to my Tummy!!!  The staff...Great!!! The atmosphere...Great!!! The ice cream...Great!!! I can't wait to go back....mmmmm!!!
