I've been in here several times and the service is usually okay - though the establishment seems to be getting grungier and grungier.  I went on the evening of January 10, 2012 and there were three young men behind the counter.  One of them, whom I've seen before, said something like "Oh I know what he's going to get."  He was rather nice and attended to me.  There was a dark haired guy who was obviously holding "court" and replied, "Oh, he's ugly ..."  and proceed to seat himself on a counter top in oder to eat copious amounts of the store product and all the while holding the 3rd employee enthralled with his conversation.  I think the guy who attended to me felt left out and somehow "scolded" by the comments of this 3rd guy and I felt bad.  I've been 20ish once years and years ago and knew exactly what was going on.  In any event, it was an unpleasant service experience walking into somewhere and being entangled into some bizarre triangle.  Granted, I was the only customer.  Still, it should have been at least a neutral experience where I wasn't indirectly insulted.

The Signature Sunset (merlot ice cream with dark chocolate chips) is great, but it might be the only flavor worth getting. The only other specialty flavor I've tried is the Cubby Crunch (vanilla ice cream with sprinkles, Oreos, chocolate chips, and toffee) and I felt that it was way too busy. Sprinkles are much better served as a room-temperature topping -- they become very hard and are mashed up during the creation of the ice cream, which I don't like so much. Regular flavors are good but are either roughly the same quality-wise as the premium supermarket brands (Oberweis, Ciao Bella, etc.) or worse (Talenti). For the price, that is not good enough. Cute corner location and helpful staff, but if it becomes busy it will probably become difficult to look at all of the flavors or to grab a few pints to-go -- the ordering area is quite narrow. Plenty of seating indoors and at least one bench outside during the warmer months.

I've been here a handful of times and want to love it but it's difficult. The ice cream is hit or miss. Some flavors are awesome and some lack in any taste at all. My favorite is the peanut butter chip which I think is great though. I do feel that this place is a bit over priced though. One scoop in a cup is about $3.50 (maybe a little more). That is a lot for one scoop. Now the real reason I give this place only two stars. My husband and I stopped in last night and when I walked in I noticed it smelled a little funny. I thought this on another occasion I was there and never said anything. This time I didn't say anything at first because I do have a sensitive sense of smell and usually smell things others do not. Though, while waiting for my ice cream my husband asked me if I thought it smelled funny and I said yes and he asked, "like pee?" and I said yes. We looked around and the place was full and it didn't seem to bother anyone eating there. I could not have sat there to eat my ice cream, we had to take it to go.

Wow, yummy and unique flavors can be found at this little hidden gem.  As part of the Chocolate tour I got to sample the Signature Sunset which is a Merlot ice cream with dark chocolate chips so smooth and delicious! The Lakeview Barhopper brought me to tears with Dutch cocoa ice cream with Jack Daniels®. So rich and divine! I have to come back and have a huge scoop of these homemade delights real soon. They also hand pack pints for home!

I wanted ice cream badly. This place satisfied my sweet tooth very well.  My sister and I went to try this place on a hot Chicago day. I didn't know what I wanted, but Yelp told me that the cubby crunch was popular.  It was a nice surprise. It was vanilla ice cream with toffee, sprinkles, and chocolate chips. It reminded me of a ice cream birthday cake. It was really creamy and everything blended together very well.  The place looks like an old-fashioned, whimsical ice cream shop. Very cute. They also have chocolates on display for sale. When we went there, a chocolate tour was coming through and people were testing out the ice cream.

Their ice cream is delicious...even on a cold October night. I had my favorite cookies and cream and their signature cubby crunch...num num num. The place is super cute too...kinda retro-ice cream shop style. After a long stroll down the Lakeview hood this was a great rest stop. So worth the trip from whatever 'hood you are coming from

This is my absolute favorite ice cream place!!! I love you Bobtail! I've been here a few times but my favorites are the brownie sundae (so huge but yum!!) and just a simple cone w/ chocolate ice cream. My boyfriend LOVES their malts. The ice cream is always delicious and I love that it's homemade. It gives it an even better taste. I will continue to go to bobtail whenever I crave ice cream :)

Came here after weeks of craving a brownie sundae. I do like their hours, 10pm on weekdays and 11pm on weekends even in the winter. Got in, perused the menu (I love chalk board/whimsical menus, but I kind of found this one difficult to read). Hubby and I shared the brownie sundae with a scoop of vanilla bean and 1 of cubby bear, hot fudge and toffee toppings. This is where I was a bit disappointed, I just didn't like the brownie. It wasn't bad, but it just wasn't that hit-the-spot brownie; I was surprised as I even love out-of-the-box brownie mix so I don't consider myself overly picky, but maybe I was being so. Unfortunately that's what brought me down to 3-stars. Aside from the brownie itself, the ice cream flavors and consistency was really good. I liked the cubby bear even though I'm not a huge fan of peanut butter ice cream, and the toffee on top was not overly sweet, which was nice also.  They also have board games - I LOVE that! Think I'm just jaded by my expectations of the brownie, sorry bobtail. I'd be back for the ice cream though!
Classic ice-cream shop with a limited selection, but well crafted.  The staff is polite and affable.

Yes, I guess it is pretty good but it didn't blow me away.  Maybe I came in with my expectations unfairly high because I had heard so much about it.  The vanilla malt, good and rich.  The root beer float, nice and refreshing.  The butter pecan ice cream also tasty and creamy.  That being said, I miss having Stone Cold on Diversey.  I think it was better.

Cubby Crunch--it doesn't look like a lot, but it will make you tear up with joy. If you're getting a sundae, you need another person to help eat it to ensure you don't go into a delicious coma. Prices are a bit higher, but worth it.

Such friendly staff - they definitely saved this place from getting a bad review.  Not that my review matters, since others seem to love Bobtail. But I have to make my case ---- My bestie and I came here since someone else recommended it, and being the crazy sweet-tooth she is, she had to drag me here after dinner.  They do have lots of flavors of ice cream, which was a plus. Their staffs were super friendly and offered us samples. I wanted pistachio, and I was glad I tried the sample before ordering it, because it did not taste like pistachio whatsoever, It was rather bland. So I went with espresso instead - you could never go wrong with coffee/espresso. It was ok. Maybe I was really full from dinner, but I was not "wow" by it. My friend got the Cappuccino Crunch Yogurt and I was slightly confused by it - it had lots of cinnamon and nutmeg taste to it... not what I had expected at all.  For a child scoop and a small scoop (without scones), we ended up paying 6-7 bucks - I thought it was expensive for just ice cream! I think it's fair to say I won't make myself a regular here!

oh bobtail, why aren't you in ukranian village? had a delicious cone there today and will most definitely be back. although its pretty darn far from my house, it is worth the trek.  i had the cookies and cream. and the bf had the white chocolate peanut butter cup. both were great. we also had a sampling of the pumpkin. yum. although i don't think i could eat an entire cone of the pumpkin.  love that they have cute board games. the bf and i definitely had a pretty competitive game of Guess Who going.

Great ice cream place. The staff is always very friendly and their ice creams are homemade (at least I think they are) and delicious. Also, they have intelligentsia coffee too.  Finally, they have some great board games to choose from and a nice water area (+ cups) for if you're really thirsty and want just an ice cream cone - for instance - but do not want to get a shake, ect, just because you're thirsty.

If you have any type of claustrophobia then maybe this place will not be for you on a summer night From the time we walked in to the time we left I stared getting that "sardine in a can feeling" that I normally get riding a CTA train during rush hour. However, you can't get delicious ice cream on the CTA. It was the delicious ice cream that allowed me to tolerate the crowd. Now on to the ice cream. I ordered a cream express shake. It was a vanilla shake with a double shot of espresso. What can I say besides: WOW!. This was well worth the wait and fighting the crowd. This is going to be the place that you will find me when I need to indulge!

Fresh, homemade ice cream in creative flavors.....can't ask for more since I live a block from here.  Cubby Crunch is still my favorite flavor and banana fosters tasted like rich rum which is a plus in my note.  Tried out their waffle cone for the first time and it was fresh.  Their milk shakes are pretty good too!  Keep up the good work, I love these small places that compete against corporate ice cream stores (cold stone, baskin robbins) .

Even when ice cream is bad it's good, but thankfully Bobtail's ice cream is excellent! I appreciate that they have a big jug of ice water sitting out for customers. That makes me happy. Go with the White Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup & thank me later.

I'm a sucker for pistachio ice cream. Like, forget winin' and dinin'. just throw a cone of pistachio in my face and i'm done for. walked into bobtail on a whim with a friend, and ordered a scoop of pistachio in a sprinkle cone. that ran me about $4.00, and being the thrifty spender i am, i thought "shit better be good... i can buy a pint of ice cream at this cost." mmmm best pistachio ice cream ever!!! there were whole pistachios! WHOLE ONES. the ice cream itself was really creamy and delicious, too. highly suggest this place if you are jonesin' for the sweet stuff.
The place is lovely with a good atmosphere!  The decor is so cute and adorable!  I tasted the bananas foster milkshake, it was good but just a little too sweet for me!

I don't know...I found this a little disappointing.  It's a nice little place, service was lovely, but the icecream didn't have much *flavor*.  Strange to say about icecream, perhaps, but my date agreed.  I would probably visit one of my regular places instead of returning.

This ice cream is delicious! The shakes are great and the people, mainly Shaun.. are super accommodating. They want to spice up your latte or add something special to your ice cream or shake. And Shaun is hot. Go say hi to Shaun.

Looking for some after dinner dessert and we almost stopped and got foyo but we didn't.  So we went in search for ice cream and oh boy am I happy we did!  Homemade Ice Cream! I got the Cubby Crunch, which is Vanilla ice cream, sprinkles, Oreo, chocolate chips, toffee. Sooooo yummy!! I would have died if it was chocolate ice cream and not vanilla. Can you tell I am a sweets freak! It was about $3.40 for a scoop but soo worth it!

probably the best milkshake i've ever had. downside - it's like $7 for a regular size. upside- if you go on tuesdays its only $3! yay!  bobtail, my mouth waters thinking about your lakeview barhopper milkshake. mmmmmmm.

I live only two blocks away so I am always here. The ice cream is to die for especially the "signature sunset" a merlot flavoured ice cream with dark chocolate chips mixed in. SIMPLY BLISSS :)))))). The staff is super friendly and have no problems helping you find the perfect flavour for you. I will always be a frozen yogurt fan but sometimes I need the real deal. Bobtail is a must go if your ever in the neighborhood or looking for that perfect dessert!

Just moved to Chicago from east coast and totally in love with this city... this ice cream place happens to be in my neighborhood and the ice cream is GOOD!! Friendly staff and they have so many choices. BTW, the scoop is big!  If you love ice cream and don't mind to have a very generous scoop of GOOD ice cream, dft come here.  Love it!!

I'm still mad about an incident where one of their employees shut me out when there was still ten minutes before the advertised closing time.  The lights were still on and it was ten minutes! Try to get here early and avoid my situation.  If it's cold enough or you can handle the sugar rush, get a hot chocolate, they are out of this world.  Second to the hot chocolate at George's ice cream, though the sugar rush of both are too much for me.  Headache inducing. I love that their flavors are made in house and that they offer combinations which pull me away from my usual; rocky road which is found at most other ice cream shoppes.  Well rocky road or Zanzibar chocolate.  Try Daley addiction or Cubby crunch, I don't particularly care for the name of the first one.

Unfortunately, I visited this place after recently discovering that I'm lactose intolerant.  Bummer.  I still enjoyed myself though with a little frozen yogurt with gummy bears on top.  Everyone else in the group I was with ordered ice cream and all seemed to enjoy it pretty well.  Apparently this place also sells chocolate?  Bonus. No matter what you order, it's going to be spot on.  This place is delish.

My neighborhood ice cream joint. I usually have a pint of Bobtail's cookies and cream in my freezer to fulfill my sudden ice cream cravings especially when I'm watching tv at home. Once in awhile, I do get one of their specialty flavors such as Thor and Cubby Crunch, which is one of my faves. What I love about this place is how creamy and soft their ice cream is and most of the time, there is a new flavor to try. The perfect anytime treat.

Bobtail Ice Cream Company is definitely not a Plush Horse but at least it's not a Margies Candies. Bobtails is really cute and adorable inside as it sits on the corner at 2951 N. Broadway. It packs in quite a crowd of locals and even non-locals like us.  After watching my oldest daughter perform with her improv company my wife and I decided along with my daughter and her boyfriend to stop at Bobtails for some ice cream. It was a nice average treat for our family. I ordered the Orange Mint ice cream in a milkshake. Which on this Tuesday was milkshakes at a reduced price. The Orange Mint ice cream was very light on flavor. My wife ordered a pistachio ice cream cone. There were big chunks of nuts in the ice cream but again it was a bit light on the actual flavor. My daughter ordered the Cubby Crunch ice cream. It is a mix of different treats, cookies, toffee, sprinkles, etc in a vanilla based type of ice cream. This one was pretty good, if you like those type of extras in your ice cream. Our total bill came to roughly $15 dollars.  Do we recommend the Bobtail Ice Cream Company? Well like I always say with everything, you should give it a try at least one time. Because the Bobtail is good average ice cream at an okay price point.

I am here every Tuesday and Thursday ordering the strawberry milkshake with spanish peanuts hold the whip cream! I have a punch card and always check in on yelp. 5 Check ins and u get something free. I am the only one to have redeemed it TWICE! Peeps in Lakeview East wake up... and take advantage of this great deal. The staff is young, hip and super awesome!

Cubby Crunch.  'Nuff Said. But since I have time I may as well elaborate.  Cubby crunch is a kids dream ice cream.  I'm sure I won't cover it all but it has sprinkles, oreos, toffee, chocolate... everything.  But somehow its not too rich as other ice creams can be when they try to load all those ingredients in.  Pure heaven.  Pure nostalgia.  There's a few others I'd like to try, like the italian ice, but I got a ways to go yet before I can pass on the cubby crunch. Not that I was alive during the soda shop era but I get that sort of feeling when I come into Bobtail.  And the people who work there all seem genuinely nice so that's refreshing.   They have games here, which I'm always a fan of.  Most notably, Go to the Head of the Class.  I kicked butt at that game as a kid.  Which will give you an idea about how cool I was.  Its usually too packed with people trying to get some Bobtail action tho for me to hang around and play a game, but one of these days I'm gonna have to school someone!  Pardon the pun. Anyway, main point is when you try Bobtail's Cubby Crunch you go straight to the head of the class!

I don't know about you, but when it's hotter than balls out I don't instantly crave dairy. I usually want a sorbet or italian ice. BOBTAIL, YOU KNOW MY NEEDS. Walked in on a Saturday when everyone and their mom was out (it was about 90 degrees with 1000% humidity) and I needed a frosty treat, stat. I gazed at the menu. CHERRY. ITALIAN. ICE.  Oh yeah. There was no need to look further. Got a kids portion (really, this kid size was probably made for a gigantic child because it was a lot larger than I thought it was going to be) and dug in. It was sweet and refreshing. It had real pieces of cherry.  AHHHHHHHH Perfect treat on a summer day.

Old-school, independently owned, delicious ice cream shop... how can I not give them 5 stars?  Great flavors, lots of combinations/ways to enjoy your ice cream, decent prices, and great customer service.  Plus they have board games you can play.  Places like this are such a rarity these days, enjoying their ice cream on a warm summer night really makes me feel like a kid again.

Ice cream may have lost the war against frozen yogurt, but Bobtail's always a winner to me.  Best Permanent Flavor: Signature Sunset (merlot flavored ice cream with chocolate chips) Best Seasonal Flavors, in order of amazingness: Guinness (St. Patrick's Day) Pumpkin (Fall) Eggnog (Christmas) Lavender (Spring) Also, their store is a great spot to hang out with friends. There's limited seating but the staff doesn't mind if you sit and chat awhile, or play one of their many board games.

The first time I went here I left not terribly impressed. Why, you ask? Well, I don't know! I went back again (with a groupon) and I picked up a pint of cubby crunch and 2 scoops of... a white chocolate ice cream with mini peanut buttercups in it. Both are deeelicious (no I did not eat it all at once.)  I can't tell you what left me unimpressed the first time but I can tell you that Bobtail makes some very tasty ice cream. The line even moved quickly when there were a ton of people there with their groupons.  Since I'm obsessed with ice cream, I will DEFINITELY be back here.

Unfortunate for the sidewalk work outside (which made getting to the store almost impossible). Never the less, so worth it! Had the two scoop - mint chip and cappuccino. I really like mint chip, but it usually has a weird medicinal aftertaste. There's is superb and actually tastes like real mint.

This is a wonderful neighborhood ice cream shop. We tried it walking around one day, and we were pleased with the experience. The shop is a little bit cozy inside, and every time that we have went it was packed.  They have a pretty decent selection: shakes, sundaes, scoops, coffee, etc. I have enjoyed everything I have had so far, but my favorite so far is a shake with the "Lakeview Barhopper" flavor.  Be sure to pop in if in the area.

I'm not a huge ice cream fan usually, but this place is where I'll be going over any chain parlor or ice cream carton from the grocery store. I've only been here once so far, and I can't remember the name of the ice cream I had --  it had pretzels and chocolate in it, my favorite flavor of blended goodness. My boyfriend had the Merlot ice cream with dark chocolate chips which was... interesting, but he loved it! The help was really friendly and let us try a bunch of samples and gave some good suggestions considering it was our first time there.  It apparently gets really busy, so I'll probably be planning my chocolate/ice cream cravings (if I can help it) for sometime during the week.

How can you not love delicious ice cream paired with a game of candyland???  My only complaint about this place is that you could practically get a meal for the cost of this ice cream.  A single scoop (and it is truly a single scoop) will run you nearly $3.50.   My favorite ice cream is the signature sunset which is merlot ice cream with dark chocolate chunks in it.  I don't even like red wine but I LOVE this ice cream.  Maybe because red wine is not chock full of cream and sugar, but that's besides the point.  I haven't tried a flavor of theirs that I didn't like, and they always have seasonal flavors rotating through which always keeps things exciting.
Best homemade ice cream with delicious flavors. I had a strawberry lemonade cake ice cream. Mmmmmmmm

One reason I'm thrilled to be moving to Lakeview this spring is my new proximity to Bobtail. It's local ice cream perfection: a very walkable location in the heart of a great neighborhood, creamy but not sickeningly rich scoops, simple but flawlessly executed flavors, and a friendly "it's-always-summer" ambience. On my most recent Bobtail visit, I scarfed down their wonderful white chocolate peanut butter chip while my girlfriend doubled up with a coffee scoop and a cookies & cream scoop. A lot of ice cream shops go overboard with experimental flavors, but I love that Bobtail does the classics and does them well. (They do have a few specialty flavors, like the Lakeview Barhopper and the Signature Sunset, with merlot and chocolate chips, but I have yet to try them.) While there could probably be a bit more seating--the crowd often spills out the door--the wide selection of board games you can play while you munch on your waffle cone more than makes up for it.

bought a few groupons for this joint - never new it existed prior to. got ice cream from here 3 times in the past month and each time they had suprising new flavors.  workers are very polite and offer samples of any and all ice creams. i went with the cubby crunch last night in a waffle good and it was very tastey!  the line was out the door but im pretty sure that was due to it being the last night for the groupon. id definately go back.  parking is a little tricky in the immediate area so walk or talk public transportation if possible.

Everything I've ever had from this place is delicious! It's a very nostalgic and unique atmosphere. Definitely not Baskin Robbins... which is why it is awesome. And, it's not only ice cream! Hot Chocolates, coffees, coffee concoctions, Chai... mmm.

I come to bobtail especially for their lakeview barhopper ice cream. Dutch chocolate + jack daniels = happiness. All the flavors that I've tried have been great - really rich and creamy and even better when served in one of the chocolate and sprinkle waffle cones. The staff have always been friendly, helpful and patient. I'm glad I live a few blocks away because this place is hard to resist.

There is NOTHING wrong with Bobtail!  I love this place!  It's wholesome, with a mom-and-pop feel and the ice cream is really delicious!  If you know of a better ice cream place (not gelato) I would like to know.

If you're looking for incredibly rich and creamy ice cream served with a smile in a cute old-fashioned environment, this is the place to go. And for those of us who don't want to commit to a single flavor but also don't want to gorge on ice cream, I love that they will let you split a scoop between two different flavors.  I had a split scoop of kiwi ice cream and mango Italian ice (made elsewhere) and both were insanely good. The kiwi ice cream was so rich and buttery with just a hint of kiwi flavor; it reminded me of a kiwi cookie dough. The mango ice was the perfect contrast to the heavy, guilt-inducing goodness of the ice cream--light and refreshing and so packed with flavor it tasted like you were eating a chunk of frozen mango.

BEST ICE CREAM IN CHICAGO! No contest. This place is amazing and it also looks like a Ice Cream shop from a movie. Cubby Crunch is delicious. I love down the street and have to force myself from not going here multiple times a week. Great place to go to after a date or if you are going on a walk.

This is a very cute ice cream shop with unique flavors!  My favorites are the merlot chocolate chip ice cream and the whitte chocolate peanut butter cup....oh and  the Daley Addiction.  I have been coming to this place at least once/month for the last couple of years.  I live a block away from Cold Stone and Oberweis...but make the trip to the North side for this place:)

My husband and I love ice cream. Really good ice cream, that is. I had a groupon with one month left before expiration. I decided that after the movie we would stop for ice cream. Even though it was cold outside, Bobtails was crowded like it was a spring day. That right there signaled to me that we were in the right place. My husband had some sundae that included cubbie crunch. He said it was good but it probably sucked like the cubs do. ( Can't you tell I'm a White Sox fan?!) I had a brownie with vanilla ice cream. Even though it was busy, we were able to snag a table an enjoy our treats.  I would have given this place 4 stars. It was very enjoyable and my brownie ala mode was delish. The reason for the fifth star was for an incident that did not involve me but the owner. (he served us our ice cream) One man came in and started arguing with him about the use of the groupon. I didn't hear exactly what was going on but the owner gave him his money back. The irate man continued to berate the owner and the owner was like 'OK sir you made your point.' Then he proceeded to ask who was next in line. The man again jumps in and continues to berate the owner saying I wasn't finish and I want you to hear this. After all that crap, the guy decides to sit and enjoy his shake right there! SHEESH! To put up with a crappy customer like that and continue to have a great attitude deserves an extra star.

Nice little corner shop that has some really good ice cream.  I got a scoop of the pistachio ice cream in a chocolate almond waffle cone.  This was a bit different then the usual pistachio ice cream I'm used to, in a good way.  It looked almost like butter pecan, except there were huge chunks of pistachio.  My new favorite place for pistachio ice cream. They also have seasonal flavors on the menu, take-home ice cream packs, and various baked goods.  I'll be sure to stop by for a scoop the next time I pass by.

Oh Em Gee! We randomly stopped in here after dinner tonight and I'm so glad we did! I had the best ice cream cone in my life!!! And when I say cone, yes, I do mean the actual cone. It was covered in oreos on the top!!!!!!!! I love oreos and a cone covered in oreos is definitely for me! The only downfall was that it was messy! I got oreo crumbs all down my shirt like a mountain beast~eek! The ice cream was just fantastic, too! It's all homemade and they had some extremely unique flavors like a guiness for St Patrick's Day, a merlot with chocolate chips but I opted for Peanut Butter Chip. It was the best peanut butter type of ice cream ever! The actual ice cream was peanut butter with tons of chocolate chips. It was absolutely fantastic and went perfectly with the oreo waffle cone. Excellent combination! Plus, the service was super friendly! It just can't be beat. I'll definitely be back and try more flavors...make take a couple of pints home next time!

Bobtail rocks my socks off.  They have awesome flavors full of tasty goodness - real Oreos in the cookies & cream, real wine in the "signature sunset" merlot flavor, and real girl scouts in the Thin Mint ice cream.  They make their own ice cream on site - how neat! Don't forget to submit your own flavor idea!  Mine looked so good by the time I was done coloring that I'm sure I've got April in the bag, or the cone, as it were. And though I didn't think it was possible, the staff makes ice cream even more fun.  They clearly love being there, or they're amazing fakers because they seemed so happy and cool that I started fantasizing about working there.  Mmmm, ice cream.
The staff is always super friendly and helpful, and they have yummy ice cream. A little pricey, but that's what you should expect when going to a place that makes their own stuff.
I had the Cappuccino yogurt and it was delicious! it was creamy with crunch bits of chocolate and espresso beans! i licked the cup...and I was glad I did!

What do you do on a cold late night with one of your most favorite gal pals???? BOBTAILS! My K introduced me to this spot, which at first glance looks cute, but "hey, its just ice cream" RIGHT? WRONG!!!!!! We shared the turtle ice cream sundae AND played 'Guess Who?' which I never played a child growing up...my thing was rocks and baby chicks. However I had a blast! Sometimes its the simple things in life, like ice cream on a cold day, with a good friend, playing a childhood game! :)
Sure, ice cream and summer go hand-in-hand...but in the winter you can eat a whole pint of salted caramel pecan and hide your sins under a bulky sweater.

Bobtail offers consistently awesome flavor combinations - the Lakeview Barhopper and Cubby Crunch are particularly scrumptious, and they always manage to have at least one great specialty option (I'm looking at you, sea salt caramel pecan!). If you're a lover of pumpkin, this should be your autumn destination for some truly delightful pumpkin ice cream. And they have some neat options that I've not seen elsewhere, like lattes served with a scoop of ice cream that some of my friends swear by.  Another perk is the staff, who are as "consistently awesome" as what they serve. They must treat their staff really well, because anyone I've ever met there is in a fantastic mood, ready and willing to help you choose a flavor or just shoot the breeze if business is slow. When I want to pop up the street for a quick bite of something sweet, Bobtail is my destination of choice.
Oh Bobtail, how I love thee! Chat with the friendly staff, try a million flavors, decide on some cubby crunch, then grab a board game, and go to town!

Great ice cream and love the 50's feel.  I go here when I need my lactose-fix and I am never let down.  The shakes are great, too! Try it out! There are few nice places on this road with good ice-cream type things (Paciugo), but this one is the one I choose time and again.
Delicious ice cream. Really warm and fuzzy atmosphere! Felt real old fashion.

YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMM.  I've been hearing about Bobtail for awhile (merlot ice cream?  Hello!) but never quite made it.  Lucky for me (and unfortunately for my bathroom scale), a good friend moved in right up the street.  Despite the windchill bringing the outside temp down to a bone-chilling 19 degrees, we went for ice cream, because we're clearly unbalanced. The first thing I did was try the "Signature Sunset," merlot ice cream studded with dark chocolate chips.  You may have to sit down for this, Yelp.  I did not care for it.  I wanted to like it so very very badly, but I got less the flavor of the wine and more the flavor of alcohol.  Like when orange juice goes bad and it tastes almost fizzy from the fermenting?  Like that.  I was so sad.  But then I tried the "Lakeview Barhopper," chocolate ice cream with Jack Daniels, and I was happy again.   However, I had a craving for s'mores, and I ended up with a s'mores sundae.  Two scoops seemed excessive, but if you ask, they will indeed make you a single-scoop sundae, just the right size. Mine had amazing chocolate ice cream, hot fudge that tasted like a melted Hershey  bar, real marshmallow topping (did not taste like "marshmallow" but actually like marshmallow), graham cracker crumbs, whipped cream, and a cherry.  I'm almost ashamed at how quickly it disappeared before me.  It was so wonderful and so satisfying I wanted to lick the bowl. The atmosphere is very bright and cheerful, with retro signs and at this time of year, Christmas lights.  They also make ice cream-flavored coffee drinks (which may be more appropriate as we sink into single-digits).  And they have a little help-yourself water cooler by the coffee accessories.   The price isn't so bad.  With tax, my single-scoop Heaven sundae was $4.38.  Which is less than you'll pay at Coldstone.  And Coldstone is subpar.

Pumpkin ice cream in the fall from Bobtail is really all that I need in life, other than a freezer and a spoon. The quality is not over-the-top, but it is at the top - a well-deserved four stars.  Acquisition tip: you can get it at Fogo 2 Go, a collaboration that grew out of mutual admiration that the owners of the two establishments shared for their respective products. Bobtail ice cream pairs with Fogo chicken to make a utility-maximizing way to spend $10 on food in the Lakeview area.
Just a regular little ice cream shop, but what earns it an extra point is the Lakeview Barhopper -- only ice cream I've found made with Jack.

I love nights like this - strolling around Broadway on a chilly Chi night, and stumble on a really cute dessert place like this joint - think old school ice cream shoppe meets alice in wonderland.  Couldnt help ourselves so went in and had the cappucino froyo ( cinnamon with chunks of chocolate) and a pink specialty flavor of the day (strawberry ice cream with marshmallow fluff) - soooo good!   Plus the woman behind the counter was cheery and as sweet as can be, offering us each multiple tastes as we narrowed down our flavors.  Love this place!

Bobtail consistently serves up delicious, creamy, rich ice cream.  The sort of treat that tastes like it was made from quality ingredients that I can easily pronounce and could find at the local market.  The place is compact, but tidy.  The employees tend to be friendly and efficient, without being pushy. I have two gripes with Bobtail.  The first is the cost.  I get that ingredients and overhead put them back a fair amount, but it still seems kind of expensive - particularly for anything beyond a scoop of ice cream.  That being said, their servings are reasonably sized.  My other gripe with Bobtail is that 90% of what they offer is really rich and decadent.  I get that I'm going there for ice cream, but sometimes I want a little subtlety in my treats.  More fruit, less chocolate.  For me, it's very much a meal ender or substitute, versus a snack or interlude.   When I am in the mood for something rich and decadent, their peanut butter chip ice cream with hot fudge sauce never lets me down.

I agree with Kat S that Bobtail feels like an "old fashioned soda shop" - not many places can trigger nostalgia for something that I never originally experienced. Bobtail provides unusual flavors of ice cream, and also carries waffle cones and makes milkshakes. Yes, the inside is small seating-wise, but they have a nice outdoor seating area to people-watch along Broadway. I have had positive experiences with the friendly staff allowing me to sample.  Their late hours are also a plus - which makes Bobtail a perfect destination when taking a late-night stroll through the neighborhood. They would get 5 stars if they could provide more dairy-free options (lactose intolerant people can't have frozen yogurt) and perhaps a "discount day" so the prices aren't ALWAYS so high.

Ice cream in October? you betcha. Bought the $4 for $8 groupon thinking we would hang on to it til the spring but the mood struck on Halloween and we went to check it out.  Its set up like a cute old fashioned soda shop, not very big but charming for sure. The choices on the menu are a nice mix of classic and creative.   I'm boring- and was hungover- so i was safe and got the Daley Addiction, vanilla with fudge swirl. it was wonderful. My partner in crime got a pumpkin ice cream milkshake and loved it, couldn't stop talking about it.  The price was a bit much for me- $10 for a milkshake and a single scoop? i know its lakeview but come on, its milk and sugar.

A great place for people in the mood for authentic and inventive ice cream. Although the flavors options are standard, it offers a warm and nostalgic environment with quality homemade ice cream from natural ingredients unmatched from those I've had in the recent memory. There are also sundae and shake options. There are indoor seating and two benches outside. The price is fair, but worth it.  What we had: Pumpkin sundae - featured flavor that my wife loved Apple cinnamon on a sugar cone - featured flavor that I recommend  When we went: 8 PM on Friday night (not so busy) Will we return: - definitely to try out their signature ice creams

I've only been here once, so I haven't tried all the flavors, but their pumpkin ice cream tastes just like pumpkin pie in a scoop. I tried the steamer with the pumpkin ice cream, and it hit the spot on a chilly autumn day. The service and staff were great as well. A lovely local spot for delicious ice cream treats!

It's a personal failure for me to have loved something for so long and not yelped about it. Bobtail Soda Fountain aka Paradise is JUST ABOUT as good as it gets. Bobtail's Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip ice cream could amble over a pick a fair fight with Scooter's coconut custard concrete* (think Pacino vs. Dinero). Their chocolate is some kind of temperature controlled daydream - it melts when it hits your tongue instead of sitting all waxy and indignant in your molars.  I'm sure there are other flavors and delicacies available - I know they have a menu board full of options, but I can't bring myself to abandon my standby. Even though their steamers (STEAMED ICE CREAM, SAY WHAAAT?) sound amaaaazing. One day, Bobtail. One day I'll be spontaneous. One day I'll let you melt my ice cream BEFORE I eat...er, drink it it. Awkward. Since I mentioned Scooter's, I'll give you two reasons to root for Bobtail:  (1) Bobtail's open year round. Year round!!! (2) Bobtail's service has a lot more charm.
gotta love that cubby crunch ice cream when it's 80 degrees in the middle of october!!!! =P

They make their own ice cream and although they're pretty good, it wouldn't hurt to have regular flavors like chocolate and vanilla! They have a couple of ice creams that seem kinda funky but I guess if they have it there for a couple of weeks, means they're good! If you're looking for something different and are feeling adventurous, this might be the place for you!

One of the best ice-cream shops in the city. They sell a wide array of their own delicious/ creative flavors. I highly recommend the Merlot w/ dark chocolate, it sounds odd but taste AMAZING!  They have lots of boardgames inside and plenty of seating outside, plus they stay open late.

Once upon a time I spent a good deal of time in a theatre nearby so if you want some delicious bit of cold wonderful ice cream come here.  Also if you want something warm to keep you up at night; warm or cold stop by Bobtail!

One of my favorite things to do in the summer is to walk along Broadway Ave. and choose from a variety of restaurants and ice cream shops. But Bobtail happen to be an excellent dessert spot that I love to visit. I've tried several of their ice creams and they are all super creamy. My favorite has to be pistachio and butter pecan. There's not a whole lot of seating area inside the shop but there's some outside, which is perfect for a nice sunny day. Definitely stop by if you get a chance!

This is a fun neighborhood spot with great ice cream treats. The Cubby Bear Crunch ice cream is by far my favorite, but the butter pecan is close behind. This place would be a "10" in my book if they had chocolate chips as a topping.

I used to live in the neighborhood but I never made a trip to the shop.  On a whim (and craving ice cream) I decided to make the drive.  The service was fine but the ice cream was rather bland.  I ended up settling on the pistachio flavored ice cream and only consumed a 1/6 before throwing the rest away. I was disappointed, was it an off day?

Would it be bad if I said I liked McDonald's chocolate shakes better? I just felt like I was drinking a cold glass of chocolate milk, not a rich, creamy chocolate milkshake. Never again will I waste the calories, or the money. Sorry!!

Totally salvaged dinner/date night. My +1 had a cup of cappucino...errr late...err mocha something good, tasted like iced coffee with cinamon. If she ain't happy ain't nooobodyyyy happy.....well that's not true because..wait.... what's that? Is that vitamin D milk ur putting in my Peanut Butter chip milkshake? Ohhh fatkid likeeeeeyyyyyyyyy. Homemade, creamy, delicious, peanutbuttery flavor.  Perf.
Great neighborhood ice cream place ... their chocolate shakes are the best!

The staff are super sweet (one recommended a cookies and cream/peanut butter shake that was kind of incredible!) and the $2.99 Thursday shake nights are definitely going to be a weekly tradition for me and my roomies.

Hey there, Sugar Lips. Yea you, see?  So after leavin the gin mill sauced on Mexican giggle juice, me and my pallys hopped over to the Bobtail, see? It was lotsa dames and joes, minus the crumb panning for tin, outside the place chowing down which blew our wigs about goin in. We's gets in there and it was nostalgia!  Cute as a bug's ear, I tells ya. Reminds me of when alligators used to head to the clip joint to jolly up.  Aces! I was dizzy on the menu, but swell on the S'mores Sundae, see? All the way (chocolate  ice cream and hot fudge) w/ marshmallow topping,  graham cracker crumbs, whipped cream  and cherries to top it off. Murder! A lil over a lincoln, but less than a sawbuck. And man, was it juicy!  Too much for just one doll though. Didn't matter, cause when re-enacting a funny story to my pallys, it laid a honey cooler to the ground. :-/  What a brodie, but it was  like fate was talkin to me, see?  Do yourself a fava & get ya tail in Bobtail for some  keen ice cream. Tell em Aise the Spice sent ya, see?

Busy night full of people. Really nice neighborhood reminds me of an ice cream shop where I grew up...and that's just the much-needed comfort on a peaceful summer night. Debated the merlot ice cream again, decided to get some chocolate cinnamon coffee yogurt creation that was surprisingly tasty.

Seems like a lot of these Bobtails, as well as other ice cream vendors in LV and LP closed down in recent years.  I hope that Bobtail isn't one of those.  While the icre cream itself doesn't necessarily astonish me, it's a very friendly place, is easy on the eyes and feels like it belongs in the neighborhood.  That stretch of Broadway is a pleasant area to walk and slurp on a summer evening, and the plasticity of Paciugo north of Melrose isn't cutting it for me.

"Keep it moving!" A great line from "I Love Lucy" and Bobtail is no exception to this quote. We were there on a hot Saturday in June with the Chicago Chocolate Tours (see review) and they got us in and out but you have to know what you want; no hemming and hawing. We had a coupon for a free scoop of Blago's Blues, a blueberry ice cream treat that was oh so good and also our tastings of macadamia nut vanilla, bourbon chocolate, merlot wine and one other - must not have made an impression... The seating area in the front was small, only a few tables and the outdoor seating area was only six tables strong, corralled into a small area. For the six of us CCT goers, it was tight. Still, nice to see an old established building that once was a drug store being used for an ice cream shop.  Anyway when in the area, we'll be back! Get out your wipees, the scoops are HUGE and delicious!

Wish the place was a little cleaner, but I do love their vanilla shake made with a banana....truly a delicious treat.  Peanut butter flavor is also very good.  Would agree that the ice cream is not robustly flavored, but that is fine by me.  It is more expensive than McD's and CVS, as other reviews have stated, but I think you are getting something of better quality here, and the prices are not out of line for any of the ice cream shops I've been to, and I have visited more than my fair share.
Best. Ice Cream. Ever. Obsessed with Vanilla Chip... Friendly staff and great atmosphere too!

Little ice cream parlor close to the lakefront. Decent selection of flavors and other ice cream dishes. It's on the smaller side and parking in the neighborhood is a little hard to come by. But with ice cream parlors being few and fair in between it's nice to have options other than Baskin-Robbins..

I've walked past here many, many times and have always wanted to try it. I finally stopped in the other day-can't believe I haven't tried it yet! My mom, sister and I split the double in a waffle cone.  We got the mint chocolate chip.  The ice cream was very creamy and I couldn't get enough of it!! This was the perfect treat to a warm day.  I can't wait to go back and eat it again.

I've been here on three separate occasions, and have yet to be impressed. The service is fine, but the ice cream lacks flavor. I got a chocolate malt, and that didn't even taste like chocolate (though it's hard to get malt wrong.) The cookie dough ice cream just sucks. I broke Lent on an anniversary for a Sundae there. I wish I hadn't. I do enjoy their board games, but anyone who has ever had Graeters or Aglamesis (or UDF for that matter) knows what the bar should be for good ice cream.  No wonder Oprah's favorite ice cream was from Cincinnati.
Nice place, good ice-cream, open late, and board games to play while enjoying the ice-cream!

I loooove sweets and the fact that there was a place in the area that was devoted to ice cream was so amazing that I had to check it out.  The first time I went in Bobtail, I grabbed a smoothie for like 3 something dollars and it was good. Wasn't mindblowing or anything but it was a good price for the amount. The next visit was to grab some cookies and cream ice cream. I realized it was around 2-3$ for a scoop. I was kind of turned off at that. The ice cream was pretty good, but the scoop wasn't $3 worthy. I mean, I could go to CVS a block away and get more ice cream for the same price. I would rate Bobtail so much better if it were a bit cheaper. I'd come again for the smoothies, though.

Bobtail is like a small town, neighborhood ice cream parlor that's been transplanted into Lakeview. They make handmade ice cream, fantastic milkshakes, and special in Chicago-themed combos. It's also a great spot post-date or to take the kids; they have a bookcase of board games to play while you finish your cone. Aside from the standard flavors, they also have some unusual weekly selections that are often invented by customers. I usually get the Lakeview Barhopper which is dark chocolate ice cream laced with Jack Daniels (so so good) but recently branched out to try a vanilla milkshake with banana and it was awesome too!
Expensive but worth it if you need an ice cream fix. I always get the cookies n'  cream in a bowl, which is fantastic. The staff is very nice about giving you samples before you decide.

I LOVE BOBTAIL.  My biggest complaint is that it's so close to my apartment, I eat it way too much! I typically get the peanut butter milkshake, but I've also tried the cookie dough, mint chocolate chip and their specials.  I've never had something I didn't love.  Definitely one of the best ice cream spots in Chicago, and not that pricey.

Are f..ing kidding me? 7 bucks for 2 scoops and 1 topping!?!?!?! Very bland flavour. And do they know how to make yoghurt based ice cream: it is supposed to be light and fluffy .Man, I get a better bang for the buck at McDonalds.

Bobtail is a tiny, tiny ice cream shop. Their selection isn't mind-blowing.  They do have a few alcohol-infused items or treats with coffee in them, but I just ended up with a mint chip cone.  It was good.  Nothing to blow you away.  Just solid ice cream. Perhaps if I'd been more adventurous, I could kick it up a few stars, but based on my cone, Bobtail did the job.  Solid, but unspectacular.  If I'm in the neighborhood, I might be back, but it's not a destination by itself.

Chicago is a great city for diverse high-quality food, but ice-cream is not one of its areas of excellence. Is Bobtail one of the best ice-cream spots in the city? Yes. Does it have amazing ice-cream? No, not really. This place is located in the heart of Lakeview, making it a convenient stop during some window shopping, after-dinner dessert, or post-movie snack. They make their own ice-cream, feature different flavors every month, and have a (slowly) rotating selection. However, the ice-cream itself is not very good. I would describe most flavors as different hints of "off-vanilla". Like, vanilla with the tiniest hint of pistachio thrown in. Or vanilla with a trace of orange. Or vanilla with a suggestion of merlot. Even the chocolate ice-cream is not very rich or full. The texture varies greatly. On some days it seems fresh and creamy. On other days it has borderline freezer-burn -- not cool for a place that makes its own ice-cream. Overall, definitely worth a stop, among the best you can get in the city, but don't get your expectations up.

Just moved in down the street from this place - it was 90 degrees and there was no way I was going a step further without something cold. I tried the brownie sunday and it did the trick, but left way too sugary of an aftertaste. Maybe that's because I don't eat much sugar, or maybe it's because I went for the motherlode of sugary treats, but on a day when it's not so hot or I have more time, I'd rather walk the extra distance to Whole Foods to get a scoop of gelato.

- Dutch chocolate ice cream infused with Jack Daniels - Open late in summers - Treats hilariously named after Lakeview institutions - Rotating flavors - Rewards punch cards - Boards games  Absolute perfection.

Hot cookie sundae  with  three scoops. Cookies and cream Espresso chip Hot fudge and caramel MMM sooo good! The cookies is all warm but gets kinda hard if you don't gobble it up. Nice area.  I would go again and try everything!

Ice cream is really good, but the hot fudge sundaes are to die for.  The staff is always super friendly and helpful, and will let you sample whatever you want (even when they are super busy, which I feel kind of bad about).  On a hot day, be prepared for a line out the door, as everyone knows this place rocks! Also ask for the "frequent buyer" card.  They stamp it every ice cream or drink you get and you get your 10th free (and you can get whatever you want, aside from cakes).
super awesome, mega creamy and delicious home made ice cream.   you can get cones in the store or pints to go.  SO GOOD!

Bobtail is the ice cream store we all want to love and see succeed. The ice cream is great. However, the store is absolutely filthy. The floors are sticky (and smelly - as in urine smelly). There are piles of crumbs and napkins all over the place. What I can't understand is why there are 4 people behind the counter and nobody to keep the place clean. There's no reason for it be in such a condition. There is lots of ice cream competition in Lakeview. I think I'll stay with Nuts on Clark.

After a trip to wing out faces out at Crisp, I proposed heading on up to Windy City Sweets but the cold preordained that a four block walk would likely end in disaster and disgruntled friends. Instead, it was pointed out there there was an ice cream parlor right across the street: hooray!! I don't know much about ice cream and don't even buy ice cream on any regular basis, but when I get it I like to know when it's done right. I ordered a chocolate ice cream and couldn't resist getting a giant waffle cone with chocolate and almonds on it. For $4 and some change, I bit into a crunchy waffle cone and the almonds heightened the crunch and the ice cream was deeeeeeelicious. There was room to sit but I stood and enjoyed my treat. We enjoyed watching a new employee being hazed by running into the street and giving away ice cream. There were board games and there were crayons for people to make their own ice cream flavor. One child made a monkey ice cream picture and it was very cute. Bobtail is a great spot for ice cream and even better if you have kids!

You're never too full for dessert, especially when it is ice cream from Bobtail.  The ice cream is so creamy and tasty.  I had the cookies and cream ice cream and my husband had the cubby crunch.  You can get a sprinkle cone, an oreo cone, and you still have the old school option for a sugar or cake cone.  Outstanding ice cream.  Nothing like you can ever buy in the grocery store.

This place gets crazy busy so be prepared to wait in line.  I came with a group on a chocolate tour and we were able to try the white chocolate with macadamia nuts, chocolate with jack daniels, and chocolate chips with merlot ice cream.  I am not a drinker and hate the taste of alcohol, but my favorite ice cream was the one with merlot! What a surprise!! They also serve coffee and shakes here. A new location near Millennium Park will open soon so keep a look out!
Delicious ice cream and super friendly staff! I love it. Not much I can say that other people haven't. Also, awesome selection of flavors.

Still reliably good, but it seems as if I oftentimes come here as a second or third choice.  Last year right before Christmas, I went somewhere for a seasonal milkshake flavor--peppermint--but I had the wrong place.  By then I had a strong craving and ended up at Bobtail, where they hooked me up with a dish of peppermint ice cream with hot fudge.  Majorly awesomely hit the spot.  Today I wanted Italian ice, but my first two attempts were closed, and since the sky was opening up, I ducked into Bobtail and "settled" for a scoop of Thin Mint.  It's like a cross between mint chip and cookies and cream--a milder mint flavor and some big cookie pieces.  There's even a little sign that says "No Girl Scouts were harmed in the making of this ice cream."  (No, I made that up.  Bobtail and GSA, please do not sue me.) Folks are always friendly in here, and they throw enough new flavors into the mix every so often, enough to keep it interesting.  I love that if I want to sit down and linger (like today when I was waiting out the rain) for most of the time I am usually the only person in the shop.
There's pretty much nothing to complain about here.  Good ice cream.  There was a line, but it was a fast line.  A lot of different options.  Yeah.  Ice cream.  There you go.

It's a shame that a cute place like this has to be so incredibly overpriced.  I got the term correct: Not expensive...overpriced. $5.17 for a small cereal bowl of three flavors. To me, ice cream should be around a dollar a scoop.  Sure, it's "homemade" and all, but...well, I'm not going to ramble on. Suffice it to say that while Bobtail has a cute interior, accepts credit cards without one of those irritating "minimum charge" signs, and has a few tasty flavors, so do grocery stores. [Editorial note: Attention restaurants: it is illegal to call anything in your shop "homemade" unless whatever home you made it in is licensed and has been checked by the Dept. of Health.]

Homemade ice cream!  1950's soda fountain atmosphere!  Board games! I think you get the idea.  This place is just fun.  On top of that, the ice cream is phenomenal.  My favorite flavors are Lakeview Barhopper (Double Chocolate with Jack Daniels flavoring) and Cub Crunch (Vanilla with sprinkles, toffee, oreo, and other goodness).  This place is relatively cheap, and they give you a good portion for your money compared to places like Cold Stone.  If you are in Lakeview/Lincoln Park I seriously recommend this!  Free whipped cream and cherries!  Now, go get fat.

My name is Patrick and I have a problem. That problem is being a chronic lover of ice cream. Not frozen yogurt or any of that low fat/low sugar nonsense. Real honest ice cream that makes the seams on my pants beg me to stop after the fourth scoop. And Bobtails has the richest and creamiest ice cream I've had in a long time. So some quick favorites... the peanut butter chocolate chip. The peanut butter is more mild so it doesn't overpower the chocolate. I'm also a huge fan of the merlot and the mint chip. They also have seasonal flavors all the time.  The best part about Bobtails is that they make it all there! It has an unparalleled freshness to it that can't be described. The only drawback (but not worth removing one of the stars for) is the lengthy line that greets you when you arrive on a bilstering summer evening. It moves quickly, though, and the tasty scoop of heaven is rarely delayed.

Worth it, but not the best. I've been to Bobtail quite a few times, and I like it okay.  It's not the best ice cream that I've ever tasted, but they have pretty good toppings. Likes:  The S'mores sundae is quite possibly the best sundae that I've ever eaten!  The menu is diverse, and the shakes and sundaes are very good.  It also has very friendly staff, and that's been true every time I've been there, regardless of who was working. Dislikes:  Really just some minor complaints...  It's a bit pricey (at least to me, nearly $7 for a specialty milkshake is not terribly cheap anyway), but it's worth it every now and then.  It's something like six bucks for a pint, which is high considering the overall lack of flavor their ice cream has when served without toppings.  There's not a ton of seating, but I've only seen the placed packed a couple times.  I'd really prefer if it closed at 11pmtoo, but they shut the doors promptly at 10.  The atmosphere won't blow you away - not quite old fashioned soda shop style, though I think that's what they're trying for.  Really it's a bit too modern looking to pull that off, but no biggie. Regardless of a couple minor dislikes though, it's an okay eat.  Frankly, I'd say their toppings are better than the ice cream flavor itself (which is slightly bland if eaten alone), so indulge in something crazy.   All in all, their flavors don't totally blow me away, but I like the place.  It's a good stop if you're in the area & craving some ice cream, but don't go out of your way.
The merlo ice cream was DIVINE. I would come back for exotic/out of the box ice cream flavors.

Bobtail's ice cream is so good it's worth risking hypothermia to enjoy it in the winter. The Bobtail Ice Cream shop looks the way you imagine the perfect ice cream shop to look -- straight out of Pleasantville or Small Town, USA. The menu offers the usual sundaes, shakes and scoops, plus several coffee/ice cream drinks. You can also purchase a pint of their ice cream to take home. My favorite flavor is the Cubby Crunch, with vanilla ice cream, sprinkles, oreos, chocolate chips and toffee pieces. For a scoop and a shake, we paid about $9, which seems reasonable given the quality of the ice cream and the atmosphere. If you're shake lover, check out Bobtail on Tuesdays and Thursdays for their shake specials.

I recently went to Bobtail with someone and we ordered 2 waffle cones, each with 2 scoops.  I left very disappointed and here is why: Price: Two cones with 2 scoops each cost me $9.50.  I understand that the ice cream is made on site, and therefore of supposed higher quality.  However, $9.50 for 2 cones is outrageous, especially when the quality is not very good.  Taste: The ice cream was not good.  Instead of being creamy, the way ice cream should be, it was crystalized; as if it had been in the freezer for months.  In addition, the cookies n' cream did not have enough cookies in it, though I would be willing to overlook this if the ice cream itself had been good.  And having lived in Madison, WI, where excellent, locally produced ice cream is abundant, I have a good pulse on what good ice cream should taste like.   Service: The service was good.  The staff was attentive and let us sample different flavors, much like in a gelato shop.  Unfortunately, the ice cream was not up to par with the service and ultimately, I would have been much better off going to Pacciugo a block down the street where I get a higher quality product for rougly the same price, if not cheaper.

This place is excellent.  I have been coming to Bobtail's fairly regularly since they opened many years ago.  It started off great and it has gotten even better since then.  The staff are all friendly and helpful and the ice cream is delicious.  Cheap shakes on Tuesdays and Thursdays make my week. The only downside is that I would probably be about 10 pounds lighter if I wasn't such a regular customer.

I like to consider myself a connoisseur of ice cream, although i don't usually find myself buying hard ice cream often by the scoop.  Bobtail is such an exception to that rule for me! They atmosphere is that of an old fashioned ice cream shop (pretending i know what that actually used to look like) that is cozy and tucked into boys-town on the corner of wellington and Broadway.  The ice cream may seem pricey but thats because its so amazing and HOMEMADE. Coming from a cheap person in general, shut up and spend the extra dollar something on 2 scoops. Its worth it.  The cubby bear crunch is my personal favorite but there are plenty of good combinations and flavors to choose from.  Whether its winter or summer this is always the perfect place to stop in for a cold, sweet treat!

I've been here a few times for their hot chocolates - I've had hazelnut which was really good, tried raspberry which was ok but probably not my favorite, and most recently I had white chocolate which was really good as well. Best of all it comes with marshmallows and whipped cream :) I've sampled some of the ice cream but I'll have to come back during the summer to fully enjoy it. The staff there have always been friendly on every visit.

I was never an ice cream person but Chicago really got me into it, especially during the summer. This place is amazing mostly for the atmosphere, it's the kind of quaint place you've always fantasized about going to where you sit outside watching cute dogs pass by eating an ice cream cone. I love the vanilla bean though the chocolate is kind of okay. It's very homey and inviting, although once in a blue moon you have to avoid the crowds of kids. It's just the cutest place.

Is it fair to write a review about an ice cream place you visited when the temperature was in the single digits and all you had was a latte?  Maybe not, but I'm going to anyway.  I promise, Bobtail, if I am in the area when it is hot out, I will give you a second chance, but for now... I went here with my girlfriend Diana and her mom.  Diana and I got ice cream lattes (lattes made with any of their ice cream flavors) and her mom got a hot chocolate.  After we ordered, I noticed that the man who took our order had a Star Wars symbol tattooed on each arm.  One was the symbol of the Rebellion, the other the symbol of the Empire.  These conflicting images made me suspicious of his motives.  When I showed Diana she simply responded, "It's a trap!"  I think she was right.  First of all, Diana ordered the peppermint stick latte, which apparently was a holiday flavor that had been discontinued and they had never taken it off the board.  That alone makes me think maybe they don't sell many of those ice cream lattes, as no one had noticed it yet.  So we each got the mint chip.  The coffee tasted burnt, bitter and stale.  That was a major disappointment, because whenever I got some of the chocolate mint chips, I thought they were delicious, and it made me wish it were warmer so I could try the ice cream.  Diana's mom said her hot chocolate tasted funny, and Diana agreed.  I would not recommend the mint chip ice cream latte at all.  I do, however, intend to be back for the ice cream some day.

I love Bobtail.  It is only a few blocks away and they have some of my favorite ice cream.  The only reasons they got a four rather than a five is that they don't seem to have as many ice cream choices as many ice cream shops.  Not a problem for me, because everything they have is delicious.  Also, they do not have a lot of indoor seating, but in the summers they have a nice seating area outside.

Yeah, I'm crazy.  I eat ice cream when it's 4 degrees out.  I can't help it when it's Eggnog flavored and heavenly!  The place was cute and clean, service friendly.  Parking was frustrating and I just didn't want to pay that much, hence the 4 stars.

I think I've gotta try Bobtail a few more times ... so let's just call this review a 'first impression'. Super friendly service, pretty decent ice cream. I tried the Daley Addiction (vanilla ice cream with caramel-fudge swirls) and I tasted my friend's chocolate ... They were pretty tasty, but I can't really picture myself craving ice cream and automatically start thinking Bobtail Ice Cream. They get an 'S' for 'Satisfactory'.

I love this place. First of all, it's adorable. Combine the look of an old fashioned soda fountain with some board games, cute tables, and an ambience that's hard to beat in an ice cream shop....  Secondly, their ice cream... Mmmm. I've been here 3 times total now. The first, I tried the pumpkin ice cream. Yum. Then, a vanilla shake (Shakes are $2.99 on Tuesday and Thursday) and the third time I had the Cubby Crunch in the form of a milkshake... oh my gosh, best flavor ever.  It was a little much as a shake b/c my straw kept getting clogged with all the goodies :) But, nonetheless, flavors were awesome. I will admit the prices are high, but I don't blame them for doing it. The place is adorable, and the line is still out the door.  Plus, they do have some good deals now and then ($2.00 root beer floats). Oh and one last thing, they serve intelligentsia coffee! Awesome! I just got coffee, but, they do have several options to mix their ice cream flavors with coffee, etc.  Anyway, Bobtail is adorable, and delicious!

Problem #1 - They were sold out of either cookies or hot fudge...can't remember which.  But in either case, the brownie sundae that both of were craving just wasn't gonna happen.  This is at 4:30 on a Monday.   Problem #2 - Merlot ice cream was disappointing.  Not much flavor and had turned to liquid within the 3 minutes it took to walk down the street.   Problem #3 - Uhh, I don't know how to say this discreetly but the place smelled like pee.  Believe me, I live in San Francisco and walk by the bus terminal every morning, so I know the smell of human urine quite well.   Nasty. Cute shop, but think I'd rather be out in the suburbs hitting Cold Stone.

I feel like this place exposes me as a fraud. This all natural, homemade ice cream tastes like NOTHING. Seriously, nothing to me. Where is the chocolate, where is that rich delicious flavor???? I love the shop - its beyond adorable and always has the cutest kids ever in it. Their staff is helpful and friendly, which is almost unheard of in a trendy little shop like this. The prices are high (but not beyond what is to be expected) and seating is limited. But I just can't get past the total lack of flavor. I'm sorry Bobtail, I guess it going to be Edy's Grand again for me tonight ;)

First Treats, then Coldstone. All my favorite ice cream places in the neighborhood...gone. I had to find a new one, it was imperative. And not just a Dairy Queen. No that wouldn't do. So I finally gave Bobtail a chance after seeing in the window that their special was Pumpkin ice cream (the best flavor in the universe). Delicious. And not too expensive either, as most specialty ice cream shops are. They have a lot of unique flavors that I will definitely be going back to try. Plus they give you a frequent visitor card, so after you buy 10 items you get 1 free. Free! Coldstone never gave me that. Thank you Bobtail for filling the ice cream-loving void in my heart.

I must say I love this place! It's fantastic. I first found out about this place by eating at Wilde up the street. They serve their Ice Cream Pie that I absolutely love! The staff here is always CHIPPER and HAPPY! It just makes you want to come back. Yesterday I ordered a mint Oreo shake and it was stellar! My other 2 friends both had cups and they were equally enjoyable. I defiantly love the nostalgia of this place too...it's old fashioned.  You cant go wrong..it's better than Cold Stone and BR!  Give it a shot!

I have to give Bobtail mad props for their pumpkin ice cream.  I had it in a waffle cone all by itself and it was awesome.  (Actually, better than the pumpkin fro yo at Red Mango). Hope they have this flavor for a while cause I'll be coming back for it.

Good ice cream, soda fountain drinks, old-school games like checkers and connect four, this is a great place. But this review is all about the pumpkin ice cream I tried over the weekend.  I'm not even a big pumpkin person, per se, but it was fantastic.  Not too nutmeggy or spiced....and will be awesome come holiday time over some pie.  5 stars!

I have always been a big fan of this place. I used to live right around the block at Barry and Pinegrove, and passed by this place every time I went to the Wellington train station, but never stopped in. The first time I went here was my first "date" with my wife. Didn't really know what to expect, but damn, I think we scarfed down two banana splits and were still craving more. This is definitely one of those places that will give you a stomach ache if you stick around long enough. But its an ache that is well deserved. Haven't tried much else from here, and sadly, haven't gone back in quite some time now, but its still a favorite of mine.

Pretty good ice-cream. Not great, I'm going to go out of my way to get some, but pretty good. The merlot chocolate chip was tasty but could have been richer in flavor in my humble opinion. Mint chip was good. In both instances, the chips were not overly large as is a common drawback elsewhere. I was pleased to see that neither the mint or pistachio were bright green - a dead giveaway of artificial coloring and usually an indicator of sub-par flavor. If I'm in the vicinity and have a hankering for ice-cream I'll return.
Summer special: Honey Lavender.  Holy cow it's good.

WOW!! summer special= coffee oreo milkshake....amazing! nothing less than stellar and i don't even consider myself to be a huge milkshake person but for coffee ice cream i thought i would give it a go. and i was glad i did b/c it was delish! i don't know how long it will be around b/c it sounded like a summer special flavor so go in and get one while they still have it!

They must put something in their cookies & cream ice cream to make it taste that damn good!!!! At least that's what I tell myself everytime I drop $3 on a single-scoop in a cup, instead of going to the grocery store and just buying a pint of it! It's ok, winter's coming in Chicago and my need (see: desire) for ice cream will drop off significantly pretty soon. Quick sidenote: I looked at my bank account online and I've been charged differing amounts for the same thing almost everytime I go in.... Varying from $3.19 to $3.30. How much is a single-scoop in a cup anyways?

Oh my friendly little Bobtail.....how you make me smile. Even when I don't enter your door, you have a nice, pleasing effect on me when walking by...... I love your peanut butter chip ice cream, and your cookies-and-cream is tasty, too. Your turtle sundae really comforted me in a time of heartbreak, which has endeared you to me eternally. You are my go-to place when I need some icy goodness, and your hot cocoa is on my Lakeview to-do list. Keep on keepin' on, Bobtail. You are my ice cream hero!
Bobtail, your ice cream is SO GOOD that I will forgive you for smelling like a Chicago Parks District men's bathroom.

I wanted to love this place! My sis and I drove out of our way to experience Bobtail.  We were so excited after hearing such great things about this neighborhood ice cream shop. Upon entering, the staff was not very cordial....basically like, "What do you want."  Forgivable considering it was late at night.  Yet the ice cream was runny!  Not forgivable!  I'm sorry but ice cream should be hard and cold.  Not runny and goopy.  It's an easy fix, just put your ice cream cooler on a lower temperature.   So I threw my ice cream away after a couple bites (it was either that or having to drink it) and walked away sad....

I had dragged myself up to Lakeview by warrant of Tylenol but now my hangover was kicking in. I had the following conversation (it was pretty one-sided): "I want pancakes!" "ooh, i don't want pancakes any more, i want a freezer pop!" (ate ice pop) "I want pancakes again" "mmmmm pizza" "do you have any graham crackers?" "that frozen custard we had in Milwaukee was really good..." "ICE CREAM!" So we had Bobtail. I couldn't resist ice cream with my two favourite things in: bourbon and chocolate. Hair of the dog and all that. Sadly, there was no flavour of bourbon that I could detect, BUT my enormous sprinkle cone more than made up for it. I loved the shop and its colourful (and extensive) menus (not a place for someone who is chronically indecisive!), and the fact they let you try the ice creams before you pick.  I tried a couple of others and would go back for the Merlot one, but the cappuccino one was awful. My friend had the white chocolate and macadamia but and I was very jealous.... we enjoyed ours on the patio and I was revitalised. I've had better ice cream but it's a nice place.

I consider myself a HUGE ice cream connoisseur and I found Bobtail to be just meh. I've had several of the more complicated concoctions and they failed me. I now just stick with the good ol' cookies and cream in a sugar cone...which satisfies me just fine.

My mom is visiting from out of town, and she wanted some ice cream. Fro-yo was not going to cut it. Ice cream choices in the hood are Bobtail and Cold Stone Creamery. I was excited to go to Bobtail since its cute and it's supposed to be good. Cute it is. Good? Kinda. My mom orders a scoop of vanilla ice cream with chocolate syrup. How can you mess that up? I'll tell you: a half full cup of melted vanilla ice cream swimming in entirely too much sickly sweet chocolate syrup. It was about 66 degrees outside so there is no excuse for soupy ice cream. Drowned in syrup like a 7 year old kid would serve it. I couldn't believe this lady handed that to my mom. My scoop of Cubby whatever flavor they call it looked a lot better. I didn't really want it, just ordered it to have something to do. Its a good thing because then I gave it to my mom since her ice cream reminded me of how when I was young, my cousin would put chocolate ice cream in the microwave. I didn't say anything about that memory because then things would get too weird and emotional about how time flies. And to Bobtail's credit, the messy ice cream cup and my mom not complaining was oddly appropriate. But seriously, you handed that mess to my mom?!?Shame on you.

So after a hardcore late dinner at SSGS I was craving some sweets, and began driving around Chicago looking for somewhere open at 10:30 PM. Sensational Bites? Fail. Molly's? Fail. Phoebe's? Fail.  and right around Diversey/Clark I had an epiphany: BOBTAIL. Oh, Bobtail. I had two scoops of "Lincoln Park Zoo" - strawberry with sprinkles and frosted animal crackers, and a Cappucino Crunch Yogurt. Boyfriend had a shake with Daley something, and the bill came out to $8.80. The wallet is a little sore after that and Korean BBQ for two, but man, it was totally worth it. I got to try a "signature sunset" - merlot ice cream and chocolate chips. Such an adorable old-fashioned ice cream parlor.

this is a rather interesting ice cream place. flavors are things like strawberry with sprinkles and animal crackers or chocolate with jack daniels. i got the cappucino yogurt and while i dislike coffee itself, the yogurt was really flavorful and had a nice contrast with chocolate chunks. i also sampled some of the other flavors, and all were nicely done. the chocolate is of a really good quality, which always makes a difference in ice cream! extra points for the outside terrace seating. the place was pretty busy with a consistent stream of people, and it was really nice to see people sort of gathered around-- definitely had a local business feel to it.  service was also great. i wouldnt say this is the best ice cream ive ever had, but id be back for the originality of the flavors, the service with a smile, and the atmosphere.

As a hard serve ice cream lover, I really wanted to make this "my parlor"  but I can't. I've tried two flavors of ice cream from their lackluster selection. Very average and not very rich. Tasted a little thin, like ice milk to me. I'm struggling to type more; just nothing to say, really.

How did it take me this long to try this place out?   Phenomenal!  My friend and I wanted some frozen treats and as you may have noticed I have been on a frozen treat kick lately with a lean toward the new yogurt places all about town...  My buddy did not want Yogurt he wanted the real deal, we both decided on Bobtails and wow am I glad we did!  What blows my mind is every ice cream I tried was great!  What really blows my mind is how encouraging the staff was when it came to trying even more, my buddy was going to order a shake with some ice cream he had not tried and the girl said but you didn't even try that one, we both quickly tried the peanut butter chip on her command...   I decided on a two scoop with four different types of ice-cream, another mind blower I figured two scoops means two types the girl was quick to let me know I could enjoy up to four different flavors in my two scoop cup, sign me up!   I had peach, the Daley addiction, the merlot infused chocolate chip ecstasy not the official name but it was ecstasy! and the chocolate Jack Daniel's creation they were all amazing flavors!   I will be back again and again I plan on earning a free ice-cream with my ten purchases that are sure to come!  (they have a frequent Bob-tailer card)

Merlot ice cream with chocolate chips is a perfect wine pairing that would make Alpana Singh sing. Next time I will have to order that one. Instead I didn't get anything instead opting to taste leftover creams.The other was strawberry and it was excellent too.  Compared to other ice cream establishments the people in here felt genuinely in good spirits.

Bobtails has ruined my diet.  Whenever I go for a jog, I cannot run past this ice cream store because I know I will jog right in.  This place has old fashion style ice cream.  You know the good stuff that you used to eat when you were younger before the abomination of Frozen Yogurt, Cold Stone artery clog, or berry yogurt crap that every store is imitating.  Espresso, Cookie and Cream, or just plain Chocolate is exactly as you remembered and just as good.   I can't give it 5 star because of the price.  It is a bit overpriced but I guess that's the price of nostalgia.

If you have not tried the Cubby Crunch yet, you have to, it will change your life. Cookies and Cream ice cream with sprinkles, toffee and chocolate bits mixed in. I am usually more of a cake and cookie girl than ice cream, but Cubby Crunch is so good I'd eat it over a cup cake any day of the year.
