Summer, summer, summertime... Time to sit back and unwind... (Good luck getting that song out of your head.) Ok, so for June 2nd it may not exactly FEEL like summertime outside since it's freezing out and most of us have donned our sweaters again...  but Sarah B and I channeled warm weather and decided to go for ice cream anyway. Bobtail is one of those places I always forget about (which is probably a good thing), but whenever I go I walk out saying "yummers!"  Or I'm saying OW! from the inevitable brain freeze. Super cute decor - very old school soda fountain shop with bright colors and fun menu boards and cute tables (and outdoor seating too!).  The service is great and friendly, as it should be.  (Can you really hate your life if you work at an ice cream shop?) The ice cream is super yummy, and I love watching them make it through the window while you wait to place your order.  They'll also give you free samples if you're feeling indecisive which is always helpful.  I got a root beer float and it totally hit the spot, though I could have done with a half size of what I got (note to self - next time inquire about kid's cups).  Sarah ordered a hot fudge sundae, and I won't lie - I had ice cream envy watching her scoop up that hot fudgy goodness. Prices are a little up there...  but can you really put a price on memories of ice cream melting down your hands in the hot summer heat?  I think not!
I love this place! the people are so friendly, the ice cream is delicious AND they have board games.  Definitely check it out!

I love everything about ice cream, and would probably love it more if I weren't lactose intolerant.  That said, I've tried, have been quite dissatisfied, with the Hot Cookie Sundae twice, simply  because the cookie is never, ever hot.  They microwave a cookie that's been sitting on their shelf for what could be days, and after 20 seconds or so, they cover it in ice cream. One would expect that if they re-heated the [stale] cookie adequately, the cold ice cream wouldn't immediately cool the cookie within seconds. But that's what has happened.  I thought the first time might've been an aberration, but after the second time, I resolved that I would go elsewhere for my hot cookie sundaes -- even though my fat ass shouldn't be eating them in the first place.

Bobtail reminds me of a little ice cream shoppe I visited with my grandparents in Scottsdale, Arizona, every summer as a kid.  The Sugar Bowl.  Same old-fashioned seating, same cold tile floor, same nice folks behind the counter...always brings me back. I love Bobtail most because they always have some italian ices (small cup, just less than $3) that taste so authentically like the fruit they're named after and there's not tons of added sugar.  Their ice cream flavors vary and there's really something for everyone here. PS- When I was leaving, I overheard someone ask if the ice cream was made there, on the premises.  They said yes.  Who knew? It's small, and the line is always hard to figure out, but it moves fast and everyone's in the best mood ever.  Hmm...I wonder why???

I love this place.  I love ice cream.  I love waffle cones.  I love chocolate.  I love sprinkles.  I love whipped cream.  I love that I live less than a 5 minute walk away.  There are so many things to love and Bobtail has like 99.9% of them.  I don't care about specials, I don't care about the flavor of the month, and I don't care how much it costs.  Just give me my frozen sugar on a stick and no one will get hurt.  Bobtail is a cure-all for anything that ails you.  What?  You've never been?  Must.  Go.  Immediately.  Stop reading.  Go now.

This place is amazing if you like unique homemade ice cream. This isn't custard or a cold stone type of place; just an old-fashioned soda fountain. They have great shakes, malts, sundaes, and coffee drinks as well as ice cream.  Order any flavor and you won't be disappointed!

I first went to the location in Wilmette, Il and I knew this location would be just as good. I love the cappuccino yogurt-it is light, refreshing, and healthier than their huge whopping scoops of ice cream.  What a great idea! Happy hour for an ice cream shop.  Even better-the cashier determines if your scoop is monstrous enough to be considered adult, if not, yeah discounts!

With the summer coming, I like that I don't live too far from Bobtail. I had a great chocolate milkshake, and it was delicious. They also let me know that they have $2.50 shakes on Tuesdays and Thursdays. The ice cream choices were plentiful and made me want to come back to try other things. Only disappointing thing was that while we were sitting outside on the bench enjoying our ice cream and the sunshine, a guy decided to smoke right next to us. Cigarette smoke and ice cream... not the best combination.

Bobtail is a cute place to take a date and a tasty place to get a shake.  Limited flavors of ice cream just mean that it really is homemade and each flavor is designed carefully.  This place gets packed on a summer day, but you can always come back in the fall.  Their awesome pumpkin ice cream can also become a pumpkin shake!

OK the BF has had Ice cream at like 3 or 4 places this weekend already so tonight he wants Bobtail, and as I know this isn't to be passed up and it was just as good as last time, the pistachio was wonderful and the cappuccino yogurt is really delish  wish i had a freezer they have a monthly beer flavored Ice Cream this month is Guinness but that is in the to go containers so I didn't get to try it  I also saw a ice cream with Jack Daniels in it

I went to Bobtail when I first moved into Lakeview almost 3 years ago. I've been searching for that perfect pistachio ice cream ever since I got back from France in Spring of 2006. I thought I might find it at Bobtail's. Some Two and a half years later, I'm still searching. I don't know if I'll ever find it, I've heard it's something to do with the water over there.  Still, the staff is friendly and obviously well paid, since they're pretty much always happy. They give out free ice cream cones for random things, like because they dig your T-shirt. But, when it all comes down to it, I'd rather live near a Dairy Queen.

There is one and only one thing you can do when your best friend and neighbor calls to say the building has been broken into.  No, not buy an Uzi. No, not cowering behind a guy (Guilty. That was indeed the fifth or sixth thing I did after police report, calling my sister and purchasing skincare products)  It is to buy her something yummy and relaxing and hopefully soothing- Red Wine Ice Cream with yummy dark chocolate pieces thruout also known as Signature Sunset. She made healthy food such as vegetables and salad... but let's face it, When traumatized, indulgence is required.  It helps. I might really, really panic otherwise.  Now I am going to go soothe my fearful, frazzled shoe collection. What? Do these criminals think I have electronics? Diamonds? Pshaw. Signature Sunset is waaaaay more valuable.

This place is pretty fantastic. First and foremost, they have a mural on the side of the building that has an old-time ice cream man and a pigtailed kid eating ice cream. Creepy, but awesome.  Then you go inside and people are hanging out, chatting and playing board games...nice! The staff are friendly and then there's the ice cream....a fat kids dream. My personal favorite is the cookies and cream...but I've not had a flavor I didn't enjoy yet.

Warm and cozy in the Winter, ice cream in the Summer, what's not to love about Bobtail? The owners are really nice and so is everybody else that works here. My favorite thing to order is their grilled cheese. Wow. Or sometimes I'll just get coffee and sit by the window (they have free wi-fi)... great people watching!
I love this place. The ice cream is so good and tastes homemade. I love the atmosphere and the benches outside. The sundaes are amazing! Their merlot ice cream ... no words. delicous.

i had the cubby crunch (vanilla ice cream with a bunch of random crap mixed in) and my boyfriend had the merlot with chocolate chips. both were creamy and delicious but maybe a bit heavy on the mix-ins.

I want to go back to Bobtail Ice Cream immediately!! I tried this place for the first time yesterday and absolutely loved their ice cream! Homemade, creative flavors and a super cute and cozy soda shop!  I had a scoop of the Cubby Crunch- which was vanilla ice cream with rainbow sprinkles, oreos, chocolate chips, and toffee.  It was so delicious and creamy!  It was pretty moderately priced-  way cheaper than places like Coldstone and they even top your ice cream scoop with whipped cream and a cherry on top for free, if you ask.  This place is definitely worth a visit if you're in the mood for a sweet treat.  There are tons of flavors to choose from and they have a variety of desserts, such as italian ice, smores, and drinks, such as steamers, shakes, etc.  Bobtail has a great neighborhood feel and it's a nice little place to sit down and enjoy something sweet!
Love this place. Mango sorbet is my favorite. Not too pricey either. This place is a must.

Extremely charming neighborhood ice cream shop with friendly staff.  Worth the trip just to try their homemade flavors.  The booze inspired ones are fun but my favorite has to be the Cubby Crunch.  Sample a bunch before you decide on a flavor.   Also, they have board games here so if you're drunk and feel like sitting and playing Connect 4 with a friend for an hour...they don't seem to mind.

I think I like the shop more than the ice cream!  Just kidding, but it really is cute inside there- kinda reminds me of the '50s!  I had the strawberry Italian ice and my sister had the cookies and cream waffle cone.  The ice cream was comparable to Baskin Robbins and it was pretty pricey, but the location is reallyyy convenient so I'd say check it out!
Decently priced. Their ice cream flavors are always amazing. I haven't been big on some of them lately but I loved when they used lucky charms.

Most have summed up this place...super friendly staff and good ice cream.  It's hard to improve on that.  I really like some of the flavors they have there - things I've never seen anywhere else. If you've an icecream lover, this is a place to check out.

So many fun memories involving Bobtail. The time I had a horrible day at work, and hopped off the bus (on pure impulse) outside Bobtail - the cookies and cream cheered me up reeeaaallll quick. Summer nights, walking to Bobtail with my partner and poochie, waiting outside on the benches while he gets my milkshake (Daley Addiction). Taking my mom and watching her flip out over the merlot flavor.  Very good ice cream (possibly the best cookies and cream ever? dare I say?), yum milkshakes, banana splits. Memories.

I love their smore milkshake.  It is very tasty with all the elements of a smore really shining through.    The old time feel of the place is awesome and it fits in with the neighborhood well.  Its good to get away from the commercial baskin robbins blah blah blah every once in a while. My only complaint is that it seems expensive for sweets but what do I know.

I am on a PUMPKIN craze and they have PUMPKIN ICE CREAM. For now I'm happy with Bobtail. I have to admit though I think I like the Dreyers Pumpkin Ice Cream a bit more, I think it taste more like pumpkin. Anyways Bobtail has some pretty good ice cream and they stay open pretty late which is awesome when I need an ice cream fix.

I'm a huge fan of this place as it is just a block away from my apartment (which is a little dangerous). My SO and I come here most nights during the warmer months to grab a glass bottle of Coke and sit outside.  Sometimes it can be a little hard to grab a table because they fill up fast. Also, when it's warm outside I would advise to stay away on Friday, Saturday and Sunday evenings. The place gets so crowded it probably takes about 20 minutes to get an ice cream cone. I'm not saying it's not worth a 20 minute wait, because it is (especially the strawberry, cappuccino yogurt and lakeview barhopper) but it's a little pricey for the wait. I think $5 for a milkshake is a bit much, but I definitly willing to purchase one here! Also on Tuesdays and Thursdays they offer milkshakes for $2.50!

If you're a fan of old fashioned, home made ice cream, chances are you'll love Bobtail. Their specialty flavours are well worth trying, in fact, my friend and I stopped here three times when we visited. They also have shakes and coffee drinks so if you're not an ice cream eater, you can try those instead. I tried the Cubbie Crunch, Sunset (something or other - it had Merlot and Chocolate Chips in it) and the Barhopper. All were quite tasty. They also give you a heaping scoop which makes it worthwhile. The prices were a little high, but it's worth trying at least once. I'm glad I don't live close to there or I'd probably gain a ton of weight eating there.

Very delicious ice cream! I had the chocolate liquor ice cream. I couldn't really taste the liquor too strongly at all, but had I not known it was in there, I still would have thought the chocolate tasted a bit different in a unique way. I appreciated how the flavor was unique without walloping you over the head with "hey I have alcohol in me!"! So, teenagers looking for a legal buzz can move on to a different flavor. But for a sweet ice cream fix, this place is fine.

Maybe the best ice cream milk shake i've ever had! and that's a lot to say because I've tried a LOT.  I've been meaning to try this place for 3 years and I finally went tonight (darn I've missed out on so many great shake memories :*(  Super affordable prices, a great deal at $4 I feel. What I had:  Pumpkin ice cream with Chai milk shake... HEAVEN. like eating/drinking a fresh pie while drinking chai and eating ice cream.. or something. The house specialty ice creams are also amazing: White chocolate + macadamia... rawr, and the merlot ice cream

Cute ice cream shop and very yummy ice cream.  They have mostly standard flavors, with a few interesting ones mixed in (i.e., merlot chocolate chip, which really tastes like merlot...weird...) I had the peanut butter chip, which was very good.  nice, not too heavy peanut butter ice cream with chunks of chocolate that are shaped like the wavy edges of a reese's peanut butter cup mixed in.  Soooo good!

On my way to dinner I passed Bobtail, since I was already running late I thought it better not to have a pre-dinner treat. After my mediocre dinner I decided that I deserved a treat and headed back to Bobtail. The special flavor was chocolate mint Oreo. Since mint Oreo Blizzards are my favorite DQ treat I was all over it. I got it in a waffle cup and was on my merry way. The ice cream was very good and I got a lot of it for under $4. The ice cream has such a good flavor, they used flecks of chocolate and creme de menthe in it. I will definitely be back to try some of the other items on the menu.

Mmmmm.....what a treat! The ice cream here is fantastic and so creamy. Plus, it's an adorable throwback to an old-fashioned ice cream parlor. Order the mint chocolate chip and snag an outdoor table, and you'll feel 9 years old again.
The ice cream was great.  They have a tasty coffee shake.  They have coke bottles which always takes me back.  It was open late.  People were great!  Done and done.

What a tasty place to eat. A friend of mine thought some ice cream was what I needed to cheer up and, although it normally doesn't work, this just hit the spot. I realized that I've always enjoyed the ice cream. The Daley Addiction is especially good and if they have it when you go in I highly recommend that you give it a try! Another big plus is that they carry pop from Goose Island which is made from real sugar instead of high fructose corn syrup. It is so much better that way. Yum yums...

The prices are reasonable and the ice cream seems homemade (which is what they advertise). I ordered  a two scoop ice cream and was surprised at how huge the portions were.  The service was quick and friendly. It was a nice summer treat.

So I'm sitting outside Bobtail on a nice summer evening, eating ice cream with a friend, when a total stranger walks up to me and says, "It looks like the last thing you need is ice cream!" Thanks dickwad. No, it wasn't Matt L. The peanut butter chip ice cream was good enough that they still get 4 stars. Special thanks to the nice white-haired grandmother sitting next to me who asked it I knew the guy, and when I said I didn't, replied, "What an asshole!" No, it wasn't Matt L.

Just an amazing place to grab ice cream at. They are very tolerant, friendly and the atmoshpere is awesome. You can hang out in here and study, play board games, or just chill out and people watch. I'm a fan of all the above..which is why i'm a fan of bobtail. Oh yea..the ice cream is really good, too.

I love this place so much I visited twice in one day. While the same people were on shift. It was embarrassing. Enough said. Try the Merlot and the Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip. Bonus:  cute shop with high tables and fun board games. I wish I lived closer!

Great simple little ice cream and pie shop.  Such a staple of the neighborhood.  Cute inside and out, I love people watching on the benches right outside.  Actually, I've never sat down inside, because its so small.   My favorite is the peanut butter ice cream, and much to my detriment they sell it in to-go pints.  There isn't a lot of variety, but everything is classic and tasty.   They're always really nice there, even when there's a line out the door.  It's a quaint way to wind down a summer night, for sure.

Cute little old-fashioned ice cream shop.  I usually get a kids scoop sugar cone.  They have a couple tables inside with some board games to play if you are going to stay awhile.  I've always sat at the outdoor tables.  The root beer floats are good as well, but you can't really screw up a root beer float if you try.  They have coffee drinks and hot chocolate too for the fall and winter.  They have your standard flavors along with a Merlot ice cream that is always there and then two special flavors that they frequently switch up to fit the season.  I love the pumpkin ice cream around Halloween- it is delicious! Only downside, kind of pricey for ice cream.

My first experience with Bobtail was admittedly strange. Josh K. and walked over on a sticky evening looking for a cool treat, and when we stepped inside, we were shocked to find that it was about twice as hot inside the shoppe! The cute cashier explained that the AC was out and that the ice cream freezers were doing a nice job of heating up the place.  Needless to say, we got our ice cream and got out of there as fast as possible! Although my "dirt" (vanilla ice cream with oreo bits and gummy worms) ferociously busted through my cone and dripped on my cute dress, it was still great, and the outdoor seating was a perfect escape from the overly warm shop!

My first time at Bobtails on Broadway involved me stumbling upon it while I was walking around killing time waiting for the Wolfe Camera up the street to finish printing some of my photographs. They have a simple selection of ice cream and several choices of cones. I had a 2 scooper...which with the cone ran about $4 and change.  Folks were nice, engaging and they also take credit cards. Once you get your ice cream I'd recommend heading out to the bench closest to the door on the left.  It gives you a 180+ degree view of the streets and affords you some great people watching!!! (just don't for get your sunglasses *wink). When you are all finished, head back in and get a free cup of water to wash it all down.  A great summer time past time.......eating ice cream.

Who doesn't love ice cream?  I've been to this location several times for ice cream cones on my way to the Landmark or Borders.  I love their Espresso Cream and Winter Commute (white chocolate ice cream with macadamia nuts).  Milkshakes aren't very thick, though, so stick to the cones, splits, and sundaes.  They also offer Intelligentsia coffee, spiced apple cider, and hot chocolate to keep you warm in the winter.  It's a small location, with few seats indoors, so your best bet is to take your ice cream to-go.

I like this place a lot.  The ice cream is really good and I love the atmosphere.  You can either sit outside and enjoy a nice day, or you can sit inside and play board games. My bf and I always come here and play connect four.  I am getting better, but he normally beats me.  I love the espresso milk shake.  It's freshly brewed espresso and vanilla ice cream...so good!

Awww I loooove this place! What great seasonal specials!!  RIGHT NOW IN JUNE/JULY DIRT-chocolate ice cream with gummi worms and crushed Oreos...your original take on the dirt pudding you had when you were a kid.  Also, Lakeview Barhopper is an all season favorite. Includes a bit of alcohol to give chocolate a spin! Such a cute shop, and everyone is always in there, even during the winter! They have pretty good hours which is nice for a late night sweet cold treat.

As the ones who know me best know... I ::heart::: ice cream, and this place is definitely a keeper!! What I like best is the unique flavors they offer. The Merlot with chocolate chunk is very fresh, and different. My next try is the one with Jack Daniels in it (cant go wrong with Jack!!) Even tho they have flavors you wont see anywhere else, don't skip over the staples!! Their Madagascar Vanilla is out of this world...ouh yes! I love their little outdoor area to just hang out in, and the old time soda shop feel inside. Great desert place indeed!

Bobtail has excellent home made ice cream for those who can appreciate the creamy less processed flavor. During my last visit, I had a delicious combo of white chocolate macadamia nut ice cream in an almond cone. Apparently I was craving nuts that day. (Ha that's what she said!) I like the old time ice cream parlor feel here. When I ordered my cone, I only specified my ice cream flavor and cone type. As the gentleman behind the counter began heaping mounds of ice cream and I skeptically asked "Is that a scoop?" He shrugged and said "It is today." Friendly service, good ice cream, and great people watching (if you can snag a spot by the window) makes this place a great place to stop on a Saturday stroll.

Interesting flavors I got the Lakeview Barhopper in it as a 'steamer' which is an interesting drink, a scoop of ice cream steamed with milk. I have to say that it's good but not great, maybe homemade ice cream doesn't explode as much since there isn't as much artificial crap that big chains have but it's still kind of bland, but that's just me and when I walk into homemade ice cream places I expect that, which bumps it up to four stars.

The service is unbelievable here.  There's a guy who works the early shift here, and we seem to always see him.  He's always happy to have a conversation and help us pick a flavor. I'm also a sucker for oldies music. Hoorah for tasty, original ice cream.  Recently they had Thin Mint and I thought I had died and gone to heaven.  Their iced tea is also very good and cheap.  Yes, I miss the grilled cheese and the breakfast sandwiches too, but I totally understand why they got rid of them.

bobtail ice cream is oh so good, but my favorite thing to have there was a grilled cheese. I know i'm a weirdo for going to the ice cream place for lunch, but it was tasty with a chocolate shake. They then took it off the menu, and one hot summer day, i was very sad. Get back the lunch stuff, and they are 5 stars in my eyes
Fantastic. The ice cream is very rich and they're actually creative w/ steamer and coffee drinks so it's great in the winer too.

Oh Bobtail. You and your sneaky non-green Mint Chip ice cream. You have won me over. Turns out the green isn't natural and is a dye. I guess I should have known this, but of course seeing non-green Mint Chip blew me away, so I got a little dish of it and oy. So so so good. It tasted natural and delicious, the perfect amount of mint-chip balance. There with several other people, I also tasted some other ice cream flavors, including the chai, which was so strange since chai is the kind of thing you drink, not eat! It was surprisingly delicious. I also tried the Merlot chip ice cream (I forget the name) and wow was it crazy to have wine-inspired ice cream, but so good! And I don't even care for wine :) The two counter girls were helpful, friendly, and even detailed that they might be going organic. I know, I know. Things might get more expensive, folks, but come on! Organic deliciousness!? You can't complain about that.  I highly recommend Bobtail for all of your ice cream pleasures. And for a good pre-cream treat, give Crisp, across the street, a go!

Let's put it this way - if you can walk in from a 10 degrees winter's night and still enjoy your ice cream, that place is a keeper. This is such a place. Old school 1950's soda shop designed interior w/ a touch of doo-wop on the sound system compliment the excellent ice cream and service that is found inside. A friend of mine had her ice cream topped w/ caramel and marshmallow sauce and a small taste of that is still keeping me wired right now. Go get some, immediately.

Friendliest ice cream shop around. I love the old fashioned vibe of this store and the ice cream is delicious.  The staff is always upbeat and patient as I usually take a while to decide which flavor I want.  They have a bunch of fun flavors of ice cream that have Chicago related names and their brownie sundaes are to die for.  The best part is the REAL super thick hot fudge.  This may be the thing that keeps bringing me back! Only downside is is get PACKED in the summer (line outside of the door kind of packed).. but it's an ice cream shop in the summer so I deal and enjoy!

I LOVE this place. It's this cute little neighborhood spot. I used to live really close by and they would have different specials pretty much every day of the week. The shakes are thick and awesome! The real find was the grilled cheese though. This tasty sandwich has the perfect bread to cheese ratio. The thing that really makes it awesome is that they use sourdough bread. It's either Saturday or Sunday when they have the grilled cheese and milk shake special for like $5. They also have all sorts of creative ice creams and they are wonderful on a hot summer day. Oh I miss you, Bobtail...

When Zephyr closed, my husband and I searched for a great ice cream place and I came across...Bobtail. What a find. It's really, really damn good ice cream and shakes and are willing to do just about anything. they have some really unique flavors like the merlot ice cream which is to die for! I know it sounds weird, but it was really, really good. I have always had great service here and it is just a fun place to go to since it has the old school soda shop feel to it.

Bobtail was started by two University of Chicago GSB folks (I'm glad to see those UOC guys have skills in more than just economics! ;) to mimic old fashioned ice cream parlors. The place serves a sumptuous mix of ice cream cones, floats, shakes, sundaes, etc. And true to its origins, Bobtail delivers a unique mix of Chicago flavors, from Lakeview Barhopper to Cubby Crunch, along with more normal staples like Vanilla and strawberry. It's also open open late with nice park benches outside to people watch while enjoying the ice cream. Happily, it's not overpriced for the solid quality, unlike more numerous Cold Stones. I'm a happy returnee and regular attender.

Bobtail has some of the yummiest chocolate shakes I have ever tasted and their whipped cream is to die for...unfortunately or fortunately...however you want to look at it I live right down the street from this amazing ice cream parlor!!!  My diet shall be tested!!!  The place also offers speciality coffee for all you coffee lovers and they have free Wi-Fi internet!!!  Everyone is really laid back and you don't get that stuck up vibe that tends to hang around the Starbucks Crowd.

Bobtail is a great neighborhood ice cream shop.  I love the peanut butter chip and the cookies n' cream flavors as well as the yummy peanut butter sauce.  Actually, the peanut butter sauce is my main reason for coming here, it's even better than my favorite East Coast ice cream chain, Friendly's.  I can't give this place 5 stars though because it's too expensive.

You've got to try the Lakeview Barhopper ice cream, rich chocolate with bourbon, it's my favorite! Bobtail's Butter Pecan is the best I have had in years. Service is usually pretty good and they have Intelligentsia coffee too.

I used to live right down the street from here and really loved their ice cream.  They also serve Intelligentsia coffee, which is a nice bonus;)  I recommend the Coffee Milkshake (although it has a special name...but it's awesome, they throw a shot of espresso in there), and I love the mint chip ice cream in the oreo cone. It's quite darling, the service is friendly and they have some great specials ($2.50 milkshakes on Thursday, I think!!!)

Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum. I like ice cream. Bobtail is an excellent place to go for a cone.  Their dipped waffle cones are very tasty, and so is the ice cream.  My favorite is the Espresso flavored ice cream in a dipped (with sprinkles) waffle cone.  They have other fun flavors, like the one inspired by the CPD - coffee ice cream with donut chunks.  Yowza! The stuff just tastes good.  Plus, it isn't super hard packed, so it doesn't hurt my teeth.  I like it a little bit soft. 1 star deducted for 3 reasons:  (a) Super crummy root beer floats.  1 can of MUG root beer and 1 scrawny scoop of vanilla does not constitute a root beer float. (b) It can be pretty pricey.  I saw some guy with his family (3 kids plus 4 adults) drop $38.  Not even kidding. (c) Smarmy kids working behind the counter.  Don't get me wrong.  Most of them are just fine...but the smarmy ones really boil my blood.  Hey kid - just get me the damn cone and leave the editorializing for someone who gives a hoot. Recommended if you are in the hood.

I have yet to be disappointed with any of the eclectic flavors at this ice cream parlor. Although Bobtail is no longer a single-store operation it still feels like a unique, old-time soda fountain. Heck, even Margie's candies expanded! I'm not sure I buy the whole "family tradition" bent since one of the founders was a fraternity brother of mine, but really who cares when the ice cream is this good?

A friend recommended this place to me, so my boyfriend and I checked it out.  I got vanilla bean ice cream and he got the peach.  Both were really good.  The only complaint I have is that the seats were kind of torn up, and it was pretty warm inside.  But the ice cream was really good and the service was good too.

I like Bobtail, really I do... Their ice cream is excellent, smoothies fantastic and the place is cute to top it all off.  But it is often horrendously busy and too warm in the place.  There isn't an effective way for people to form a line since Bobtail is small, so the area in front of the ice cream cooler and the counter is like a zoo.  More so because people insist on having their entire party present at the counter even if just one person is doing the ordering. But with that being said they really do blow ColdStone out of the water.  If you want ice cream, this is the place to come.  Just...  Try to step over the unattended children and weave around the vacant eyed customers and you'll be alright.

I was walking past Bobtail's and decided to check it out. I've been there twice so far and have never been disappointed. I've tried out their strawberry smoothies and the Daley addiction ice cream (which is to die for) and would recommend it to anyone on these hot, humid summer days! It's definately a treat!

I dared to complain about paying $3+ for a scoop of ice cream.  It was pointed out that I regularly pay more for a single beer.  Realizing how much more I enjoy ice cream, I now opt for 10 scoop sundaes from Bobtail over consuming the same quantity in liquid refreshment. **$2.50 milkshakes on Tuesdays and Thursdays**

Great homemade icecream shop. Some of their icecream flavors are Chicago themed like Daley Addiction and Winter Commute and they featured Guinness flavored icecream during march for St. Patrick's day. They serve Intelligentsia coffee and offer free wireless internet access. It is markedly hot inside during summertime and the staff is sometimes grumpy- which I blame on the heat factor.

Cute Ice Cream shop. I'm more into soft serve but we checked out Bobtail this past weekend and I ordered a Root Beer Float. It was pretty tasty...but seriously who can mess up a Root Beer Float? Anyhow...I live just down the block from Bobtail now so I can see myself coming here and sitting in their outdoor patio sipping on a Root Beer Float or even a shake many times this summer.

The decor is really refreshing (ironically, since it's old-school), and the ice cream is great.  Their flavors are really creative, and their milkshakes, even though a bit runny, are delicious.  I can't wait to try their sundaes, especially with the peanut butter sauce someone mentioned on here.

Super-fresh ice cream with flavors that taste real and are not overly sweet. Their PBB&J (peanut butter, banana and jelly) sounds gross but take a taste -- you'll be surprised by how creamy and lightly nutty the ice cream is, and then the streaks of jelly are heavenly! I love that they are a local place and also that they do free cone afternoons on Saturdays to raise money for local schools and charities.

Peanut butter, jelly, and banana ice cream. Amazing. Merlot ice cream with chocolate chips. Amazing. Plus, you can't beat the oldies playing in the background and the friendly staff. One star docked for the ridiculously long line on warm, sunny days. Although, could it be because other people find this place well, amazing?

Definitely better than Coldstone.  I like Daley's Addiction. It's a cute little soda fountain - can get a bit crowded.  If you are in the neighorhood looking for a place to grab some homemade goodness, stop here!

Yum. Good ice cream. Not much else to say except that. Last night I had the peanut butter oreo...oh yeah! The cappuccino yogurt is yummy, too.  They have waffle cones that are dipped in chocolate, oreos, sprinkles, etc. It's a good little spot to hit when it's warm and you want some ice cream.

Props for it being a locally owned business that is putting out good product.  It's nothing mind-blowing, but consistent. They've also got board games inside, and serve Intelligensia coffee, so it's got all the bases of a good chill out place covered.
The sundaes are SO good.  They actually have peanut butter sauce here!  One star off though because the employees are usually kinda surly.

I love this place in the summertime--the ice cream is divine. When I feel like being good (rarely happens), I like the mango sorbet.  I keep meaning to try their cold weather treats. I dig the old fashion setup also. Best thing? Free Wifi--yay!

Love this place.  Cabernet & chocolate ice cream?  A wine lover couldn't ask for better!  Great original flavors; although, a little MORE flavor wouldn't hurt, thus the four stars.   Fun & old style soda shop.

I needed some ice cream therapy to soothe a slowly breaking heart, so my roommate suggested that we venture into Bobtail to cry and complain about boys. The banana split definitely cheered me up!  The staff is always super friendly and it's a great place to just relax and enjoy the old-school feel of the place!   The added bonus is when you can score a seat outside and witness all the craziness that happens up and down Broadway.  Check it out sometime!

Ok, lets be honest, can you really go wrong when ice cream is involved. Bobtail is a cute little ice cream parlor that sits on the corner of Broadway and Oakdale. I always pass by this place and wanted to try but there was always such a long line that I didn't want to wait. Finally my friend and I visited this place. I got the chocolate and espresso ice cream. I will have to say the espresso was my favorite. My friend got their sunset ice cream which was merlot flavored with chocolate chips. That was also very good. If you are in the neighborhood and you are sick of Cold Stone or Dairy Queen, check out Bobtail!

There's nothing better in the summer than clear skies, the warm sun on your face, and a nice scoop of ice cream to cool your belly (no, it's for eating silly!).  Bobtail has a pretty good list of flavors making it kind of hard to decide exactly what to get - I ended up with chocolate bourbon.  Tasty for sure!  The only reason I took a star off was the cashier got a bit snippy.  She asked me how many scoops (first of all isn't it already obvious looking at my cone?... it's not like I can wolf it down in the 2ft distance from the scooper to the cashier)... well anyway she proceeded to punch in my order and I saw "extra scoop" on the display.  I then reiterated I had one scoop to which she snidely answered "I know what one means."  Well apparently you don't know what "extra" means!  But, snippy cashier aside, the ice cream was good and there was seating outside to avoid said cashier.  Still good experience in my book... I'll just remember to take it to go from now on.
I rarely venture from the Sunset ice cream - merlot flavored with chocolate chips, but it's good stuff. Cute place, fun location, decent ice cream.

This place makes Coldstone look like a poser for true ice cream making.  There is nothing better than visiting an old-style soda fountain that serves homemade ice cream titled 'Lakeview Barhopper' and 'Daley Addiction.'  Although it may not have a ton of flavors, it makes up for variety with charm and a knack for making a fantastic sundae, with whatever toppings your heart desires.

I love this place!! I'm new to chicago, and it's just down the street so I decided to try it. First of all the mint hot chocolate is amazing!! it tastes like mint chocolate chip ice cream, but hot chocolate, so good!! I love their hot chocolates...and the staff and owners are very friendly, very nice,  and very helpful. One person drew me a map :)
A very cute place with an old time feel.  Along with a traditional selection of ice cream, they also serve coffee and tea.

This is an awesome ice cream shop. Great homemade ice cream with an old time soda fountain feel. The shake that I had was really good-pumpkin, how festive.  They have all of the standards, ice cream, shakes, cakes and they also serve some food, breakfast stuff and grilled cheese for lunch. The only way to make it better would be if the people working there acted just a bit interested in their jobs. The tmes I have gone in I almost felt like I was bothering them. Otherwise, a great place.
Good place to spend some time chatting without drinking involved.  The downside is that the ice cream is fairly average.  The sundaes are ok, but I'd stay away from the shakes.

Cute looking and inviting, but the compliments stop there.  I mean they try and be inventive and the flavors sound delicious -- merlot ice cream with chocolate chips.  The only problem is these wonderful flavors --- ARE JUST NOT FLAVORFUL.

This is a great ice cream soda fountain. They have some of the best flavors I have ever tasted and, and they always make a unique flavor of the day. Also they have great daily specials like $2.50 milkshakes on tuesdays, and an ice cream happy hour from 5-7 daily with $1.50 scoops!
Good icecream and friendly staff. A great cozy neighborhood atmosphere with outdoor seating.  They also have daily specials which are hard to pass up!

Bobtail may not have the best home made ice cream I've ever tasted -- that's a tie between Grand Ol' Creamery in St. Paul, MN and Sebastian Joe's in Minneapolis (that may be nostalgia talking though). However, it is the best I've had in Chicago. Once upon a time there were no homemade ice cream shops in Chicago. Now there are several, but few are all that great. Bobtail to the rescue! Their two most creative flavors are Lakeview Bourbon Barhopper and Merlot Signature Sunset *tonguegasm*. While they do have two additional specialty flavors per season (peach and mango sorbet in the summer), I would like to see them apply their talents to adding a few more flavors to their selection. But then that's just me being greedy. Check out their web site ( bobtailsodafountain.com ) for the story behind the family-owned business. They also offer drinks, sundaes, fondue, cake, pie, and grilled cheese and peanut butter & jelly sandwiches. Yay!

Their peach ice cream is a must try! I'm a total chocolate ice cream freak, but their peach ice cream makes me put chocolate to the side. This place is really nicely decorated and their ice cream is great. Add one of their fresh baked waffle cones to your ice cream and you'll be happy you made your way to this great little ice cream shop!

Oh, but it's just so cute! That's the feeling you have after licking down an ice cream cone at Lakeview's newest ice cream eatery, Bobtail. A perfect place to bring a date after dinner or a movie, Bobtail has the magical cheeriness of the easter bunny or sugar plum fairies (and there are no shortage of fairies at this place). Because Bobtail gets most of its business in summer season, many of its employees are young kids so don't make your order complicated. I ordered a milkshake one time and the kid looked frightened and gave me something that tasted like the leftover milk after a bowl of cocoa puffs.  Just be simple, get an ice cream cone and enjoy the atmosphere.

I love this place - so convenient and Tuesdays, they have these $2.50 milkshakes and their low carb shakes are yummy!  Also - try the mango sorbet or Daley Addiction!  For the winter season - definately try the eggnog or peppermint and the cake batter is delish, too!

I ordered a shake.  Is that so hard to do?  Put the ice cream in and mix it up with milk, pour in a cup and toss some whipped cream on top.  I had been so excited for my chocolate peanut butter shake all day.  One sip in and I threw it in the garbage out of pure frustration.  Not only was my shake runny and luke warm (how that's possible is beyond me), it had cost me about $4.00!  In the end, Bobtail got two stars because my friends seem to love their hard ice cream.  What can I say?  I'm generous.
